title: Deliver a UK Kyoto Protocol Registry
description: To deliver a UK Kyoto Protocol Registry. This is a two-phase IT project: firstly, to provide and implement an interim National Kyoto Protocol Registry IT system for the UK; and, secondly to host, maintain and support such software.  Please see the ITT linked to this notice for further information.
buyer: Department for Business Energy and Industrial Strategy

title: Refugee Resettlement Support Services for Lincolnshire
description: City of Lincoln, North Kesteven District, South Holland District and South Kesteven District Councils have accepted Syrian refugee families within their authority areas. The Councils are seeking to enter into contract with a suitable Supplier for the provision of Refugee Resettlement Support Services which includes (but is not limited to): (1) Welcoming new arrivals at the airport and providing welcome packs on arrival at the airport and the accommodation (2) Liaising with the Authority to deliver the Biometric Residence Permits following arrival (3) Developing and auctioning support plans for the families and individuals (4) Providing a dedicated source of advice, guidance, information, signposting, support and advocacy (5) Managing the expectations of the family to ensure they do not become reliant on either the local Authority or the Support Worker (6) Visiting families and accompanying them to appointments, drop in / training sessions, etc., in order to: (a) Assist with registering for benefits and services and signposting to other advice, information and agencies (b) Register with local nurseries, schools or colleges, English Language and Literacy classes and other appropriate training (c) Register with local GP's and other healthcare providers in line with any identified medical or mental health needs (d) Attend local Job Centre Plus appointments for benefit assessments and access to employment (e) Help with opening a bank account - ensuring people know their rights and are able to manage their finances (f) Where required, help with understanding tenancy agreements and addressing any problems (some Authorities may wish to provide this element themselves) (g) Help set up accounts for utilities (h) Show them around their new local area, helping them get to grips with public transport, buy familiar food, find their local library, places of worship and other community facilities and volunteering opportunities (i) Support with budgeting, wellbeing, skills development and employment readiness (j) Take active steps to reduce isolation, ensure integration and connecting people to their communities and encouraging local support networks (k) Help local communities and services to become refugee-friendly (l) Develop support plans for families and individuals (m) Help with asylum and immigration issues (7) Ensuring / confirming that other agencies interacting with the refugee have made telephone interpretation services available for appointments, etc. (8) Provide updates on the progress of families and individuals to the local Authority  Further information is available via the ProContract system https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=d3325d7a-e232-ea11-80fc-005056b64545

Literacy classes and other appropriate training (c) Register with local GP's and other healthcare providers in line with any identified medical or mental health needs (d) Attend local Job Centre Plus with understanding tenancy agreements and addressing any problems (some Authorities may wish to provide this element themselves) (g) Help set up accounts for utilities (h) Show them around their new local area, helping them get to grips with public transport, buy familiar food, find their local library, places of worship and other community facilities and volunteering opportunities (i) Support with budgeting, wellbeing, skills development and employment readiness (j) Take active steps to reduce isolation, ensure integration and connecting people to their communities and encouraging local support networks (k) Help local communities and services to become refugee-friendly (l) Develop support plans for families and individuals (m) Help with asylum and immigration issues (7) Ensuring / confirming that other agencies interacting with the refugee have made telephone interpretation services available for appointments, etc. (8) Provide updates on the progress of families and individuals title: Mobile Voice and Data Services Contract
Artificial Intelligence-Powered Content Curation and Self-Assessment Education Tool
description:
Background

The way learners access education is changing and increasingly incorporates learning from third-party websites and systems, not just those provided to them via HEE's own platforms and systems. However, finding the best and most appropriate resources can be difficult.

HEE is committed to the building of a digital ready workforce that can use technology effectively to support individuals and patients with their health and care in the present and as new technologies emerge in the future. To benchmark and develop these digital capabilities, it is necessary to assess the current levels of digital literacy in the health and care workforce.

The objective of this project is to develop and pilot a tool that will allow users to diagnose capability gaps according to HEE's digital capabilities framework, making recommendations of learning resources based on the gaps, and then enable participants to re-assess their abilities based on what they have learned, using artificial intelligence to tag and identify resources.

Scope of Contract

We are seeking a partner to work with us and provide a method of assessing an individual's capabilities against the HEE digital literacy framework and making personalised recommendations from our existing catalogue of content and third-party curated content.

title: Cleaning Services (AH-235) - AWARD
description:
This procurement is for the provision of cleaning services and window cleaning within the North Somerset and surrounding areas. This procurement relates to services largely to be provided in the North Somerset area but could also include the following areas: Bristol, South Gloucestershire, Bath and North East Somerset, Sedgemoor local / unitary authority areas and also in the Swindon area (such as SN1 to SN5, SN25 and SN26 postcodes). Any such increase would be at the agreement of both parties.  
      
      The services covered by this procurement exercise have been subdivided into 3 lots as follows:
      LOT 1 - Cleaning - communal areas, sheltered schemes, office cleaning and external window cleaning
      LOT 2 - Cleaning - void properties
      LOT 3 - Cleaning - Tamar Court
      Tenderers may tender for one, several or all lots. 
      
      The duration of the contract for each lot is 3 years with the potential to extend for 2 additional 12 month periods (up to a total of 5 years). AHG intends to award the contracts on 4th February 2020 to go live on 1st April 2020

title: Taxonomy Indexer, Data Connector and Search Service Provision
description:
Background

The way learners access education is changing and increasingly incorporates learning from third-party websites and systems, not just those provided to them via HEE's own platforms and systems. Many of those systems contain poorly structured data that needs indexing, enriching and aggregating so that it can be searchable through HEE's websites.

The TEL programme is in the process of developing a new learning product for everyone working in health and care in the UK. The Learning Hub will be a powerful new digital platform that will provide easy access to a wide range of education and training resources for the health and care workforce.

The Learning Hub will be the place to go to access and record learning from a broad range of shareable resources, including existing e-Learning for Healthcare (e-LfH) programmes, and resources contributed and uploaded from the user community. The Learning Hub will also encourage discussions to take place around the uploaded learning content and networks to form around areas of shared interest to maximise the opportunities for collaboration and realise the potential of the resources.

HEE have invested in the implementation and development of a taxonomy management system (Pool Party) and have developed a range of taxonomies and knowledge graphs. Currently, search is provided through the Open-source Elastic search tool. However, connecting these to a search tool in the Learning Hub and making the most of indexing our extensive range of learning resources has proved difficult and we have yet to maximise the value from the taxonomy investment and development.

Scope of Contract

We are seeking a partner to work with us and provide a method of connecting our Pool Party instance to the Learning Hub and other HEE systems through a taxonomy and resource indexer, data connector and search service provision, so that it becomes more than just a simple index and search bar.

All software needs to be hosted on-premise through HEE's Azure instance.

title: Personalisation for Learner Motivation in Healthcare
description:
Background

The way learners access education is changing and increasingly incorporates learning from third-party websites and systems, not just those provided to them via HEE's own platforms and systems. However, finding the best and most appropriate resources can be difficult and as such personalised messaging to motivate learners has been a proven technique.

Research conducted by HEE with the University of Leeds explored the use of personalised nudges for learner motivation in healthcare, aiming to better support and motivate NHS staff when using e-learning resources. As part of the study two surveys were conducted with medical students at the University of Leeds. The initial results of using text-derived user characteristics for personalising nudges were promising, and the natural next step is to conduct a survey with staff at an NHS Trust, first analysing their personality and thinking styles from text samples using natural language processing and machine learning algorithms, then showing differing motivational messages to the learner.
Scope of Contract

We are seeking a higher education partner and/or SME in collaboration with a higher education partner to work with us and scale this work up so that we can test different motivational techniques with learners in an NHS workplace setting.

title: CPU 3652 Production of Immersive Experience for Robin Hood Gallery
description: As part of the Nottingham Castle Museum & Art Gallery project, we require a Contractor to deliver an immersive interactive experience for the new Robin Hood gallery.These will require strong editorial, high production values and seamless technical execution. We require a Contractor to deliver a series of AV assets - working with the Nottingham Castle team throughout pre-production, production, post-production and implementation to ensure the work meets the included brief and fulfils the broader aims. The scope of this contract includes: - Pre-production development, scripting and storyboarding of all elements - Opportunities for client input on the above - Full production and post-production work of all elements - Delivery of final high-quality assets in appropriate formats for AV material - Advice on implementation - Assistance with implementation - including ensuring AV syncing works seamlessly - Handover documentation/scripts - Staff training for those involved in delivering this experience - 12-month warranty support for final elements of interactive experience from the opening of the new exhibition.

title: Alternative Provision  Dynamic Purchasing System
description:
Doncaster Borough Council (The Council) is seeking to appoint a range of Contractors able to provide Alternative Provision for children and young people, aged 8-19 many who are not able to attend their usual school or setting many of whom have severe difficulties in managing their emotions and behaviour. The successful applicants must be able to appropriately meets the needs of pupils and enable them to achieve good educational attainment, which is aligned to that of their mainstream peers. The successful provider must also be able to supplement learning through the provision of a broad range of holistic interventions

The Council is proposing to appoint Contractors through the application of a modified Dynamic Purchasing System established under the Light touch Regime

The DPS will consist of 3 Lots:

Lot 1: Provision to promote engagement and/or reengagement to mainstream school
Lot 2: Provision to support Special Educational Needs and Disabilities
Lot 3: 5 day SEMH provision

Contractors are invited to apply for one, more than one, or all Lots.

The Dynamic Purchasing system for the supply of Alternative Provision will be initially 36 months in length, with two further optional 12 month extension periods, subject to the provision of available funding and the strategic priorities of the Council

title: Mid Sussex District Council - Pest Control Services
description:
The contract is to provide a pest control service to the residents of Mid Sussex District Council. The service shall be provided on a concession basis whereby all payments shall be made by the customer directly to the service provider. The pest control contract will cover at a minimum the treatment of infestations of rats, mice, fleas, wasps, bedbugs, cockroaches, food and textile pests and other pests as required across the district.
      
      The contract will last for a period of five years with the option to extend for an additional two years.

title: YPO - 001003 Windows and Doors
description: YPO are looking for Providers to be appointed onto a Framework Agreement for the provision of Windows and Doors. This Framework is designed to allow YPO to meet the needs of all public sector organisations by establishing an agreement where the end customer will place orders directly with the Provider on a "contract" basis and the Provider will deliver direct to the end customer on an agreed basis.

title: Selnet Ltd - Partnership Opportunity: Employability Skills Provision for Building Better Opportunities - Age of Opportunity Project (East Lancashire)
description:
Applications are invited from suitably qualified and experienced organisations to provide employability skills support to Age of Opportunity participants from specified Boroughs within Lancashire (Blackburn, Burnley, Hyndburn, Pendle, Rossendale).  Proposals are sought from organisations that can demonstrate competence in delivering relevant support to people aged over 50 with multiple and complex barriers into employment, training or education. The delivery partner will be expected to carry out a diagnostic assessment with potential participants to determine eligibility, suitability and need.  This will be followed by a comprehensive action plan to agree a course of action for the eligible participant, which will improve their lives and ultimately take them closer to work or learning.  The delivery partner will be the key contact and support provider for the participant and will also introduce the participant to a variety of specialist services should they be needed, some of which will be other BBO funded services. These specialist services may include, financial capability support, digital skills, volunteering, business start-up support, and emotional wellbeing help. 
The successful applicant will become an Age of Opportunity Delivery Partner and will sign the Partnership Agreement alongside current partners.

title: Medical Services for Events
description:
The City of Sunderland holds various events throughout each year which are hosted by the Council.  The events range from small half day events where a few hundred people attend to large multi-day events where thousands of people attend.  Some events are a one-off occurrence and others have been running for multiple years.  The Council may also introduce new events as need arises.  Most of the events hosted by the Council required medical services provision to be available on the site of the event for the whole time the event is being held.      The Service is divided into two Lots:

•	Lot 1 - First Aid Led Medical Services - This Lot will cover general events which will be events requiring first aid led medical services only.

•	Lot 2 - Emergency Medicine Doctor Led Medical Service - This Lot will cover large scale events which will require an Emergency Medicine Doctor led medical service.

title: Anti-Social Behaviour Partnership Case Management IT System
description: An Anti-Social Behaviour partnership case management IT system is required to provide a means to record incidents, share information, identify repeat vulnerable victims and perpetrators by locality. It must allow for a multi-agency approach to the management of cases. It should be capable of being used as a generic information and case management system as the partnership may, in the future, wish to extend usage to other areas, for example Integrated Offender Management and Domestic Abuse.

title: Home Support CQC Regulated Services - Manningham (Area 2) and Thackley
description:
Further to the award of the Home Support CQC Regulated Services Contracts earlier this year, the City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council has found it necessary to re-provision services in two specific Locality areas, and therefore seeks tenders from providers of Home Support services for personalised support and care to adults in the Manningham and Thackley areas.

The purpose of this contract will be the delivery of a range of personal care and domestic/community support services to individuals in their own homes and will cover support to older people and those with support needs relating to learning disabilities, mental health and/or physical disabilities

title: PQ0234 - European Social Fund Progression Pathway for Adults World of Work Project: Health & Social Care Sector Training  - AWARD
description:
Birmingham City Council requires a provider for the provision of Health and Social Care sector specific training to support the delivery of the WoW project objectives.  This contract requires the delivery of demand led health and social care training level to meet participant's needs on the WoW project. 
      
      Health and Social Care Sector Training: Demand led Health and Social Care sector specific training for unemployed or inactive WoW participants linked to employment opportunities within the health and social care sector, across all social care settings, including in residential care homes, primary care services, domiciliary care, day services and assisting supported living.
      
      This contract will deliver a flexible programme of training focussing on supporting unemployed and inactive participants into the health and social care sector across Birmingham and Solihull.  
      
      Training must be delivered in a number of accessible venues across Birmingham and Solihull where demand is identified. 
      
      The training provision must not duplicate/replace existing mainstream provision. 
      
      This contract will be for a period of 9 months commencing 01 December 2019 until 30 September 2020, subject to compliance and satisfactory performance. 
      
      Registration and use of in-tend is free. All correspondence for this procurement process must be via the in-tend correspondence function. If you are unable to register with in-tend please either email us at cps@birmingham.gov.uk or call 0121 464 8000. 
      
      If you are interested in tendering please click on the following link to access the Council's tender Portal:- https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register as a bidder. 
      
      Your completed quotation documentation should be returned by noon 12th November 2019 via the 'in-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

title: 7856 Dendrochronology - advanced continued professional development - AWARD
description:
Building future capacity by providing greater access to continuing professional development amongst heritage practitioners has been identified as a key objective in a wide range of recent policy documents. The current cohort of professional (archaeo)dendrochronologists on the UK mainland is rapidly aging and almost all such laboratories are small-sized enterprises. Thus future provision in the heritage sector is under threat. This project is a practical and inventive approach to resolving an imminent structural deficit in dendrochronological provision in the UK.
      
      The aim of this brief is to procure advanced professional training which will be provided by an appropriately experienced established (archaeo)dendrochronology laboratory to a small number of early career (archaeo)dendrochronologists using a series of buildings in Lincoln Cathedral precincts.

Contract for the preventative maintenance and reactive repair of catering equipment at the University of Bradford, from March 2020 - March 2021 with the option to extend annually up to March 2025.
      
      For more information about this opportunity, please visit the Delta eSourcing portal at: 
      https://neupc.delta-esourcing.com/tenders/UK-title/UMSHGENN96
      
      Please note that a site visit for Suppliers is being held at 11am on Tuesday 25th February. All Suppliers who are interested in submitting a tender are recommended to attend this visit. Details can be found in the ITT document, and Suppliers should confirm attendance via the Delta portal correspondence function.
      
      Tenders must be submitted electronically via the Delta portal no later than 12 noon Thursday 5th March 2020.

title: Impounding and Immobilisation-Related Services
description: : DVSA is responsible for road safety across the UK and has the powers to either impound or immobilise vehicles. DVSA requires a Supplier to provide services following impounding and immobilisation activity, such as (but not limited to) the collection of vehicle, storage of vehicle and the removal of immobilisation device.

title: UK-Birmingham: Legal services.
description:
CHIC is a consortium of Registered Providers registered under the Housing & Regeneration Act 2008. It is a registered company incorporated on 25th May 2010 under company number 07266506. It currently has around 90 members, although it should be noted that some of the members are groups of housing providers. Details of members can be found at http://www.chicltd.co.uk/.
      The Members intend to appoint suppliers to each Lot capable of providing high-quality commercial and practical legal advice and assisting Members to reduce their legal spend. It is an objective of this tender that the Members will achieve better value, enhanced service delivery and more efficient management of matters outsourced to external solicitors.

title: WSCC Hospital Discharge Care Service - AWARD
description:
A Contract for the provision of a Hospital Discharge Care Service is being tendered by West Sussex County Council. Full details of the services can be found in Document 02 the Service Specification.
      
      The Council has scheduled a Bidders' Briefing session as detailed below. 
      
      All Bidders are recommended to attend; however, attendance is optional. The presentation and any questions and responses provided on the day will be uploaded to the e-Sourcing portal once the session is complete.
      
      BIDDER'S BRIEFING
      Date: Wednesday 6th November 2019
      Time: Please note that the event will start promptly at 2pm
      Location: Committee Room 3, County Hall.
      Bidders are asked to report to Main Reception, County Hall, West Street, Chichester, PO19 1RG where they will be met by a member of the team.
      Please note there is no on-site parking available. Local parking information can be found at https://www.chichester.gov.uk/parking
      Content: 
      o Overview of the requirements
      o Explanation of the process
      o Q & A
      o Using the WSCC e-Sourcing Portal
      RSVP: Please send a message on the e-Sourcing Portal by Tuesday 5th November 2019 and advise who from your organisation will be attending.

title: PQ0239 - Technical PFI capital projects contract management
description:
The Council requires a supplier for the provision of Technical PFI capital projects contract management services.
      
      Birmingham City Council (BCC) has 4 PFI schools contracts incorporating 28 Schools/Academies.  The contracts relate to design, build, finance and operate contractual agreements and are in place for between 25 to 35 years from commissioning:
      
      - PPP1 - Birmingham Schools Partnership Limited - contract was signed in February 2000 and there are circa 15 years remaining of the operate phase.
      - PPP2 - Transform Schools - contract was signed in March 2006 and there are circa 16 years remaining of the operate phase. 
      - BSF Phase 1a - Birmingham Lend Lease Partnership (BLLP) - contracts were signed in August 2009 and there are 19 years remaining of the operate phase.
      - BSF Phase 1b - Birmingham Lend Lease Partnership (BLLP) - contracts were signed in August 2011 and there are 18 years remaining of the operate phase.
      
      The proposed commission is to provide Birmingham City Council (BCC) with technical and contractual advice and, where required, project management support, relating to the need to adapt, develop and / or construct School estate to meet the increasing requirement for school pupil placements across a number of the PFI sites. 
      
      There is a requirement to: 
      
      - Prioritisation and evaluation of projects including ongoing live activities and PFI negotiations.
      - Analysis of impact on the PFI including maximising the effectiveness of the sites
      - Following detailed review with Schools, BCC and SPV, submittal of variations in line with contract and project requirements 
      - Interrogate, respond to and close out any SPV, SPV Lawyers, Funders Representatives and Sub-contractors' correspondence
      - Undertake financial and contractual evaluation around Conditions & Costs proposed by the SPV partners, as part of facilitation 
      - Represent and support BCC during negotiation with SPV and provide project Risk Assessments / Matrix for Contractor to work to
      - Delivery Phase - Facilitate works to be delivered in line with project requirements and costs; attend project meetings
      - Support BCC delivery vehicle, provide expert advice during Commissioning Period
      - Provide technical advice and negotiation to ensure PFI contractual integrity is captured and restored post completion.
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant quotation documentation.  
      
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site p...

title: GB-Lowestoft: DA- Artificial Sea Water System
description: The requirement is for a system for producing high quality artificial seawater with minimal staff input. 1.Water softening, dechlorination and RO production system to fill 200 L water holding and mixing tank for producing artificial seawater with ability to measure water quality (salinity, temperature and pH), plus 2x 200L circulating UV treated water storage tanks with taps.

title: Provision of Home to School Transport in the Kendal area (T5712)
description:
Tenders are invited for the provision of passenger transport services by taxi, minibus and/or coach in relation to Home to School in the Kendal area

The minimum number of seats required is 4 (No passenger assistant required)

You must refer to the "Instructions for Tendering" prior to submitting your bid. 

All submissions must be uploaded and returned via the Chest 

The documents that must be included in your submission are:
		
		Information and Declaration
		Tender Pricing Submission 
		Daily timetable template 

The deadline for submission is:

10:00 Wednesday 19 February 2020

title: Penair Group, comprising of Penair School, Tregolls School, Pool Academy and Camborne Science Academy
description: The Penair Group, comprising of Penair School, Tregolls School, Pool Academy and Camborne Science Academy,  are looking for a service provider to manage their cleaning services to Penair Group, providers must be able to demonstrate their capability to deliver the services via the documentation to be submitted, this service requirement will include the daily, weekly, monthly service requirements as well as managing TUPE process for the current staff.

title: Floor Coverings
description:
The North Eastern Universities Purchasing Consortia (NEUPC) are leading on a process to award a framework for floor coverings. The scope is to include primary and secondary entrance matting, carpet tile, broadloom carpet, roll vinyl, safety vinyl, acoustic vinyl, vinyl tile, linoleum, static control flooring, rubber flooring and laminate flooring. The framework is going to be available to all members of NEUPC, as well as all members of  LUPC, SUPC, HEPCW and NWUPC.
      
      The tender will be split into lots, with opportunities to bid for supply only or supply, fit & maintenance.

title: Employee Engagement
description:
The purpose of this procurement is to procure expertise and research to support CITB's programme of Employee Engagement from 2020 to 2024.
      It is anticipated that this research will take the form of initial survey design planning, with a full census employee survey undertaken every 6 months:
      
      •2020 - Initial survey design planning followed by 2x CITB census employee surveys - results from survey 1 available for end March 2020, results from survey 2 available for end August 2020
      •2021 - Dip survey for end March 2021, CITB census survey end August 2021
      •2022 - Dip survey for end March 2022, CITB census survey end August 2022
      •2023 - Dip survey for end March 2023, CITB census survey end August 2023
      •2024 - Dip survey for end March 2024, CITB census survey end August 2024

title: Hardie, Ogden & Webb
description:
Property Address's - Flats 1-8 Hardie House, Swift Road, Flats 1-24 Ogden House, Flats 1-16 Webb House, Swift Road, Hanworth, Feltham TW13

 Scaffolding for access, works to be carried out are window and door replacement and associated works.

 New PVCu window installation; new communal door and access control replacement; new canopy covering replacement liquid system to all canopies with 20-year guarantee; new mechanical extract ventilation to kitchens and bathrooms with new electrical spurs and certification; new rainwater goods; CCTV drainage surveys and external redecoration to all previously painted surfaces subject to survey. Provisional repairs subject to surveys for gulley replacement; concrete lintel repairs and fascia and soffit boards.

title: C17680 - Loadline Inspection and Docking - HMC Valiant
description:
Border Force (BF) is a Directorate of the Home Office. BF operate a fleet of five (5) Cutters. One of these Cutters, HMC Valiant (4207 Class), has a requirement for a period of dry docking to include; Loadline Inspection and some general maintenance.
The full package of works required is detailed in the attached Statement of Requirements (SoR) - C17680 - SoR - HMC Valiant - LLID - vf.
Following this sourcing exercise based on written quotation, this contract will commence on the 16th March 2020. Upon successful acceptance of HMC Valiant by the supplier, the work package is required to be undertaken between 16th March 2020 and 6th April 2020 in line with the Cutters' operational working pattern. 
It is a critical requirement that this package is to be undertaken in the following geographic area; 
1.	Europe (Eastern Mediterranean) - Pireas, Perama or Salamina, Greece.
Bidders are required to submit their written quotations in both .pdf and .docx formats.
The purpose of this notice is to make the SoR available to, and invite, potential suppliers to confirm they can fully meet the requirements by providing a fully itemised written quotation for the complete and specified work package. The quotation is to be submitted in currency, EURO.
Those potential suppliers are invited to send an email to; Ian McDermott, Home Office Commercial at Ian.Mcdermott@homeoffice.gov.uk , confirming their interest in this opportunity, providing the itemised quotation, in addition to confirmation of yard availability over the stated dates. Furthermore, confirmation of agreement to the Home Office Standard Short Form Services Terms and Conditions (C17680 - T&Cs - HMC Valiant - LLID) on which the contract will be awarded is required.
Quotations should also be accompanied by a Cardinal Date Plan (CDP) as stated in the SoR, section 5.6. All required documentation should be submitted via email to Ian McDermott, at the address above, no later than: 1200hrs GMT, Monday 2nd March 2020.

Furthermore, confirmation of agreement to the Home Office Standard Short Form Services Terms and Conditions (C17680 - T&Cs - HMC Valiant - LLID) on which the contract will be awarded is required.
Quotations should also be accompanied by a Cardinal Date Plan (CDP) as stated in the SoR, section 5.6. All required documentation should be submitted via email to Ian McDermott, at the address above, no later than: 1200hrs GMT, Monday 2nd March 2020.", "supplyChain": false, "hasEnquiries": null, "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2020-03-02T00:00:00Z"}, "awardCriteria": null, "submissionMethod": null, "xClassifications": {"isSuitableForSme": true, "isSuitableForVco": false, "ojeuContractType": "Services"}, "procurementMethod": "limited", "eligibilityCriteria": null, "awardCriteriaDetails": null, "submissionMethodDetails": "Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section.", "procurementMethodDetails": "Competitive quotation (non-OJEU)", "procurementMethodRationale": ""}, "language": "en-GB", "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "publishedDate": "2020-05-12T01:33:20.708493+00:00"}

title: Supply of Interim Call Off Printing Services for the UKHO
description: These are interim call off contracts arrangements for six months duration (with option to extend by up to a further six months), for printing and finishing services, for the UKHO. These contracts are being set up, as part of business critical strategies being put in place by the UKHO, following its previous key printing and supplier going into administration, in late 2019. These contracts are also being put in place to provide the UKHO with the period and opportunity to be able to re-compete the full publication printing, finishing and fulfilment services.

title: ITT: Ainley Salt Barn and Ancillary Works
description:
The project objectives for this commission are to: • Undertake works to construct the new Salt Barn with the Ainley Depot in readiness for 2020/2021 Winter Maintenance period (1st October 2020 - 30th April 2021). The works are, but not limited to: Site Clearance • Removal/recycling of existing concrete slab. • Isolation and removal of existing lighting columns. Salt Barn Building • All works in association with the design, supply, erection and commissioning of the new Salt Barn Building including all ancillary works including design and construction of;- retaining walls, foundations, concrete slab drainage connections, slot drain, ramped access, salt bund protection measures, above surface drainage, ducting, internal & external LED lighting and connections. We expect the value of this project to be within the region of £400,000 - £750,000.To view documentation please go to:

title: OG - Creative Design Agency Framework - PP989
description:
Orbit is seeking to appoint preferred suppliers by Lot to enter into a framework contract to provide Creative Design Agency Services across Orbit Group as specified in the accompanying documents. We seek service providers with the ability to transform our marketing and design briefs into innovative engagement which will help convey recognition of the Orbit brand. This will require any supplier to have knowledge of our audiences and customer base and how a Registered Social Housing Provider works. To meet the varied requirements Orbit is establishing a multi-provider framework agreement which will be divided into (3) three Lots as indicated follows:
•	Creative and conceptual design - Customer and Corporate Communication and Marketing 
•	Digital communication and marketing 
•	Creative Design and art working
This tender opportunity is being run via ProContract, suppliers can register for free at www.housingprocurement.com. All communication must be via this portal.

title: Luton Council Reablement and Care Plan Solution
description:
****  ADVERT HAS CEASED 24.4.20 DUE TO A OVERWHELMING RESPONSE  ****   RE MINI TENDER BELOW OJEU : Luton Council has a requirement to provide a mobile Reablement service to the community along with other services such as Extra Care. In outline: For Reablement this includes sending care workers to residents homes, servicing their care needs, updating records at the point of each visit, reallocating the repeat care requirement into a roster system, this will ensure that regardless of any resource issues the resident is always programmed to receive a visit from a carer and that up to date information of the persons care requirements including taking of prescribed drugs is always available to any member of the care team who have been allocated the work. This is an in-house service provision to Luton Council and as such it needs to operate as a business, therefore any solution providing tool to assist in the running of an efficient business will be considered.  The Reablement Service, part of Intermediate Care has a workforce of approx. 70 field based support workers, coordinated by a team of 11 office based employees.
Luton Council current solution for rostering and a care planning software tool is Staffplan with Iconnect providing the mobile handset solution. The current versions of both Staffplan and Iconnect are not only outdated with limited functionality but also lack the ability to integrate with other systems within LBC such as Liquid Logic and ITrent. Current solution user areas include the Reablement Team: 11 - office based / 80 mobile based (10 headroom) and the Extra Care Team: 4 - office based with a potential 24 mobile based (TBC - with head room).  The Extra Care staff team work in 3 separate courts where individuals that they support have their own flats within that building. The service is covered by staff 24/7 the carers work shift patterns of mornings, afternoons and waking night shifts. The teams make up about 17 carers per court with a maximum of 5 carers working on one shift. Extra Care staff visit residents in their own homes, deliver care tailored to the resident's needs, updating records on each visit, using a rostering system that plans residents visits

title: Energy Brokerage Services
description:
Procurement Assist Limited is seeking service providers to take part in tendering for a place on a 60 month Dynamic Purchasing System for Energy Brokerage Services.
      
      The DPS will be available for use by iFM Bolton and the whole public sector from across the United Kingdom.  The DPS initial application period is 30 days but will remain open until 31 May 2025.  Applications from service providers can be made at any time during this period.
      The DPS is intended to be a fast route to market for Clients, with Clients not needing any further engagement with OJEU procurement processes.
buyer: Procurement Assist Limited c/o Integrated Facilities Management Bolton Ltd (iFM Bolton)

title: GB-London: Understanding the barriers and enablers to applying rules and standards changes
description: This research aims to determine a clear rules assurance process and improve industry understanding of how the benefits of a rule change may be fully realised. It will facilitate consistent adoption of performance enabling rules across the industry. This project will focus on 3 rules changes that have been happened over the past 5 years  and when applied improve operational performance (emergency special working, high speed coasting, and contingency arrangements for GSM-R failures).

title: Telecommunications
description:
Procurement Assist Limited is seeking service providers to take part in tendering for a place on a 60 month Dynamic Purchasing System for Telecommunications Services.
      
      The services will be split into 4 Categories, as follows:
      
      Category 1: Mobile Telecommunications
      Category 2: Traditional Telephony and IP Telephony
      Category 3: Connectivity
      Category 4: Total Telecoms Solution
      
      The DPS will be available for use by iFM Bolton and the whole public sector from across the United Kingdom.  The DPS initial application period is 30 days but will remain open until 31 May 2025.  Applications from service providers can be made at any time during this period.
      The DPS is intended to be a fast route to market for Clients, with Clients not needing any further engagement with OJEU procurement processes.

title: 001023 - Educational Seating
description: YPO are looking for Providers to be appointed onto a Framework Agreement for the provision of Educational Seating incorporating Chairs, Stools and Fabric Swivel Student Chairs to cover multiple environments and classroom setting predominantly (but not limited to) within the educational environments. The Framework can also be utilised by the Private Sector. This Framework is designed to allow YPO to meet the needs of all public sector organisations by establishing an agreement for Providers to deliver to YPO customers on a direct basis whereby the end customer places the order with YPO and YPO places the order with the Provider, but the Provider delivers direct to the end customer.

title: CONSTRUCTION OF NEW SHORT BREAKS & SUPPORTED LIVING UNITS OFF CROPSTON DRIVE, COALVILLE, LEICESTERSHIRE
description:
To carry out the construction of a Short Breaks unit and supported living units at Cropston Drive, Coalville.  
The site is owned by Leicestershire County Council, currently the site is under contract for the demolition of 46-50 Smith Crescent and 98 Cropston Drive. 44 Smith Crescent is fully operational, and the service will transfer to the Short Breaks unit once occupied completed as part of phase 1 of the works. This tender will require demolition of 44 Smith Crescent.

title: Brighter Futures project final evaluation
description:
We are inviting applications from providers who are able to undertake a final evaluation of the Big lottery/ESF funded Brighter Futures project. Using methods in line with industry recommended best practice, by undertaking desk-based analyses of a wide variety of project evidence and conducting surveys and interviews with a representative sample of stakeholders, staff, participants, the provider will evaluate the project in terms of its performance, impact and value for money. The provider will be expected to present their findings in a written report that includes lessons learned and future recommendations. The provider will also disseminate their findings through social media and through a presentation given at one internal and one external stakeholder event. A full description of the requirements is included in the attached specification and questionnaire document which is also available at https://www.business2businesslimited.com/current-partnership-opportunities. If you are interested in supplying this provision, please complete the attached specification and questionnaire document and return to Rob Gray at rob@business2businesslimited.com by the submission deadline of 11.45pm on Friday 31st January 2020. 
      For all clarifications, please send written queries to rob@business2businesslimited.com. A response will be given within two working days of the query being raised. Within three working days of the query being made, the questions and answers document available at https://www.business2businesslimited.com/current-partnership-opportunities will be updated with an anonymised version of the query and the given response. The deadline for queries relating to this specification is 5pm on Thursday 23rd January 2020.
       
       Responses will be scored against fixed selection and award criteria. 
      
       The following selection criteria will be used:
      
      •	Organisational capacity
      •	Economic and financial standing
      •	Prior experience of service delivery
      
      Tenders that do not satisfy the above selection criteria will be de-selected from the procurement process.
      
      The following Most Economically Advantageous Tender (MEAT) award criteria will be used to score tenders that satisfy the selection criteria:
      
      •	Price 20%
      •	Merit of evaluation design 20%
      •	Quality of plans to engage project participants and stakeholders 20%
      •	Quality of the approach to be taken to calculating the social return on investment and local economic impact 20%
      •	Merit of planned approach to disseminating the evaluation findings 20%
      
      The highest scoring tender will be the winning tender. Only information supplied by tenderers in response to the questions will be taken into account during the scoring process.  
      
      Please note that additional information may be requested as part of our due diligence procedures. 
       
       Brighter Futures (https://www.business2businesslimited.com/brighterfutures) is a community-based project, which provides a wide range of learning and employment support interventions to support the holistic social inclusion of unemployed and economically inactive people aged 16+ within Leicester and Leicestershire. Delivered through a partnership of local organisations, the project is funded by the European Social Fund and the National Lottery, through the Big Lottery Fund. 
      The project began in December 2017 and was due to end in June 2020. However, a project extension granted by the Big Lottery and Leicester and Leicestershire LEP will enable the project to continue to meet the ongoing demand and need for support from local residents until Oct 2022.

title: Medium-Scale (£15k - £225k) Building & Refurbishment Works for Blackpool Housing Company Owned Properties
description:
Blackpool Housing Company (BHC) are looking to appoint around 12 Contractors on a framework to provide medium-scale building works and refurbishment work to Blackpool Housing Company properties. The Company has an existing arrangement for small-scale, low-value works up to £15,000 but this contract will cover larger jobs estimated at costing between £15k - £225k.  
This current round (issued February 2020) is to appoint 5 Contractors to fill spaces on the existing framework.  Details in the following link: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=033376ff-ed80-e711-80e4-005056b64545

title: Thames Tideway Tunnel - C405 Main Works West - Hammersmith Inlet Channel Benching FRC Works
description:
The Thames Tideway Tunnel project (the Project) will control CSO discharges by intercepting and diverting combined sewage flows into a new storage and transfer tunnel. The main tunnel will run from Acton Storm Tanks in west London to Abbey Mills Pumping Station in the east, where it will connect to the Lee Tunnel, which will transfer the combined sewage to Beckton Sewage Treatment Works for treatment. The Project extends from Acton Storm Tanks in west London, to Abbey Mills Pumping Station in east London. The Project includes associated works at Beckton STW, Shad Thames Pumping Station and Bekesbourne Street. 
    
    The geographic layout of the Project and local authorities through which it passes is shown in Figure 1.
    The Project comprises:
    a. tunnels:
    i. a main tunnel which will capture and store combined sewage from CSOs along its route and transfer it to Abbey Mills Pumping Station, from where the Lee Tunnel will transfer it for treatment at Beckton Sewage Treatment Works
    ii. 11 connection tunnels, which will link flows from CSOs to the main tunnel.
    b. Worksites:
    i. five main tunnel Worksites (drive and/or reception sites)
    ii. 16 CSO Worksites
    iii. two System modification Worksites Thames Tideway Tunnel
    iv. works at Beckton Sewage Treatment works.
    
    Scope of Works
    
    The Hammersmith Pumping Station (HAMPS) Inlet Channel forms part of a live sewage pumping station infrastructure. It will remain operational throughout the duration of the project. This is a gravity-fed storm relief pumping station, with no physical or mechanical means of isolating the two sewers entering the Inlet Channel wet weather, thus all works are weather-dependent. 
    
    In order to ensure safety of the working teams, BMB have implemented a series of real-time catchment sewer monitoring along with computer modelling and weather forecast modelling tools which form part of the safe system of works (more details can be provided on request). Within the Inlet Channel, two temporary weir walls were installed, which are interconnected with a series of flumes to divert the flows through the works area (referred to as dry zone), effectively creating a cofferdam within the sewer environment 
    
    BMB JV are required to construct 4no elements of additional benching structures within the HAMPS Inlet Channel (highlighted in Figure 2), as follows:
    
    1.	Benching constructed on top of the base slab - 8m log, 2m wide (at base) with the outer face sloping towards the north wall at 45o, 750mm high. The subcontractor is to design, supply and install the formwork for this element. B16 dowels and face tension reinforcement bars (at 150mm c/c) will be supplied by BMB but will need cutting / bending and fixing by the subcontractor - no reinforcement drg is available at this stage but it is envisaged to have less than 100mm B16 bars. 
     
    2.	Mass section of mass benching on top of the existing wall benching - upstream of the temporary weir wall. The section will have curved faces - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.
    
    3.	Mass section of mass benching on top of the existing wall benching - upstream of the temporary weir wall. The section will have curved faces - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.
    
    
    4.	Bullnose' mass benching installed on top of the existing slab, against the wall section between the two sewer portals. This section will be curved in multiple directions - BMB will provide the formwork design and polystyrene Cordeck infill panels made to required shape - (combination of RDM / Cordeck formwork) - the Subcontractor to provide the remainder materials for the formwork and assemble it.
    Please note that entry upstream of the upstream temporary weir wall (items 2 and 3) is only possible during the safe tide window (+/- 2hrs from the low tide at Hammersmith) - a spreadsheet with exact tides for May and July was attached for reference. As north wall benching (item 1) is not restricted to low tide working, the Subcontractor's programme should allow for overlapping the activities such the low tide window is used for the upstream works and the remainder of the shift can be used for constructing Item 1 benching as well as all enabling works. 
    
     
     Returned quotations will be evaluated by BMB JV's (BAM Nuttall, Morgan Sindall PLC & Balfour Beatty) Procurement team in conjunction with our design and engineering teams.
    Quotations will be evaluated based on;
    Cost
    Timeliness of return
    Adherence to and demonstration of understanding of the drawings and specifications provided at this point.
    Provision of accurate product specifications to accompany the quotation.
    Supplier experience of similar projects,evidence of this will be requested should the initial quotation be of interest.
    Should the candidate supplier be shortlisted they will then be contacted directly by a member of the BMB Procurement Team within two weeks of shortlisting to discuss the requirement in detail. 
     BMB Joint Venture (BAM Nuttall, Morgan Sindall PLC & Balfour Beatty) 
     Hammersmith Site
buyer: BMB Joint Venture (BAM Nuttall, Morgan Sindall PLC & Balfour Beatty)

description:
1.Maternity gravel car park
      a.Pot holes have appeared in the gravel surface, these need filling circa £2.5K to 4K
      2.A block patio
      a.The soil has been lost leaving the grid exposed, this requires a top soil coat compacted across the area

title: Running Event Organisation and Operating Services
description:
The Slough Borough Council (The Authority) Half Marathon was organised and delivered by the council in October 2018.  Due to the pressures of organising and delivering the event, it was decided that the most appropriate and efficient way to deliver this event in the future would be to outsource the event to a professional organiser (the Service Provider).
      
      The contract will be for 3 years with an option to extend for two further periods of 1 year each.
      
      The event will take place on a Sunday morning between the 20th September to 11th October 2020 and equivalent periods in any subsequent year.
      
      The Event must cater for at least 1000 participants.
      
      The Service Provider must ensure that they are United Kingdom Athletics (UKA) Licensed and will comply with UKA Guidelines throughout the event as defined at https://www.runbritain.com/shared/get-file.ashx?itemtype=document&id=1930
      
      The Service Provider is solely responsible for its costs in operating the event and the Council will not provide any funding or subsidy to the Service Provider beyond the provision of its staff for the performance of the Council's duties in relation to the planning or running of the event.

title: Inward Investment Services
description:
The draft Kent and Medway Enterprise and Productivity Strategy places a strong emphasis on the importance of attracting inward investment, and for locally based agencies to work closely with government agencies to bring new investment into the area. The draft Strategy places a strong emphasis on increasing our promotion of Kent and Medway as a UK inward investment gateway, with a commitment required from Government and the Department for International Trade (DIT) to match local support for inward investment where it is focused around sectors in which Kent and Medway have particular strengths. 

Kent County Council is seeking a supplier that can be the inward investment agency for Kent and Medway. The successful supplier must have an excellent understanding of the key issues companies face when looking to relocate, an understanding of the industrial and commercial property market in Kent and Medway, how to identify and develop leads, how to support companies during the relocation process, and how to support relocated companies following relocation. The successful supplier should have a strong track record of delivering similar services. The core of the contract will be to provide support to SMEs, in accordance with the requirements of ESIF Programme, but the successful candidate will also be required to support non-SMEs. This part of the contract will not be funded by ERDF. The successful supplier will be expected to deliver, alongside Kent County Council and Medway Council, specific outcomes that contribute to economic development in Kent and Medway and will work closely with stakeholders in the county and internationally, including DIT and the South East Local Enterprise Partnership. Prospective bidders are required to specify how they will perform this role, and to show a proven track record in such delivery. The successful supplier will develop innovative and creative solutions to secure inward investment in Kent and Medway. 

The key features of the service are; Securing external investment into Kent and Medway that creates new jobs; Promoting Kent and Medway to overseas markets; Maintaining close contact with investing businesses through an after-care programme. Prospective bidders are required to specify how they will deliver these. The successful supplier will also demonstrate how it will deliver and contribute to the following economic outcomes for Kent and Medway: More investment opportunities from overseas markets; Increased supply chain benefits for local businesses; More inward investment in Kent and Medway; Raised profile as a destination for inward and foreign direct investment. 

The Selection Questionnaire consists of a range of pass/fail questions, only Candidates who meet the minimum criteria will proceed to receive the Tender process. 
This notice is placed in consideration of The Public Contract Regulations, Regulation 32 (9) to (12), subject to additional funding being made available during the lifetime of the contract

title: Consultancy services for a Feasibility Study and Surveys at York Rise Orpington
description:
The Council would now like to commission detailed surveys that will determine the full viability and any associated costs of preparing the site for housing.  For clarity we are not looking for a consultant to consider the housing development, but instead to assess the requirements and associated costs of preparing the site and produce a Report on the sites' suitability. 	                                       
The Council is seeking a suitable consultant to undertake the following surveys, and analyse the outcome of these surveys for the proposed intended purpose of housing development: Refer to the Client Brief document.r housing development.

title: Provision of Home to School Transport in the Kendal area (T5712)
description:
Tenders are invited for the provision of passenger transport services by taxi, minibus and/or coach in relation to Home to School in the Kendal area

The minimum number of seats required is 4 (No passenger assistant required)

You must refer to the "Instructions for Tendering" prior to submitting your bid. 

All submissions must be uploaded and returned via the Chest 

The documents that must be included in your submission are:
		
		Information and Declaration
		Tender Pricing Submission 
		Daily timetable template 

The deadline for submission is:

10:00 Wednesday 19 February 2020


PLEASE ENSURE YOU HAVE UPLOADED ALL THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTS AS FAILURE TO DO SO MAY RESULT IN YOUR TENDER SUBMISSION NOT BEING CONSIDERED

title: RICS VALUER Panel
description:
WCHG have a requirement for a RICS Valuer panel. The panel will be comprised of 2 to 4 Valuers per Lot. The contract will be split into two lots, which can be applied to in isolation or in unison. This accommodates for the valuation and reporting for new build schemes. As well as our Buyback programme and Right to Buy / Acquire properties. 
      Lot 1 - Land, Sales and Rental Values 
      Lot 2 - Buyback properties; Right to Buy/Acquire Properties; Annual Rent Review.

title: Quotation for ICT Print Unit   MIS Replacement System
description:
OVERVIEW
      The Central Print Unit provides a printing resource and processes requests from various sections of Sandwell MBC, external companies and local members.  The orders vary from 1 print request to thousands.
      The system currently used is 20 + years old and has not been supported for several years.  It runs on Vista and is not compatible with the current Windows Operating system & Office 365.  No back-ups are taken.
      There is a requirement to replace this existing system so that it is compliant with the current ICT infrastructure and security.
      The replacement system is to be supplied on an initial 2-year contract with the option to extend for up to a further 2 years, with full support and maintenance. Applicants are required to submit prices for the initial contract period and the optional extension period.

title: Improving Land Use Change Tracking in the UK Greenhouse Gases Inventory
description:
BEIS is seeking a contractor to improve the tracking of Land Use Change in the UK Greenhouse Gas inventory. 
      BEIS is looking to hold a Supplier Event on the 19th of March 2020 in support of a proposed Invitation to Tender.  Places will be allocated on a first come, first served basis to one representative per organisation, as space will be restricted.

title: A NEW 'VISION FOR WINCHESTER' 2020-2030 - AWARD
description:
The Town Forum now wishes to produce a new Vision for Winchester to articulate aspirations for the town over the next ten years or so, not only for those who live in the area but also in its contribution to the wider district. This will function as an overarching framework for more detailed work on specific issues and as a clear statement of what the preferred long term outcomes of decision making will be.
      
      The Contract will commence on 2nd February 2020 and and ends on 30th June 2020
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 12.00 hrs on Friday 10th January 2020.

title: Supply of Traffic Cameras and Image Hosting Service
description:
This Framework is for supply of Cameras Associated Equipment and an Image Hosting & Support Service for Traffic Monitoring within the County of Durham.

Durham County Council is seeking to appoint a single supplier.  If you are successful you will be appointed to the Framework.  Following appointment the Council may make call-offs against the Framework Agreement on the basis of you being the sole supplier on the Framework and you will be expected to respond to meet the demand of the Council's planned programme.  However, should you be unable to meet the requirements of any order then the Council reserves the right to approach other contractors to carry out such order.

title: 2020-02-27 1300 Sudbury to Cathedral View, Bury St Edmunds or Finborough Road, Stowmarket (Respite Transport) - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      Sudbury to Cathedral View, Bury St Edmunds or Finborough Road, Stowmarket (Respite Transport) - 4 seats, no passenger assistant, required.
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is 1pm on Thursday 27th February 2020. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is 5pm on Wednesday 26th February 2020 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: The Provision of Commercial Aeronautical Information (AI)

title: THE PROVISION OF POSTAL SERVICES
description:
he Folkestone & Hythe District Council currently have a contract in place for the provision of its Postal Services - mail collection and delivery, which will be expiring on the 31 March 2020 and need to secure a new contract with suitable Supplier for the provision of the services from 01 April 2020. 

The requirement is for the Supplier to be able to collect mail items from the Council's Office and arrange deliveries to any postal address within the UK (including Scotland, Highlands and Islands).

The opportunity is available the Kent Business Portal and can only be accessed via the portal (https://www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk)

title: HW05661 - UPPER DON FLOOD ALLEVIATION SCHEME (FAS) - PHASE 1 LOXLEY CONFLUENCE
description: The project is the design and construction of linear flood defences along both banks of the river Loxley from Malin bridge to the confluence of the rivers Loxley and Don. The site is generally split into three locations: Holme Lane Defences, Penistone Road Defences and Loxley Confluence Defences. The defences will consist of a combination of new structures and modifications to existing structures and buildings and may include the following: retaining walls, retaining walls with mini-piles, gravity walls, raising and/or strengthening existing walls, ground raising and embankments, bridge parapets, flap valves and flood gates.

title: WSCC DR Public Health Services Re-Opening
description:
A contract for the provision of Public Health Services, as described in Documents 2a - g (Service Specification) ("the Contract") is being re-opened for further tendered by West Sussex County Council ("the Council") in accordance with the Light Touch Regime (LTR) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102) ("the 2015 Regulations"). 
      
      The aim of the procurement process is to seek additional service providers to provide Public Health Services in the County of West Sussex. As such, please note that bidders will not be competing with each other for a place on this contract. All bidders who pass the evaluation stage, as detailed in Parts 3 and 4 below will be offered a place on the approved supplier list. 
      
      The procurement process will be undertaken using the OJEU Open Procedure and will be divided into the following six lots: 
      
      Lot 1: NHS Health Check Services
      Lot 2: Smoking Cessation Services
      Lot 3: Alcohol Identification and Brief Advice Services
      Lot 4: Intrauterine Device Services
      Lot 5: Contraceptive Implant Services 
      Lot 6: Emergency Hormonal Contraception Services

title: Professional Kennelling Services
description:
Winchester City Council and Eastleigh Borough Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for Professional Kennelling Services.
      
      Kennelling provision for stray dogs seized within their Districts. The contract offered for tender is for both for the temporary holding of stray dogs and the provision of a public reception centre to act as a public drop off and collection point for strays
      
      The Contract will commence on 01 April 2020 and will be for a period of 4 years
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 17:00 hrs on Friday 21 February 2020.

title: ARCHAEOLOGICAL PLANNING SERVICES FOR GREATER MANCHESTER
description:
•To maintain an efficient service, with clear criteria against which case officers within LPAs are able to identify the need for specialist archaeological advice on planning applications. 
      •To maintain and enhance the Historic Environment Record. Ensure accessibility to the ten LPAs, as well as other users, and encourage greater use of the information by case officers in LPAs when seeking specialist archaeological advice. 
      •To encourage developers to seek specialist archaeological advice and utilise the HER prior to submitting a planning application. 
      •To maximise the research and public benefit value of archaeological investigations

title: GB-London: Consolidated Search
description:
The consolidated search will need to retrieve data from RMG's collections and archive database (Mimsy), library database (Symphony), as well as RMG's library and archive bookings system (Aeon). The aim is to provide a single point of reference for all researchers.
      
      Work on the Collections Online website and Consolidated Search will run concurrently. In order to achieve this, we require the Consolidated Search suppliers to:
      •Agree on interface (March)
      •Deliver a beta version to support the development of the website (end of April)
      •Be available during the development stage to advise on and adapt the search functionality (May/June)
      •Delivery final version (June)

title: INVITATION TO TENDER FOR DESIGN & BUILD OF NEW TODDLER & JUNIOR PLAY AREA, SEVEN STARS ROAD, LEYLAND
description:
South Ribble Borough Council is inviting tenders for the design and build of a new toddler and junior play area, Seven Stars Road, Leyland as detailed more fully in the Specification.  The Council's set budget for this project is £175,000.  

The project involves the removal of the existing play equipment and associated rubber surfacing and design & build of a new play area for toddlers and juniors at the open space at Seven Stars Road, Leyland, PR25 1HW.  It is anticipated that the project will commence on 13th January 2020 and will be complete by 30th April 2020.

Interested bidders should register their interest via the Chest at www.the-chest.org.uk in order to access the full specification and invitation to tender documentation. The deadline for expressions of interest is 5pm Friday 15th November 2019. Completed tender documents must be submitted and received via the Chest by no later than 12 Noon Monday 18th November 2019.

title: 2020-02-17 1000 QFX013: Ipswich - Causton Junior School, Ipswich - AWARD
description:

title: Independent visitor services for children looked after
description:
The London Borough of Bromley ("the Council") is seeking bids for provision of Independent Visitor Service for Children Looked After.

Independent Visitors provide a support and befriending service to children and young people who are in care. This service originated in the 1989 Children Act for children who had little or no contact with their birth family. However, changes to the statutory guidance in the 2008 Act now mean that any young person in care is now eligible for this service if it appears to be in the child's interests to do so. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                               The contract will commence on 1st August 2020 and be for a period of three years with an option to extend on a one plus one (1 + 1) basis at the sole discretion of the Council.

title: Bus Timetabling and Publicity ICT system
description:
Across the borough there is over 2,278 bus stops, of which 1,593 locations have public transport information displayed.  Real Time Passenger Information is provided at Chester Bus Interchange and on-street in Forgeate Street, Chester Railway station and very soon in Northwich. The Council is committed to ensuring that Public Transport is more attractive and is easier to use in the future. Getting people to the right place at the right time is essential to the smooth operation of any transport network. 

2.2	What we are buying and why
A bus timetabling and publicity ICT solution.
2.3 What we require: the solution
The Strategic Transport team is customer focused and committed to delivering an excellent service to its residents in the provision of public transport information across the borough. This is successfully achieved through maintaining roadside information at bus stops, producing timetables leaflets and travel information for bus stations, alongside providing regular updates to Traveline.  The system must be intuitive and flexible to ensure the efficient delivery of public transport at a local or national. 

The Council has embraced a cloud-first approach as part of its IT strategy and prefer where possible, the sourcing of solutions that will be offered to the customer as Software as a Service (SaaS).
buyer: Cheshire west and Chester Borough Council

title: Nuclear Innovation and Research Office
description: The Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) seeks to award a new three- year contract to the National Nuclear Laboratory (NNL) Ltd to deliver the Nuclear Innovation and Research Office - starting on 1 April 2020 and running to 31 March 2023, with the option of extending  . The contract includes: providing Government with impartial technical advice on a range of nuclear policy, programmes and strategic issues; programme support to the BEIS Nuclear Innovation Programme; representing Government in certain international fora; and acting as a Secretariat for the Nuclear Innovation and Research Advisory Board (NIRAB). The advisory function NIRO will be separated from NNL's commercial business by a series of ethical barriers.

title: SBC-01-2020-58CW-Rear Extension - AWARD
description:
Stevenage Borough Council are currently seeking quotes for the provision and Construction of a rear extension to provide ground floor, level access bathing facilities. (Conventional Build or SIP Panel Construction)
      The quotation documents can be accessed from the 'My Tenders' area of the Supply Hertfordshire website and selecting the 'View Details' button of this project.
      Please note the deadline for returns and allow sufficient time to make your return as late returns will not be permitted.
      Any questions relating to this quote should be made via correspondence on the website and can be addressed to the main contact as shown in the details above.

title: Water Quality Management Services
description: The purpose of the Water Quality Treatment Services is to provide effective water treatment services, compliant with relevant current legislation and codes of practice, and responsive to the requirements of risk assessments previously carried out by independent Service Providers. Maintenance of and repairs to associated equipment and plant also fall within the requirement.

title: LUV00843 - Water Hygiene Monitoring Services Contract
description:
The purpose of the water quality treatment services is to provide effective water treatment services, compliant with relevant current legislation and codes of practice and responsive to the requirements of risk assessments previously carried out by independent service providers. Maintenance of and repairs to associated equipment and plant also fall within the requirement. 
      Contract to commence on 1 Aug 2020 for an initial one year period, after which there will be an option to extend by a further  36 months.

title: SUPPLY OF C2A2 OF SIGHT UNIT SPARES AND ASSOCIATED ITEMS
description:
Other additional information: The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy.  If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise.  The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.
      
      https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/government-security-classifications
      
      Electronic Trading. Potential suppliers must note the mandatory requirement for electronic trading currently via email invoicing, with Babcock DSG Limited.
      
      The Cyber risk level is low and the Risk Assessment Reference RAR code is RAR-9CDU6MD2. All Potential Operators who are invited to tender must complete the Supplier Assurance Questionnaire (SAQ) via the Supplier Cyber Protection Service (Octavian) https://supplier-cyber-protection.service.gov.uk/ to demonstrate their compliance with the required cyber risk level. This is a self-assurance process and no validation of the SAQ return is required.
      
      
       Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk
      
      Justification For Non-Competitive Decision: It is considered this requirement can be placed using the negotiated procedure without prior publication pursuant to Article 25(1)(a) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1)(a)(i) of the Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011) due to the absence of suitable tenders in response to the previous restricted procedure reference 2019/S 146-360833. In respect of the previous restricted procedure, the UK Ministry of Defence received a single tender response and that tender was evaluated as being commercially non-compliant.
      Optical instruments. Babcock DSG Limited, which is acting as the agent for the UK Ministry of Defence known as the Authority, is considering a Framework Agreement to Supply spares and associated items for the C2A2 Sight Unit.
buyer: Ministry of Defence, DSG, Defence Support Group (DSG)

title: GB-Leeds: R/3706 - Supply of an integrated Laboratory-Scale Fibre Analyser and Associated Software System.
description:
Notice of award of an integrated Laboratory-Scale Fibre Analyser and Associated Software System. 
      
      
      The purpose of the Laboratory Fibre Analyser and Software System is to enable the characterisation of the dimensions and mechanical properties of fibrous materials, under both dry and wet conditions.

title: Tender for the Provision of E-Bikes 2020
description:
Sheffield City Council (SCC) is wishing to purchase 195 hybrid e bikes, which are split in to 3 Lots: 
Lot 1a: 164 Hybrid e-bikes 
Lot 1b: 21 Small framed e-bikes 
Lot 2: 10 Trekking style e-bikes, suitable for Enforcement/Police type operations
For access to tender information and documents, please visit www.yortender.co.uk and search for DN466410.

title: The Provision Of  Domiciliary Care for Children and Young People with a Disability
description:
•To provide a short break service in the community, that enhances the wellbeing of children and young people with a disability and offers parents and carers a break from their caring role.
      
      •To provide a safe and exciting environment for children with complex health needs to be away from their home for a specified period of time.
      •To offer structured sessions and setting objectives and outcomes for each child.
      
      •To support parents and carers in encouraging children to enjoy and achieve
      
      •To provide 1:1 support to families of children and young people who have a disability, with complex needs 
      
      •To provide a good level of competent staff to support children and young people with a disability to access a programme of activities and develop their independent skills
