title: Repairs & Maintenance of Workshop Equipment
description:
Leeds City Council (Fleet Services) operates a diverse service critical fleet of around 1300 vehicles incorporating a fleet of refuse collection vehicles and specialist agricultural vehicles and equipment currently repaired at the York road Depot with a satellite depot at Knowsthorpe Way. 
This tender is for the supply of onsite workshops equipment calibration and maintenance

title: HCC - 11/19 - Provision of Local Bus and School Coach Services starting April 2020 - AWARD
description:
Following a procurement, Hertfordshire County Council has awarded contracts for the Provision of Local Bus and School Coach Services starting April 2020
      
      This is an award notice and this opportunity is now closed. 
      
      The successful suppliers are - 
      
      Lot 1: H V Richmond Ltd
      Lot 2: Landmark Coaches 
      Lot 3: University Bus Ltd (Trading as UNO)
      Lot 4: Centrebus Ltd
      Lot 5: Red Eagle Buses
      Lot 6: Galleon Travel 2009 Ltd
      Lot 7: Galleon Travel 2009 Ltd
      Lot 8: Metroline Travel Ltd
      Lot 9: Arriva Kent Thameside Ltd
      Lot 10: Centrebus Ltd
      
      The estimated total value of all Contracts is £5,718,849.00 and is for the core Contract period and also includes the approximate value for extensions.  
      
      The initial term of this contract is five (5) years with a possible extension of up to a further two (2) years at the Councils discretion. 
      
      OJEU Contract Notice Number: 2019/S 220-539894
      
      OJEU Award Notice Number: 2020/S 035-083956

title: CP1827-19 Extending Next Generation Access (NGA) Broadband & Gigabit Access
description:
Connecting Devon and Somerset (CDS) is a public sector Programme supported by the Heart of the South West Local Enterprise Partnership (LEP) and working with the broadband supply market to provide enhanced broadband infrastructure across the CDS area.
This ITT is part of the CDS Phase 2 with a second amount of public money to further extend the NGA Network, on a gap-funding basis.
The aim of this OJEU tender process is to competitively select a supplier to deliver the outcome specification detailed in the tender documents.
SUPPLIER NOTE - Suppliers should note that in order to Express Interest they must complete and return documentation through www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

title: The Supply Of European Printed Music to the British Library
description:
The material required under this contract is printed music published and commercially
    available primarily in Europe ranging from editions and facsimiles of a high scholarly standard (including full critical
    apparatus) to less scholarly editions of a high standard aimed towards the performer. A small number of orders may
    be placed for printed music published and commercially available outside Europe.

title: T0982 - Union House Architect + Master Planning  - AWARD
description:
The University of East Anglia wishes to appoint Architectural and Master Planning Services for the Union House Floor Project.  A detailed outline of the scope of works is included within the Invitation to Tender documentation.
      
      We invite you to submit your total costs to the University as per the timescales detailed below and within the Invitation to Tender documentation.  Please note, the UEA Projects Office is closed over Christmas and the New Year and there will be no monitoring of InTend during this time.  Due to the Christmas break there are two deadlines for the UEA to respond to queries raised by the associated questions deadline.
              
      Tenders issued from:                          Sam Haigh
      Tender Questions Deadline 1:         1200 hrs Tuesday 17th December 2019
      Questions answered Deadline 1: 1500 hrs Thursday 19th December 2019
      
      *PLEASE NOTE* UEA Projects Office Closed during period - queries will not be responded to during this time: Tuesday 24th Dec 2019 - Wednesday 1st Jan 2020 inclusive
      
      Tender submission deadline:          1200 hrs Tuesday 7th January 2020
      Tender results announcement: Tuesday 14th January 2020
      Planned start date:                           Start-up meeting 23rd January 2020 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
      
      N.B. All correspondence regarding the tender procedure should be made through the University of East Anglia In-Tend system via the 'Correspondence' functionality. Failure to do so may result in your correspondence being excluded from the tender process.
      
      Project information:
      
      Project Ref:                                            TBC
      Project Name:                                        Student Union House Floor Repairs and Auto Door Replacement
      Project Lead:                                        Sam Haigh
      Main Contract Type:                        JCT Minor Works with Contractor Design
      Anticipated start on site date:        End July 2020
      Anticipated construction length: 5 weeks
      Award Criteria:                                         100% Price
      
      File Formats
      
      We advise all suppliers to only submit the following file formats:
      
      All Microsoft Office Files
      PDF Files
      ZIP files contacting the above files
      Jpeg images
      Maximum file size = 20MB
      No other file types will be accepted unless specified in the tender

Please note, the UEA Projects Office is closed over Christmas and the New Year and there will be no monitoring of InTend during this time.  Due to the Christmas break there are two deadlines for the UEA to respond to queries raised by the associated questions deadline.
              
      Tenders issued from:                          Sam Haigh
      Tender Questions Deadline 1:         1200 hrs Tuesday 17th December 2019
      Questions answered Deadline 1: 1500 hrs Thursday 19th December 2019
      
      *PLEASE NOTE* UEA Projects Office Closed during period - queries will not be responded to during this time: Tuesday 24th Dec 2019 - Wednesday 1st Jan 2020 inclusive
      
      Tender submission deadline:          1200 hrs Tuesday 7th January 2020
      Tender results announcement: Tuesday 14th January 2020
      Planned start date:                           Start-up meeting 23rd January 2020 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
      
      N.B. All correspondence regarding the tender procedure should be made through the University of East Anglia In-Tend system via the 'Correspondence' functionality. Failure to do so may result in your correspondence being excluded from the tender process.
      
      Project information:
      
      Project Ref:                                            TBC
      Project Name:                                        Student Union House Floor Repairs and Auto Door Replacement
      Project Lead:                                        Sam Haigh
      Main Contract Type:                        JCT Minor Works with Contractor Design
      Anticipated start on site date:        End July 2020
      Anticipated construction length: 5 weeks
      Award Criteria:                                         100% Price
      
      File Formats
      
      We advise all suppliers to only submit the following file formats:
      
      All Microsoft Office Files
      PDF Files
      ZIP files contacting the above files
      Jpeg images
      Maximum file size = 20MB
      No other file types will be accepted unless specified in the tender

title: 2473.478.JT.AMRC.20 - Aluminium Alloy Purchase - AWARD
description: The University of Sheffield (UoS) on behalf of the Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre (AMRC) wishes to invite tenders for the provision of quality aluminium alloy from an accredited supplier. The aluminium requirement is for a specialist project that the AMRC is undertaking and is a one-off requirement (not recurring demand). The aluminium will be delivered to the AMRC`s Factory of the Future, Catcliffe.Any queries regarding this Invitation to Tender should be submitted through the University's e tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sheffield via the Correspondence facility. The invitation to tender document can be downloaded and provides the instructions for this process including the specification.

title: DBC (SF) Laundry Equipment Maintenance - AWARD
description:
Dacorum Borough Council has a number of Sheltered Complexes, which contain a range of laundry equipment which require, breakdown repairs and quarterly gas checks on the gas dryers.
      
      The Council is looking for a single contractor to deliver these services, who has the relevant experience, ability and approved partnerships to repair the Councils existing laundry machines which are Miele, Electrolux  and Huesbsch and includes:
      o Provide repairs services to laundry equipment;
      o Provide an all inclusive (no quibble) service, so any maintenance issues such as blocked pipes, soap boxes and filters or ducting are cleaned out for no additional charge or call-out   (this currently accounts for 40% of call-outs)
      o Carry out annual check on all Gas machines;
      o Carry out an annual inspection and cleaning of ducting of all tumble driers
      o All machines to be cleaned and filtered checked when repair work is carried out.
      
      For full specification of the requirements please download the tender documents.  Please go to the portal https://in-tendhost.co.uk/supplyhertfordshire/aspx/Tenders/Current
      
      Please submit your completed tender document via the Council's e-tendering portal no later than 12 noon 9 December 2019. Any tender submitted either manually or by email will not be accepted.

The minimum number of seats required is 4 (Passenger assistant required)

title: Northamptonshire County Council Commissioning Framework for People with a Learning Disability
description: Northamptonshire County Council's Commissioning Framework being procured encompasses overarching outcomes that matter to people with a learning disability and their carers in Northamptonshire namely: • People get the help they need when they need it • People have, and hold on to, relationships that have meaning to them • People feel in control • People have equal access to healthcare, training and occupation • People feel safe and are supported to take risks • People have somewhere to live they call home • People live longer • Carers are able to continue caring. The Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCG's) are a contractual party to the Framework and intend to call off packages of care from this Framework as required. The light touch regime (LTR) applies to the Services under this Framework Agreement, as per Public Contracts Regulations 2015. The Framework will be opened on an annual basis or at the discretion of the Authority, based on need. The Commissioning Framework is broken down into 8 Lots: -Forensic Support -Living and Learning Opportunities -Residential Living -Short Breaks - Short Term Crisis Support -Supported Accommodation -Supported Living -Supporting People at Home

meaning to them • People feel in control • People have equal access to healthcare, training and occupation • People feel safe and are supported to take risks • People have somewhere to live they call home • People live longer • Carers are able to continue caring. The Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCG's) are a contractual party to the Framework and intend to call off packages of care from this Framework as required. The light touch regime (LTR) applies to the Services under this Framework Agreement, as per Public Contracts Regulations 2015. The Framework will be opened on an annual basis or at the discretion of the Authority, based on need. title: HAC5621 Integrated Information, Advice and Advocacy Services (IAA)
description:
This procurement aim to secure a competent contractor for the delivery of an integrated Information, Advice and Advocacy (IAA) service for Tower Hamlets residents 
The service will support the council to manage demand on its adult social care front door and health services by providing free, independent, quality-assured information, advice and advocacy across health, social care and social welfare in order to resolve issues and prevent or delay needs/problems escalating, and support residents to remain independent and healthy.
The service will be linked in with preventative services across the borough such as social prescribing, care and community navigators as well as hospitals and others. The IAA service will offer early help and support to residents and carers through: a digital portal, a telephone based triage/information/advice service and face-to-face outreach support. The budget available for this contract is up to £3,360,000.

title: Provision of Home to School Transport in the Windermere area (T6403)
description:
Tenders are invited for the provision of passenger transport services by taxi, minibus and/or coach in relation to Home to School in the Windermere area

The minimum number of seats required is 8 (No passenger assistant required)

You must refer to the "Instructions for Tendering" prior to submitting your bid. 

All submissions must be uploaded and returned via the Chest 

The documents that must be included in your submission are:
		
		Information and Declaration
		Tender Pricing Submission 
		Daily timetable template 

The deadline for submission is:

10:00 Thursday 23 January 2020

title: YPO - 000994 Fire Safety Equipment and Associated Products and Services
description:
YPO and Eastern Shires Purchasing Organisation (ESPO) are looking for Providers to be appointed onto a Framework Agreement for the provision of Fire Safety Equipment and Associated Products and Services. The Framework is designed to meet the needs of all public sector organisations which includes YPO/ESPO internal requirements.
YPO is the lead Public Sector Buying Organisation (PSBO) for this Framework Agreement in collaboration with ESPO as a group of Public Sector Buying Organisations (PSBOs; see details below)

title: Adult Community Based Drug & Alcohol Treatment Service
description:
The Service will provide both pharmacological and psychosocial programmes for the addiction and dependence
to illicit substances and alcohol.
The Service will continue to have the overarching aim of reducing the harms caused by drug and alcohol use.
More specifically it will; prevent early mortality caused by drug and alcohol use; reduce levels of dependence;
reduce levels of drug and alcohol crime; reduce demand on social care; improve the lives of children of
parents with drug or alcohol problems; reduce the spread of infections associated with drug use; reduce
hospital admissions and increase the number of people entering employment and positively contributing to
the community. The Service will be key in supporting the attainment of the Government's goals of eradicating
homelessness and Hepatitis C.
The Service will target the full spectrum of substance use problems, from 'recreational' drug use and lower risk
alcohol consumption to severe poly-substance dependence. This broad focus will be reflected in the Service
adopting and combining both the harm reduction and recovery approaches to service delivery. It is expected that
the new Service will increase the level of attention given to early interventions (i.e. primary prevention).
The Service will continue to provide, within the scope of available funds, a holistic programme of treatment
and support, this will include such things as support for families and carers, physical health care, mental health
support, and access to training and employment programmes.
The Contract Manager has been working closely with a significant number of stakeholders involved to create
a specification that not only reflects the new budgetary requirements but allows the providers to consider how
they might best meet the outcomes defined by the Contract Manager. The specification will therefore be a hybrid
version of a requirement based specification and an outcome based specification. The Council believes that
Providers are best placed to design the service that best supports the required contract outcomes within the
parameters of the fixed contract price. 
The contract outcomes that the Council is seeking to achieve are detailed within the tender documents which are freely available on our procurement portal www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk. The contract term is 5 years with options to extend by a further 2 years. The contract start date is April 2020. All communication with regards this opportunity must be made via our procurement portal. This tender will be made public on Wednesday 4 September via our procurement portal www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

and support, this will include such things as support for families and carers, physical health care, mental health
support, and access to training and employment programmes.
The Contract Manager has been working closely with a significant number of stakeholders involved to create
a specification that not only reflects the new budgetary requirements but allows the providers to consider how
they might best meet the outcomes defined by the Contract Manager. The specification will therefore be a hybrid
version of a requirement based specification and an outcome based specification. The Council believes that
Providers are best placed to design the service that best supports the required contract outcomes within the
parameters of the fixed contract price. 
The contract outcomes that the Council is seeking to achieve are detailed within the tender documents which are freely available on our procurement portal www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk. The contract term is 5 years with options to extend by a further 2 years. The contract start date is April 2020. All communication with regards this opportunity must be made via our procurement portal. This tender will be made public on Wednesday 4 September via our procurement portal www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk

title: WHC - Decked Car Park :  Welwyn Garden City
description:
Welwyn Hatfield Borough Council is looking to appoint a Specialist Design and Build Contractor directly experienced in decked car parks as their partner to develop a new decked car park in central Welwyn Garden City. 
      
      The site is currently a public surface car park. The project is to increase capacity by:
      
      Option A nett 180 car parking spaces or Option B nett 360 spaces depending on the completion and outcome of the Councils overall car parking study and strategy. 
      
      It is a requirement that tenderers submit bids for both options i.e. Option A and Option B. The evaluation criteria and scoring methodology will be the same for each option but the decision on which option to proceed with will be made separately by the Council outside of the tender evaluation process following completion of their overall Town Centre car parking strategy. The Council reserve the right to choose between Option A and Option B completely at their discretion and the highest scoring contractor in accordance with the evaluation methodology set out in Section 3 below for the selected Option shall be taken forward to the Second Stage irrespective of the tenderers position for the Option not to be proceeded with..

title: GB-Dalby: Dalby VC Flat Roof Refurbishment
description:
Bidders are invited to tender for the complete refurbishment of the existing flat roof to the Dalby Visitors Centre, The work will include the following:
      
      -Removing Stripping off the existing felt roof covering
      -Inspecting and undertaking localised repairs to the timber deck, upstands, flashings, facias and parapets.
      -Preparing roof joists and installing new tapered insulation laid to falls, vapour control layer and a proprietary built-up reinforced bitumen membrane system with a warranted service life of a minimum 20 years. 
      -Installing new rainwater pipes, soil & vent pipes, GRP trims, and a new 1200 x 1200mm triple skinned access hatch and domed roof light. 
      -Removing and refixing and commissioning the existing photovoltaic panels, solar water heating panels and pipes, satellite digital aerials and Man Safe restraint system
      
      Forestry England requires an experienced and qualified contractor to propose a suitable solution for the replacement of the existing flat roof. 
      
      Works will include for all site preparation, welfare provision, and access to height equipment. Site safety within the fenced enclosure will be the Responsibility of the Contractor during the period of the works.

title: Services of a Graduation Academic Dress Supplier at Lancaster University - AWARD
description:
Lancaster University is seeking to appoint an established and experienced company to provide a professional graduation academic dress service to the students and staff at Lancaster University.
      The company appointed will be progressive and customer focused with mechanisms to provide transparent reporting and ongoing practical solutions. 
      Throughout the delivery of the contract, the supplier will be expected to display the following:  
      o Excellent customer service to reflect and mirror the highly regarded graduation standards at the university
      o Offer continuous improvements and approaches to the gowning service 
      o Develop and maintain an excellent working relationship with the graduation team working closely to deliver a high quality service before, during and after graduation ceremonies 
      This contract will provide the successful company with the opportunity to be the sole official provider of academic dress at Lancaster University.
      The university wishes to award this contract for five years commencing 1 March 2020. There will be a review after year one.
      This tender is subject to LU competitive procurement regulations and is being conducted electronically using the University's e-tendering system, which can be found at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/lancaster/

title: Chemical Dosing Equipment
description: The scope of this tender is for the provision of chemical dosing systems design, manufacture, supply, installation, calibration, within warranty maintenance and training services for the preparation and controlled dosing of liquid, gas and powder solutions. This includes upgrading and repairing of existing and integrating with existing systems.

title: Housing Development at Strangers Way , Luton, LU4 9ND
description: Luton Council is working on behalf of Foxhall Homes Ltd. who proposed to develop land at Strangers Way for 48 dwellings and associated infrastructure.  The procurement for development is a two-stage process of which completion of the Standard Selection Questionnaire (SQ) is the first stage.  The SQ forms part of a competitive procurement for the award this contract, which will be conducted in accordance with the Restricted Procedure, 	in accordance with the requirements of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (PCR 2015) and the Public Procurement (Amendments, Repeals and Revocations) Regulations 2016. The potential supplier shall be responsible for the design and construction of all units, associated external works, and statutory services/connections, operating under a JCT Design and Build Contract 2016

title: GB-Oldham: Oldham Voids
description:
Housing 21 has a Private Finance Initiative (PFI) contract with Oldham Metropolitan Borough Council (OMBC) to deliver the provision of social housing services to OMBC stock of social housing and tenants. 
      
      Oldham PFI is a mix of sheltered schemes, bungalows and extra care. The stock consists of 613 flats in 19 sheltered schemes and 820 bungalows. 
      
      In order to deliver the PFI contract H21 engage sub-contractors to support the delivery of given services. Subcontractors should expect to engage with Housing 21 at a contractual and commercial level to meet the demands of Oldham Council and their tenants. 
      
      This SQ/ITT relates to the subcontracting of void properties on H21's PFI contract with OMBC. All the services will be delivered in and around the Oldham area only.

title: Architectural Services for HRA New Build Works
description:
Newark and Sherwood District Council are currently developing a series of sites over the next 2-3 years.  We are looking to appoint an Architect to undertake site massing and feasibilities for the next phase of the HRA Build Programme plus additional one-off sites as required over a 12 month period then progress pre-contract services to obtain Planning consent and Principal Constructor information on a series of sites.  The post-contact service is not included within this Appointment.  We do, however require data to be produced for Principal Construction and we do anticipate the architect will be novated over to the construction frame work partner for the construction phase of the project.
This Appointment is to undertake the pre-contract services for a period of 12 months.  It is anticipated that this will be for circa 50-100 dwellings on a range of sites.  Some may only contain 1 or 2 units.  The sites are likely to be mostly 1 and 2 bed units of bungalow, house or apartment design of 1, 2 or 3 storeys.

title: CPCA - Greater South East Energy Hub Regional Energy Mapping
description: The Greater South East Energy Hub's requirements for Mapping Energy and Utilities Infrastructure for Regional Spatial Planning and is an invitation to submit a costed proposal for the supply of these products and services. The GSE Energy Hub wishes to appoint an organisation or consortium of organisations to develop and deliver: 1. A proof of concept mapping system that meets the requirements detailed in 4. 2. A report explaining the costed options for a final proposed mapping system. The proposal will be developed for a national approach and platform for regional energy mapping that all five Hubs could use, with potential to extend across the wider public sector stakeholders and meets the requirements detailed in 5. 3. Ongoing support meeting the requirements detailed in 4.4. The anticipated split in focus between the proof of concept mapping system, the report explaining the costed options for a final proposed mapping system (national approach) and ongoing support, is that the proof of concept mapping system is the majority of the work. Tender documents should identify in detail the expected breakdown between these three different aspects and provide appropriate justification in the tender document submitted for their allocation.

title: Blog and article writing and editing services for the Genomics Education Programme
description:
The Genomics Education Programme (GEP) was established in 2014 following an initial investment from the Department of Health to pump prime genomic education and training activity to support the delivery of the 100,000 Genomes Project. At the beginning of financial year 2018/19 the GEP became part of 'business as usual' within Health Education England (HEE) and, in collaboration with NHS England (NHSE), continues to support the newly launched NHS Genomic Medicine Service (GMS).

As part of its role in delivering education and training to the NHS workforce, the GEP requires specialist genomics editorial expertise to plan and produce a series of articles on genomics in healthcare that are useful and relevant to our audience groups, to be featured on our website's blog.

HEE is therefore inviting quotations from providers for the service commencing 1 April 2020 for 2 years, with the potential to extend.

title: Lewisham's School Minor Works Programme 2020 - Contract 1
description:
Lewisham Council wishes to procure a contractor to undertake Mechanical & Electrical works to the primary schools described below. These works will form part of the wider Schools Minor Works Programme 2020.

The works shall comprise but not be limited to the following:

2) Eliot Bank Primary School
Replacement of secondary heating system

The Council welcomes tender submissions from any suitably qualified supplier. To access the tender documents please go to www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk and search for the opportunity under Herefordshire Council.

title: The Provision of Building Cleaning Services at Wolverley CE Secondary School Blakeshall Lane, Wolverley, Kidderminster, Worcestershire DY11 5XQ
description:
Place Partnership Ltd. on behalf of the Head Teacher and the Governing Body of Wolverley CE Secondary School Blakeshall Lane, Wolverley, Kidderminster, Worcestershire DY11 5XQ invite suitable, qualified and experienced Building Cleaning Contractors to submit a Competitive & Commercially Advantageous Tender submission to carry out the cleaning services of the school premises. 
      The contract is expected to start on 1st September 2019 and will run for a period of thirty-six (36) months with the possibility, following annual review of performance; the School may extend the Contract for further periods of up to twenty-four (24) months in increments of no more than twelve (12) months.
      There are 13 existing cleaning staff who under TUPE regulations are eligible to transfer to the new contract.
      The service includes: internal building cleaning, window cleaning including the provision of all associated materials, equipment and labour. To include in the fixed price all routine and non-routine cleaning.
      A daily janitorial service is required during normal school hours.
      The tender procedure is an OJUE Open process.
      All operatives working on this site will be subject to an Enhanced Disclosure Baring Service Check (DBS) the costs associated with any checks will be borne by the contractor. 
      
      Site Visits are planned by appointment see tender documents for full details of available dates.
      To arrange access to carry out this inspection contact the School Business Manager Anthony Derrer on   01562 859800  e-mail office@wolverley.worcs.sch.uk
      
      It is on this basis that we invite suitable contractors to provide a full turn-key project compliant tender submission.
      All tender documents must be uploaded to the portal by the due date as late returns will not be accepted.
      Tenders and supporting documents shall be in English and any contract subsequently entered in to shall be subject to English Law.
      Please note that the Supplier is responsible for obtaining all information necessary for the preparation of the tender submission. 
      All cost, expenses and liabilities incurred by the Supplier in connection with the preparation of their submission, the Form of Tender and Pricing Schedule shall be borne by the Supplier.
      Tenders must remain open for acceptance, unless previously withdrawn for a minimum of 90 days from the date for the return of the Tender.
      The contract will between the Head Teacher and the Governing Body of Wolverley CE Secondary School and the successful supplier.
      Contract start date: Monday 3rd August 2020
      Contract Mobilisation Period Starts: Monday 20th July 2020
      The Head Teacher and the Governing Body of Wolverley CE Secondary School reserve the right not to award a contract in full or in part.

title: T0986 - Waveney LV Panel - AWARD
description:
Project Brief:  T0986
      
      The University of East Anglia wishes to appoint a Contractor for Waveney LV panel Board replacement.
      
      We invite you to submit your total costs to the University as per the timescales detailed below and within the Invitation to Tender documentation.
              
      Advert is placed on the UEA website:  17/01/2020
      Tenders issued from:                               17/1/2020
      Tender Questions deadline:               31/01/20
      Tender submission deadline:               1200 hrs  on  10/02/20
      Tender results announcement:       21/2/20
      Planned Contract placement:               28/2/20
      Planned start date:                                       10/4/20
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
      N.B. All correspondence regarding the tender procedure should be made through the University of East Anglia In-Tend system via the 'Correspondence' functionality. 
      Failure to do so may result in your correspondence being excluded from the tender process.
      
      Project information:
      
      Project Ref:                                                 EST10166
      Project Name:                                               Waveney LV panel 
      Project Administrator:                               Steve Edwards
      Main Contract Type:                              JCT 
      Anticipated start on site date:              10th April 
      Anticipated construction length:      4 Days
      Award Criteria:                                             60% Quality 40% Price
      
      File Formats
      
      We advise all suppliers to only submit the following file formats:
      
      All Microsoft Office Files
      PDF Files
      ZIP files contacting the above files
      Jpeg images
      Maximum file size = 20MB
      No other file types will be accepted unless specified in the tender

title: Framework Agreement for Temporary Employment Agency/Agencies to supply Temporary Staff to stated work groups
description:
Thanet District Council is seeking to select and appoint to a Framework Agreement one or more (maximum of
4) suitably qualified Employment Agencies for the provision of temporary staff to the council for roles specified
(mainly commercial drivers and manual workers) who have the legal right to work in the United Kingdom. Full
detail of work groups/job titles required are contained in the Invitation to Tender Documentation.
                                                                                                                                                                              
Temporary workers may be required to work over the whole of the district or be based at one of one of the
council's operational sites, Manston Road Depot, Dane Park Depot, Ramsgate Port, Ramsgate Royal Harbour,
Broadstairs Harbour, or the main council offices in Margate.
                                                                                                                                                                                        The Framework Agreement is scheduled to commence 20th April 2020 and will be for a 3 year period with a
single option to extend by a further 12 months (at the sole discretion of the Council).
                                                                                                                                                                              
Evaluation will be as per the criteria and methodology as set out in the Invitation to Tender 
Documentation, as will Call Off procedures which will include Direct Award in ranked order of agencies
appointed to the framework for specified work groups 1 & 2 and by means of mini competition of all appointed
agencies for work groups 3 - 6.
                                                                                                                                                                           
IMPORTANT INFORMATION: All procurement documents are available for download from the Kent Business
Portal at www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk and available for suppliers to download and complete according to
instructions contained.
                                                                                                                                                                                       
Any clarifications or questions must be submitted via the message function of Kent Business Portal by no later
than 1400hrs Monday 10th February 2020.
                                                                                                                                                                             
Completed tender documents must be submitted electronically via the Kent Business Portal by no later than Monday 17th February 2020.

title: Multidisciplinary Consultancy Services Crystal Palace Subway Restoration Project
description: Bromley Council (the Commissioning Authority and Client) is seeking to appoint a conservation architect-led multidisciplinary team with experience in managing the restoration of listed historic structures to repair, restore and conserve Crystal Palace Subway, with the ultimate aim of, in the future, transforming the Grade II* building into a commercially viable cultural events venue.

description: Blackpool Enterprise Zone - Construction of a Natural Grass Sports Pitch Plateau. title: Painting and Ancillary Roofline Works (6 Year Programme) - AWARD
description:
Raven Housing Trust is seeking a Supply Partner for exterior painting and ancillary roofline works and interior painting of communal areas, to be undertaken over a 6 year period starting April 2020.
      The project is to redecorate all the previously painted surfaces to the external parts of the building and any communal areas to flats in occupied properties .
      This project also includes the cleaning / washing down to all the existing upvc windows, fascias, bargeboards and shiplap boarding and also carrying out minor decorative pre painting repairs.
      The existing guttering and downpipes are also included and will be cleared of debris and any blockages cleared.
      Where any guttering and roofline is to be replaced it will be clearly indicated in the tender documents and will be replaced with UPVC materials as per the specification details.

title: Crisis to Permanent Accommodation CBMDC
description:
The purpose of the Service being commissioned is to provide crisis and permanent accommodation for customers who are owed a housing duty (Prevention, Relief, Temporary Accommodation and Main Duty) by the Council. 
Crisis accommodation shall be available as temporary accommodation and accessible 24/7, 365 days in the year. Permanent accommodation shall be used to enable throughput from crisis provision but also available as direct access accommodation where agreed on an individual case basis. 
The council is keen to consider models of provision that make use of contemporary best practice to meet the needs of vulnerable individuals and facilitate rapid move on to a sustainable outcome, which may range from permanent accommodation to a planned move into supported accommodation. This will ensure that all clients can access this service and end reliance on B&B placements.  Building and using effective partnerships with other providers in the sector will be essential to the successful delivery of these outcomes.

title: Sound Proofing of OPD Rooms
description:
The Outpatients rooms in Block 16 OPD have a poor soundproofing quality. This project will be to provide suitable sound proofing to these rooms along with additional upgrades to assist with the patient experience.
It is the Trusts intention to sound proof all 9 rooms but no volumes or values can be guaranteed against this tender as all rooms are to be priced separately.

title: Tender for Mercury Abated Cremators and Ancillary Equipment
description:
The City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council Bereavement Services proposes to replace an existing cremator at Oakworth Crematorium and build two new twin cremator facilities over the next 3-5yrs. This tender opportunity is to provide the new equipment at Oakworth, install it and enter into a 15 year fully comprehensive maintenance agreement. The successful supplier will also supply, install and maintain equipment at the two new sites. It is proposed that each new site will house two cremators each.

Outline designs have been developed and the successful tenderer will be required to complete the designs utilising their equipment and install the new cremators, abatement plant and associated equipment.

This opportunity is being tendered under the YPO Crematoria Solutions II - 654 framework.

title: Ambulance and Specialist Vehicle Supply Framework
description:
The tender and subsequent agreement consisting of 11 Lot:
  Lot 1 Supply/conversion of accident and emergency vehicles of a box body construction
  Lot 2 Supply/conversion of accident and emergency vehicles of a van conversion construction
  Lot 3 Supply of rapid response vehicles (based on a car construction) 
  Lot 4 Supply/conversion of patient transport vehicles (including multi patient and stretcher variations)
  Lot 5 Supply/conversion of Wheelchair Accessible Vehicles 
  Lot 6 Supply of ambulance service support vehicles, other specialist vehicles and vehicle refurbishment and/or body remounts
  Lot 7 Provision of lease finance of ambulance and specialist vehicles and related equipment
  Lot 8 Provision of vehicle maintenance management and maintenance provision of ambulance and specialist vehicles
  Lot 9 Provision of contract hire of ambulance and specialist vehicles
  Lot 10  Short Term Hire of Vehicles
  Lot 11 Microsoft® Software and Services Lease Facilities
buyer: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Mechanical Maintenance Dredging
description:
Thanet District Council is seeking the supply of a mechanical (as opposed to hydrodynamic) dredging contractor to undertake maintenance dredging within the Harbour Limits of the Port of Ramsgate, including the Royal Harbour.
Thanet District Council shall not guarantee any minimum quantity of work or number of dredging campaigns as a result of entering into this contract, as the volumes for each campaign will be derived through examination of Hydrographical Bathymetry Surveys for the Port of Ramsgate, to maintain depths of water for safe navigation.
The procurement process will be undertaken on the basis of an open tender.  Evaluation will be on the basis of quality and costs, as set out in the Invitation to Tender document.                                                                                                                 
IMPORTANT INFORMATION: Suppliers should in first instance register themselves on the Kent Business Portal by following registration instructions www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk. All procurement documents are available on the KBP site attached to the published contract notice and available for suppliers to download and complete according to instructions contained. 

Any clarifications or questions must be submitted via the discussions area of the Kent Business Portal by no later than 14.00 hrs on 26 March 2020.

Completed tender documents must be submitted electronically via the Kent Business Portal by no later than 14.00 hrs on 1 April 2020.

title: Lift and Maintenance Services 2020 - 2024 - AWARD
description: The contract consists of 3 key areas of activities in maintaining the lifts listed within this document. These key areas of work will be divided into 3 Lots. A Contractor can apply to undertake 1 or all the Lots. By submitting a tender, all tenderers will commit to undertaking works in the area to which they are appointed. The 3 lots are as detailed below: - Lot 1 - High Rise, Lots 2 - Public Buildings and Schools and Lot 3 Residential.

title: ESPH CN Hailsham Town Centre Masterplan - Communication and Engagement (ESPH356) - AWARD
description:
Wealden District Council invited suppliers to submit a tender to provide Communications and Engagement Services to develop the Hailsham Aspires development Masterplan up to RIBA stage 2 and the submission of a validated outline planning application. It will look at how they can deliver an exciting and successful high quality area within the town centre, that comprises of retail, office / employment, residential, leisure, public realm, civic space and car parking, that both fulfils the needs and desires of Hailsham now, and in the future.
      
      We are inviting tenders from communication and engagement specialists who can efficiently engage with the local populace and stakeholders, to develop their ideas into deliverables.
      
      Closing date for submission of tenders in Noon, Friday 20th December 2019

title: The Outlook for Heritage 2020-2045 - AWARD
description:
Historic England is seeking horizon-scanning advice on the main drivers of change affecting the historic environment sector in England on both 10-year and 25-year timescales. This will help not only Historic England itself but also sector partners to anticipate and prepare for change so that heritage sector will be both more resilient and better able to plan strategically. We are as interested in drivers of societal change as we are in economic and environmental change.
      A three-year contract is envisaged under which the Year 1 report will be reviewed and refreshed annually.  We anticipate this to be a relatively quick piece of work. Our expectation, therefore, is that the final product will be submitted by 31 March 2020.

title: Adult Social Care and Health Policies and Practice Guides Project
description:
Reading Borough Council is looking to work with a suitable provider to refresh (and in some cases write) the Council's Directorate of Adult Social Care & Health (DASCH) policies and staff practice guides. The aim is to ensure that they are clear, informative and accessible whilst setting clear expectations of working practices for adult social care staff at all levels from senior managers to operational and business support staff.
      
      The Council wishes to gain the potential interest of experienced providers to deliver a refreshed suite of policies and staff practice guides for Adult Social Care & Health staff. The scope of the work is to review and develop the following:
      
      o Policies
      Overarching policies (documents that provide staff with the framework to meet statutory and legal requirements. E.g. Safeguarding, Finance and Moving & Handling) and
      o Practice Guides
      Practice guidelines (guidance that is sometimes called protocols / guides / frameworks / templates / forms or checklists). They cover work undertaken by certain staff or teams. Often it is the 'translation' of a policy or procedure into local language and within local workflows.

title: 1x New 44 tonne GCM 6x2 Tractor Unit (PGP/2020/930)
description:
Stoke on Trent City Council is inviting suitably qualified companies to submit tenders to supply for the outright purchase of 1x New 44 tonne (GCM) Gross Carrying Mass 6x2 Tractor Unit to work in a demanding bulk waste disposal service.

The successful tenderer supplying this tractor unit will be expected to liaise and work in conjunction with the successful supplier of the trailer so that both tractor and trailer have complete compatibility for air and electrical systems.

title: Quotation for the Meadows School - AWARD
description:
As the population of Sandwell grows so does the demand for school places which also includes the demand for places in our special schools. Having undertaken an independent review (EVOLVE Review 2015-2016) of Special Educational Need (SEN) provision in Sandwell, the council and the Joint Executive Head Teacher Group (JEG) has identified the need to increase SEN provision by using the full capacities of our schools, including special schools.  Consideration has been given to what additional provision is required and what can be better utilised within our existing schools.  The EVOLVE programme provides the strategic direction for building the extra capacity required across the Authority's education provision.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the Quotation document or other related documents.
      
      In Order To View a On-Line Questionnaire (if applicable) or Submit a Quotation, you will be required to` Opt-In`.   
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Friday 31 January  2020 at 15:00hrs

title: 9983 Study of Norwich's Office Accommodation
description: Norwich City Council wishes to commission a study of Norwich's office accommodation in order to better understand issues with current demand and supply of offices in different sectors, to identify sites that might be able to meet potential demand, provide evidence to support the preparation of business cases to invest in particular projects, to inform future planning policy and to assist the Council's consideration of an article 4 direction.

title: Invitation to Quote - Private Water Supplies sampling and analysis service for West Suffolk Council - AWARD
description:
Return deadline is  at 5pm on 14 February 2020.
      
      West Suffolk Council is inviting quotes for the collection, transportation and analysis of water samples from approximately 40 Private Water Supplies (PWS) within the district for a 3 year period with the option of an extension of a further 2 years.
      
      This opportunity is available in the Current Tenders area of www.suffolksourcing.uk. 
      
      Interested parties are invited to express their interest in order to gain full access to the tender documentation

title: Homecare Service in Lincolnshire
description: Lincolnshire County Council is undertaking a procurement exercise for its regulated Homecare, in line with Regulations 74-76 of the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (PCR), the Light Touch Regime, and pursuant to 2 / 8 Regulation 76(7) of the PCR. The Homecare services will meet the health and social care needs for adults aged 18 and over who are ordinarily resident in Lincolnshire. Care will be provided in the home (including Extra Care facilities) covering a range of care/support services to enable individuals to maximise their independence for as long as possible and maintain their safety. The contract will be divided into lots with a single, lead provider awarded in each of the twelve (12) areas. The main purpose of the contract will be to provide regulated domiciliary care services to individuals eligible for Social Care under the County Council. In the life of the contract it may also be necessary to purchase additional volume on behalf of local Heath bodies (CCGs) and if so this will be on the same terms as the Council service. A bidders event will be held on the afternoon of the 19th March 2020 in Lincoln, for those interested in attending please contact catherine.lees@lincolnshire.gov.uk

title: Opportunity To Join The Existing Framework Of Approved Suppliers For The Provision Of Domiciliary Care Services Start 1st June 2020
description:
St Helens Council is seeking to appoint accredited Organisations to join an existing Approved List for the Provision of Domiciliary Care Services.  
		
Those placed on the Approved List will be awarded a contract for the Provision of Domiciliary Care.

title: Energy Efficiency School Retrofit (DREeM) CPU3550
description:
Nottingham City Council is seeking tenders from suitably experienced and qualified contractors for a design & build solution to develop and install energy efficiency measures at Dunkirk Primary School, NG7 2LE.

This project has been part-financed by the European Regional Development Fund, and will be subject to conditions imposed by the funding body. The Contractor will be expected to comply with the relevant requirements and any associated regulations such as procurement, publicity, and eligibility criteria.

title: Secure IT Equipment Disposal and Ethical Recycling
description:
The Contractor will be required to undertake the secure disposal and ethical recycling of the Council's IT equipment, which include the collection of end user devises in batches over the course contract.  It is envisaged there will be two stages to the contract:

•	Initial rollout process which will run for approximately 18 months on the commencement of the contract which will consist of approximately 1,500 items.   
•	All other items identified outside of the initial rollout process.

The Contractor must ensure that the secure disposal and ethical recycling of all IT equipment and have the capacity to process the initial end users' devices.

description:
to be confirmed add briefing
      
      If you wish to express an interest in this project please ensure you are registered and logged into our Portal. The `Express Interest` button will only appear on the Tender Management page if you are logged in.
      
      Applicants are advised to ensure that they do not base their submission on discussions with any other member of Citizen Staff. If you require any clarification on matters contained within the Tender Documents, you must do so via Correspondence of the Citizen E-Procurement portal. Failure to observe this requirement may result in your bid being eliminated.
      
      Please note that in the case of tender clarifications where appropriate, answers will be circulated to all tenderers.
      
      NB: Should you require assistance or clarification on the use of In-Tend, please contact In-Tend support on 0845 557 8079 / +44 (0) 114 407 0065.
      
      You must upload your bid by using the `Attach Documents` button and your return must be submitted via 'Submit Return' on the Citizen E-Procurement portal before the deadline date provided in the project details. You will have the option to modify you bid up until the deadline.

title: 1442 - Replacement of Pool Air Handling Unit in QEII Leisure Centre at De Montfort University
description:
De Montfort University (DMU) is seeking to appoint a sole Contractor to strip out and remove the existing roof mounted Swimming Pool Ventilation Plant - comprising Air Handling Unit Plant and associated LTHW heating, controls, ductwork, electrical power and the installation of new replacement Air Handling Unit (AHU), LTHW heating. Controls, ductwork, electrical power and all necessary associated support systems, walkway gantries and trimmer steelwork.  
      
      Full details of the requirements are set out in the Tender documents.

title: PAN2325 - Carriageway Surfacing
description:
Leicester City Council is the highway authority for the city of Leicester and is responsible for the management, maintenance and development of approximately 790 km of public highway and 220 highway structures.
The main purpose of this Framework Contract is to award to a minimum of two and a maximum of four surfacing Contractors who will support LCC with their resources and expertise to help deliver numerous highway maintenance and development schemes within the city of Leicester.

title: GB-Poole: supply of  SECURITY MAINTENANCE FOR ACCESS CONTROL, CCTV AND INTRUDER ALARMS
description:
Purpose
      To establish a single source supplier for the following:
      
      Maintain and repair the door access control equipment
      Maintain and repair the Security CCTV equipment 
      Maintain and repair Patient monitoring cameras in the Radiotherapy Department
      Maintenance and repair Intruder Alarms
      
      Timescale

title: HCC - 09/19 - The Provision of a Meals on Wheels Service - AWARD
description:
Following a procurement, Hertfordshire County Council has awarded a contract for the Provision of Meals on Wheels Service.
      
      This is an award notice and this opportunity is now closed. 
      
      The successful supplier is - 
      
      Hertfordshire Community Meals Limited  (operating as Hertfordshire Independent Living Service)
      
      The estimated total value of the contract is £7,339,500 and is the original estimated value of the full procurement.
      
      The contract will remain for an initial core term of 5 years, with the option to extend the period(s) up to a maximum further 2 years, at the Council's sole discretion.
      
      Contract Notice Number: 2019/S 187-454931
      Award Notice Number: 2020/S 023-052462

title: GB-Leeds: R/3704 Supply of a Force and Vibration Measuring Plate
description:
Notice of award of a Force and Vibration Measuring Plate and Associated Software System. 
      
      
      The purpose of the Force and Vibration Measuring Plate and Software System is to enable the characterisation of the feel of flat materials, in particular textiles, fabric, paper, film and art materials.

title: RE05866 - NON- HIGHWAYS RESURFACING PROGRAMME 2020/201
description: The works comprise the resurfacing and full construction of paths, roads, playgrounds, car parks and the like across the city. Associated works could include fencing, drainage, the construction of steps and ramps and the installation of street furniture. Sites will be released to the Contractor on Works Orders and could range from a single Order for a patch repair (minimum value £500) to an order for a new car park or multiple sites across the city (maximum value £150,000). No continuity of work can be guaranteed and the Contractor will be expected to mobilise within 4 weeks of receiving an Order. The Contract Period will initially be for 12 months up to 25th June 2021 with a provision to extend a further 36 months subject to annual review. The reviews will take place in March and the respective 12 months extension will be dependent on budget availability and continuing good performance by the Contractor. Contractor performance will be measured using the KPI's outlined in Appendix H (see Preliminaries Item 1.8.6.8). The quantities in the Schedule of Works with Approximate Quantities are based on the first 12 months budget only. Following a successful review and contract extension the Contractors rates will be subject to an annual inflationary adjustment (see Preliminaries Item 31.04). The Contractor shall allow in his rates for any additional costs in relation to out of sequence or uneconomical working methods and disruption due to the aforementioned criteria.

title: Extended Activities, 11 week Play Scheme and Toy Loan Service for Families of Children with Disabilities and Additional Needs ('Short Break' Services)
description:
Hartlepool Borough Council are seeking tender submissions from appropriately qualified and experienced organisations with the capacity to deliver extended activities and play scheme provision together with a specialist toy loan service for families of children with disabilities and additional needs living in the Hartlepool area.
This service will contribute to the 'Breaks for Carers of Disabled Children' Regulations (2011) and The 'Local Offer of Services' as detailed in Chapter 4 of the 'Special Educational Needs and Disability Code of Practice 0 - 25 Years' (Statutory Guidance).
The service will also contribute to the outcomes specified in the 2008 'Children and Young Persons Act' (s25), which details the statutory duty of local authorities to assist individuals who care for disabled children to continue to do so as effectively as possible.                                Organisations wishing to register an interest and download the tender documentation, should apply via the NEPO Portal only.
https://procontract.due-north.com
Registration is Free.
All completed tender documentation must be returned via the NEPO Portal Only and by no later than 14:00hrs on MONDAY 9th MARCH 2020

title: The Outlook for Heritage 2020-2045
description:
Historic England is seeking horizon-scanning advice on the main drivers of change affecting the historic environment sector in England on both 10-year and 25-year timescales. This will help not only Historic England itself but also sector partners to anticipate and prepare for change so that heritage sector will be both more resilient and better able to plan strategically. We are as interested in drivers of societal change as we are in economic and environmental change.
      A three-year contract is envisaged under which the Year 1 report will be reviewed and refreshed annually.  We anticipate this to be a relatively quick piece of work. Our expectation, therefore, is that the final product will be submitted by 31 March 2020.

title: Canterbury Park & Ride Bus Service - Diesel Fuelled Fleet
description: Canterbury City Council ("the Council") wishes to select and appoint a suitable supplier for the provision of a Park and Ride Bus Service - Diesel Fueled Fleet and invites tenderers to submit a tender to meet the Council's requirements.The Contract is anticipated to commence 5 October 2020 and will continue for a period of 7 years (unless terminated early in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Contract), and may be extended for a period of up to 1 year subject to the satisfactory performance of the Services by the Contractor and at the Council's entire discretion. Any such extension shall be on the same terms and conditions of this Contract and shall be subject to mutual agreement in writing.

title: Tender for the Supply, Installation & Maintenance of Long Range Lanterns
description:
The Board has a requirement to purchase, Installation & Maintenance of Long Range Lanterns under a Framework Agreement for the period between 2019 to 2023 exact dates will be dependent on the completion of the tender exercise and the Boards operational requirements, these Long Range Lanterns will be used in Butt of Lewis, Cape Wrath, Esha Ness, Fair Isle North and Flannan Islands. With the initial purchase and installation of Butt of Lewis and Cape Wrath Long Range Lanterns to the specification as detailed in the tender document. The contract will include maintenance and support as detailed within the tender documents.
      The specification of the remaining three (3) Long Range Lanterns for Esha Ness, Fair Isle North & Flannan Islands will meet the tender specification but some of the characteristics of each lantern will change depending on the Boards operational requirements and will be confirm at a later date with the successful tenderer

title: QIP641 - Ipswich to Whitehouse Primary School, Ipswich - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      Transport required from Colchester Road, Ipswich, IP4 4SJ to Whitehouse Primary School, Marlow Road, Ipswich, IP1 5JN (4 seat vehicle).
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is 1100 on Friday 10th January 2020. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is 1600 on Thursday 9th January 2020 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: Rough Sleeper Initiatives Step Beds
description:
The Authority has been the recipient of Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (MHLCG) Rough Sleeper grants since 2017, targeted at meeting the needs of rough sleepers, or those at high risk of rough sleeping. The Authority is seeking to tender for the provision of several interlinking interventions targeted at meeting the complex needs of this group to support them to move from street to sustainable home, subject to funding being approved. This opportunity is available in the `Current Tenders` area of www.suffolksourcing.uk. 
      
      Interested parties are invited to express their interest in order to gain full access to the tender documentation

title: 0-25 Family Health Service
description: The Council is seeking to engage a provider who will deliver a combined and cohesive service for all children, young people, and their families (0-19) who are resident or attending school in the Durham local authority area should receive the Healthy Child Programme. The service will be available for young people with a special educational need (SEND) and/or disability and those who are Care Leavers up to the age of 25. Transitional support to young people into further education and low-level mental health and emotional wellbeing support for young people aged 19-25 will be available to young people through community support.

title: Clapham Manor Primary School ~ Cleaning Services Tender
description:
The successful Supplier will be required to provide cleaning services at Clapham Manor Primary School, Belmont Road, Clapham, London, SW4 0BZ.
      
      There are approximately 420 children aged 5-11 years split over two sites: the primary school is located on the main site and the nursery on the second site.
      Following a building extension in 2006, the overall design re-used an existing 125-year Victorian school by giving it a new lease of life by adding a new four-storey extension joined to the existing school with a glazed link building, providing access at each level. The ground floor of the new building is glazed, and three stories above are each marked by six bands of coloured glazing. The new building was nominated for the RIBA Stirling Prize, and came second.

title: Cambridge City Council - Building Cleaning
description:
Cambridge City Council (The Council) is calling for bids to fulfill its building cleaning services for the city across three core lots and two additional specialist cleaning contract lots, resulting in the following five lot structure as follows: 

•	Lot 1: Administration, commercial buildings, community centres and operational buildings
•	Lot 2: Public toilets
•	Lot 3: City Homes communal areas and sheltered housing schemes
•	Lot 4: Multi-storey car parks
•	Lot 5: Window cleaning
Suppliers are invited to bid for one or more of the five lots, in any combination.  
Please note the current arrangement is with a single supplier and as such the exact nature of the TUPE requirements and who transfer to whom will not be known until the selection process is complete and the number of successful tenderers has been identified.
A contract term is initially 3 years, with an option to extend by 2 years then up to 2 further years, if the supplier is performing satisfactorily, and the service can be shown to continue to provide best value to the Council; this gives a maximum possible contract length of 7 years.
Assessment - price: quality tender assessment split of 40% price: 60% quality
The current contract is due to end on the 19th June 2020 and it is anticipated that the start date of the new contract will be begin on the current contract end date (20th June 2020).

title: In Lieu of Short-Term Enablement
description: The In Lieu of Short-Term Enablement Service is for adults who have been assessed as requiring a period of intermediate care whilst determining their longer term support needs.  The Service is designed to provide a high quality locality based intermediate care service.  The Service will provide flexible, intensive, consistent and integrated short term support to enable an adult to remain at home or return to their normal place of residence.  The Service will provide support to adults to maximise their independence and achieve their optimum level of function, usually in their own home (but support could also be delivered within other settings including a relative's home, a residential setting or temporary accommodation), including a rapid response when required.  This could be to enable an early and safe transfer from hospital, to prevent admission to hospital, or to meet an immediate support requirement within the community.

This could be to enable an early and safe transfer from hospital, to prevent admission to hospital, or to meet an immediate support requirement within the community.", "supplyChain": false, "hasEnquiries": null, "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2019-12-11T00:00:00Z"}, "awardCriteria": null, "submissionMethod": null, "xClassifications": {"isSuitableForSme": true, "isSuitableForVco": true, "ojeuContractType": "Services"}, "procurementMethod": null, "eligibilityCriteria": null, "awardCriteriaDetails": null, "submissionMethodDetails": "Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section.", "procurementMethodDetails": "Open procedure", "procurementMethodRationale": ""}, "language": "en-GB", "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "publishedDate": "2020-05-12T02:07:34.793950+00:00"}

title: Procurement of Research Vessel with Enforcement Capabilities
description:
Eastern IFCA are seeking to procure a research vessel with enforcement capabilities. A new build project or arefurbished second hand vessel would be considered with either option providing a demonstrably capable seaboat with a proven design. 
      Norfolk County Council would like to engage with the market and meet with potential bidders on a face to face basis to further understand options for delivery. Meetings will be held in Norwich week commencing 6th April. Please use the correspondence facility to leave your name and phone number and I will ring you to book your appointment. If you have any questions, please send them in by 30th March. It would be useful if you could indicate if you are interested in refurbishment of second hand vessel, new build or both.

title: DPS Adult Education
description:
Adult Education Budget (AEB) is allocated to providers by the Education & Skills Funding Agency (ESFA) on an annual basis. Cheshire West and Chester Council receives AEB funding for the purpose of supporting flexible tailored programmes of learning targeted at those furthest from engaging in learning or the workplace. In providing accessible high-quality education and skills provision Cheshire West & Chester Council offers its residents opportunities to gain the skills needed for entering and sustaining work, an apprenticeship/traineeship, or other further learning. 
Through this Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) - under the light touch regime, Cheshire West & Chester Council (CW&C) is looking for the opportunity to develop new relationships with post-16 skills and training providers. Providers should focus on progression outcomes for learners and ensure provision, even at lower levels, is clearly aligned to the needs of employers and growth sectors within the borough.   All documents are available on The Chest, www.the-chest.org.uk   Please register your interest and download the documents.
buyer: Cheshire west and Chester Borough Council

title: Supply, Delivery and Installation of Furniture and Other Goods for Children's Residential Homes
description: The council's aspiration is to re-profile its existing 4 and 5-bed children's homes to favour smaller homes.  These homes will more closely replicate an ordinary family home and life whilst meeting the placement requirements of children and young people with complex needs, which cannot be met through foster care or other family placements. The council will do this by redesigning its children's homes to look and feel like real family homes and avoid institutional style furnishings to ensure a wider range of placement options available for its children.

title: VEHICLE BODYWORK REPAIR SERVICES
description:
The London Borough of Bromley ("the Council") is inviting tenders for the provision of Vehicle Bodywork Repair Services under a contract to support its vehicle fleet operation                                                                                                                                         
 The service required is to carry out accidental damage and other bodywork repairs to a fleet of lease cars and light commercial vehicles operated by the Council, which could be driveable or non-driveable at the point that work is required.

title: Passenger Transport Services Framework
description:
Bromley Council is inviting offers from transport and taxi service providers (taxis, minibuses, coaches), to deliver these services to local residents. We are keen to secure services to support wheelchair accessibility.
The Council's Passenger Transport Services Framework will provide transport services to children, young people and adults, both with and without additional needs.
Clients could have a range of needs including; being wheelchair users and individuals with mobility needs, learning needs, sensory impairment, hidden disabilities, or a combination of these. In some cases, a passenger assistant will be required.
The type of vehicle that can be used is flexible as long as it meets the required specification.
We want to engage with suppliers who will:
- Work closely with us and understand our needs.
- Demonstrate flexibility and react quickly to changing service demands to support changes to the Council's requirements and our residents.
- Be innovative and efficient in the delivery of passenger transport services.
- Conduct their business in a socially responsible and ethical way.                                                                                         
Currently approximately 900 children, young people and adults over the age of 18 attend over 100 different venues, with 37 of these situated within the Borough and 63 are situated out of the Borough. The majority of these passengers (~75%) attend venues in the Borough. Educational establishments operate throughout the academic year from September to July with half term and term breaks. Arrival times vary from 8AM to 9AM and departure times vary from 2:30PM to 4PM. Further to this, approximately 210 adult clients attend 12 day activity venues. These services are required throughout the calendar year (closed bank holidays) and operate between 7:45AM to 10:30AM in the morning, and 2:45PM to 5:30PM in the afternoon.                                                      
The Council is reopening this opportunity for a limited period in conformity with 76 (4) of the Public Contracts Regulation 2015 due to feedback received from a number of tenderers regarding technical issues with receiving notifications about this opportunity.

PREVIOUS APPLICANTS NEED NOT APPLY
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
The tender opportunity will be run through the London Tenders Procurement Portal and you will need to register your company with the portal as soon as possible (if you have not already done so) at www.londontenders.org to ensure that you are able to access and submit the relevant documents online. This opportunity will be conducted under the Light Touch Regime.

description:
Gentoo Group Ltd has a requirement for the construction of 44 residential units for affordable rent with associated infrastructure and landscaping on land on Avenue Vivian/Rose Avenue, Fence-houses, Sunderland.

Prosper Procurement Ltd ("PROSPER") is managing this procurement on behalf of the Contracting Body.

PLEASE NOTE: This is an award notice following a Call for Competition under a Dynamic Purchasing System and this contract has been let.

title: City Typology Analysis of six African Cities
description:
Connected Places Catapult is running a Request for Proposal Tender process to award a contract for the following services:
Benchmarking of six cities to set and explain fundamental context, logic for interventions, identify particular trends, needs and opportunities. Provides foundation for engagement with partners in each city.

Detailed analysis of three cities in Kenya and three in South Africa to provide clear overlay of opportunities, potential partners, local advantages and skillsets to draw from, and identify future deployment impact.

Development of Urban Innovation success factors to guide whole process, monitor and analyse proposed deployments, engage players with real-world lessons.  Further and complete information can be found in the information document on the Procurement Portal at this link: https://procontract.due-north.com/Procurer/Advert/View?advertId=d323fbd1-fc32-ea11-80fc-005056b64545&fromAdvertEvent=True

title: Provision of Special Educational Needs Transport in the Ulverston area (H6210)
description:
Tenders are invited for the provision of passenger transport services by taxi, minibus and/or coach in relation to Special Educational Needs in the Ulverston area

The minimum number of seats required is 4 (Passenger assistant required)

You must refer to the "Instructions for Tendering" prior to submitting your bid. 

All submissions must be uploaded and returned via the Chest 

The documents that must be included in your submission are:
		
		Information and Declaration
		Tender Pricing Submission 
		Daily timetable template 

The deadline for submission is:

10:00 Wednesday 8 January 2020


PLEASE ENSURE YOU HAVE UPLOADED ALL THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTS AS FAILURE TO DO SO MAY RESULT IN YOUR TENDER SUBMISSION NOT BEING CONSIDERED
