title: GB-Hemel Hempstead: Faraday & Edison Court Boiler Works
description:
The Works comprise replacement boilers and flues, replacement gas risers and supply and associated internal works to 31 no flats at Faraday Court and Edison Court, Watford, Hertfordshire. WD18 6AD
      
      These upgrading works are defined as running external gas pipework from the position of the external floor mounted gas meter boxes, to the position of the gas supply pipework for the boiler point. The programme of the work will be agreed with the successful contractor prior to commencement on site.
      The contractor is to allow for having adequate installation teams working on the site simultaneously, working on batches of houses on different parts of the site. This is to minimise disruption to the residents.

title: ISO Certification
description:
NLB are certified to BS EN ISO 9001 2015, BS EN ISO14001 2015 and BS EN ISO 45001 2018 (valid until 30 October 2021). The Information and Communication Technology (ICT) department are certified to BS EN 27001 2013 (valid to 7th April 2022). 
      
      We require that a transfer / revalidation of these standards is undertaken by the successful bidder at the outset of the contract in order to enable us to maintain our current levels of assurance.  The associated (follow-on) Periodic audits should also be combined / integrated audits,  undertaken by suitably quialfied auditors and approved to audit against 9001,14001 and 45001 management standards, for optimal intergeneration.
      
      With additional audit cycles against 27001 again by suitably qualified certification body.
      
      Full details of the requirements are detailed within the tender documents.

title: Provision of Childcare for 2 to 4-year olds in Nottinghamshire County Council Properties 2019
description:
In response to the need to maintain and increase additional Early Years childcare places for eligible 2, 3 and 4 year olds Nottinghamshire County Council (NCC) is seeking Early Years providers to provide places at three NCC sites.

Providers must have "Good" or "Outstanding" Ofsted inspection gradings from the Private, Voluntary and Independent sector (PVI), Schools, Academies and Registered Childminders may submit tenders to establish childcare provision within the three purpose built NCC owned and maintained properties.

Open Days
It is strongly recommended  that prospective applicants visit the site(s) they may be interested in before submitting applications.  The Open Days have been arranged as detailed below;

Lot No	Site	Open Day Details
1	Summer House Children's Centre, Clare Road, Sutton-in-Ashfield, Nottinghamshire, NG17 5BB	Monday, 7 October 2019 at 13.00-16.00
2	Sherwood East Children's Centre, 1a Braemar Road, Clipstone, Nottinghamshire, NG19 0LL
	Monday, 14 October 2019 at 12.30-16.30
3	Bassetlaw Rural Children's Centre, 50 High Street, Misterton, Doncaster, South Yorkshire, DN10 4BU	Friday, 18 October 2019 at 10.00-15.00

To book a place please contact:   
Alison Miller - Early Childhood Contracts and Performance Officer
Early Childhood Services
Nottinghamshire County Council
a: County Hall, West Bridgford, Nottingham, NG2 7QP
t:  0115 977 2494
m: 07765 285074
e: Alison.miller@nottscc.gov.uk
General Enquiries:  
e: earlychildhoodservices@nottscc.gov.uk

title: Coaching for GP trainees in targeted strategies to encourage self-reflective and self-directed learning
description:
The PSU requires a provider who can coach GP trainees in targeted strategies to encourage self-reflective and self-directed learning. The ultimate goal of the support is to improve GP trainee pass rates, specifically targeting the AKT and CSA exams. 

This support should be delivered by a provider with substantial knowledge of the exam requirements for GP trainees. They will need to also understand the challenges facing GP trainees throughout their training programme both in hospital and practise environments.

title: Agriculture, Environment and Animal Care Route Review
description:
The Institute is seeking support to organise and facilitate five regional workshops to feed into the Agriculture, Environment and Animal Care Route Review.
The workshops will supplement our public consultation and ensure we receive a wide range of feedback on the Agriculture, Environment and Animal Care Occupational Map and the standards in scope of the Review. 
The workshops will take place after our public consultation has closed, so there will be an opportunity to pick up on any insights from our high-level analysis.  However, the focus should be on getting input from stakeholders who have not responded to our public consultation.

title: WITHDRAWN - AutoCAD & BIMS Suite Cymap and Cylink Licences and Support
description: City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council (the Council) is seeking to appoint a suitably experienced and qualified Provider (the Provider) for support and maintenance of their Autodesk AutoCAD & BIMS Suite & Cymap and Cylink Licenses and support. The proposed contract will be for an initial duration of three (3) years with a possible two (2) twelve (12) month extensions. If you are interested in submitting a response, please go to the Yortender portal on Procontract to access the tender documentation; https://procontract.due-north.com. If you have any clarification questions, please submit these via the portal and not by email.

title: TC1007 Framework for Measured and Unmeasured Water Charges
description:
Manchester City Council is prepared to receive tenders for Measured and Unmeasured Water Charges which will be subject to the information, specification and tender package enclosed. 

The purpose of this tender is to appoint one supplier to form a framework water services agreement.   

The framework period will be for 1 year with the option to extend for up to an additional 3  years. It is intended for the framework to commence June 2020.

The £20 million value specified in the OJEU notice are for Manchester only and for the potential full 4 years of the framework. The annual value is £5 million. Should other bodies use this framework we expect that the 4 year value will be £30 million.

Justification for Competition with Negotiation as per Regulation 26(4). The needs of the Contracting Authority cannot be met without adaptation of readily available solutions. It requires design and innovation solutions. Due to the infancy of the market, the technical specifications cannot be established with sufficient prevision by the contracting authority with reference to a standard, European Technical Assessment, common technical specification or technical reference.

title: Extra Care Rostering, Billing and Payments System
description:
Housing 21 are looking to appoint a Supplier to provide an Extra Care Rostering, Billing and Payments System. The high level requirements are:
      
      •Easy to use 'drag and drop' style rostering system
      •Integrated system for auto production of pay and billing based on the roster
      •System configuration based on each service contract / staff arrangement and means to provide aggregated management information and reporting
      •Reconciliation of pay and billing to understand and improve productivity
      •Remove onerous spreadsheets to free up front line to focus on quality of services
      •Robust data and ability to reconcile outputs to provide meaningful management information
      •Automation of pay and billing inputs to improve efficiency and cash flow management
      •Significant reduction in manual inputting in back office

title: Mail Services
description:
The North Eastern Universities Purchasing Consortia are leading on a process to award a framework covering both Domestic and International Mail Services for the Higher Education Sector in the UK
      The purpose of this PIN notice is to invite interest in supplier engagement which will take place in Leeds on the 2nd March 2020.
      The supplier engagement will be used to shape the tender process and to gain knowledge in order to reflect sector requirements.

title: Public Analyst Service
description:
Suffolk County Council are currently out to tender for the provision of a Public Analyst Service for the analysis of food and animal feed on behalf of Suffolk Trading Standards.
      
      This opportunity is available in the `Current Tenders` area of portal. Interested parties are invited to express their interest to gain full access to the tender documentation.
      
      The deadline date for submissions of the tender is 5 February 2020 at 12:00 noon. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is 27 January 2020 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: Replacement of the existing passenger lift at 37 Tanner Row, York Y01 6WP
description:
Historic England Replacement of the existing passenger lift at 37 Tanner Row, York Y01 6WP
      
      37 Tanner Row is a double-fronted five storey building (basement, ground and first to third floors) that was originally a hotel and later converted to commercial offices. We are looking for a contractor to design, development and implementation of all the works required for the lift replacement. Please see separate document, Replacement of the existing passenger lift for more information.

title: GB-London: RMG Washroom Services
description:
Royal Museums Greenwich (the National Maritime Museum) is an executive non-departmental public body, sponsored by the Department for Digital, Culture, Media & Sport (DCMS).
      
      The Museum's estate includes a range of buildings that sit within the Maritime Greenwich World Heritage site and these include the National Maritime Museum (NMM), Queen's House (QH), Cutty Sark (CS) and Royal Observatory Greenwich (ROG). A new collections and conservation centre is based at a separate site in Kidbrooke. The buildings and their associated services are maintained to a high standard that is worthy of a leading visitor destination. Toilet provision is provided at various locations across the estate.
      
      With over 2 million visitors a year it is essential that the sites are presented to a quality standard, and that works are undertaken in a safe and sustainable manner. 
      
      The RMG is committed to providing access to its collections for the greatest number of visitors and to provide the highest possible quality of displays, exhibitions and services.
      
      At RMG we recognise that environmental protection is one of the most important issues facing the world today. We're committed to working in environmentally sustainable ways, applying the principles of sustainable development for the benefit of current and future generations, both locally and globally.

title: West Lancashire Borough Council - Community Grants - Independent Living
description:
Background

Following a review of its support to voluntary organisations, the Council is supporting services to improve independent living (elderly, young families, vulnerable, veterans, residents with disabilities) and their families within the Borough through the provision of a Grant.  The Grant will commence from 1 April 2020 for a maximum 3 year period, subject to annual budget processes and satisfactory progress in meeting the outcomes and the indicative measures by the successful Bidder.

Outcomes
Support for the elderly, young families, vulnerable, veterans, residents with disabilities and their families has been identified as an area of critical need in order to support independent living, resilience and health & wellbeing of our residents.  The Council's investment is expected to help to deliver the following outcomes:-

To improve the resilience of the elderly, young families, vulnerable, veterans, residents with disabilities and their families
To reduce potential demand for crisis services by early intervention and protection
To Improve health & wellbeing of our residents
Support networking/partnership arrangements between local/national organisations with particular emphasis on local service providers 
To engage with Veterans/Service leavers
To support digital inclusion and assist service users to become more digitally literate
Increased number of appropriate referrals into employability programmes for West Lancashire.
Increased number of appropriate referrals into health and wellbeing services for West Lancashire.

Tender documents are available via 'The Chest' https://www.the-chest.org.uk   Bidders should visit the 'Current opportunities' page and then click on the drop down menu for 'West Lancashire Borough Council' to access the tender opportunity.

Tenders must be submitted by 9/12/2019 2.00pm via https://the-chest.org.uk.

Clarifications in relation to this requirement must be submitted via the messaging system within 'The Chest' https://www.the-chest.org.uk by 03/12/19 2.00pm.

title: 2019-01-06 12 noon QSC079 Hellsdon, Norwich to Chalk Hill School, Sudbury  - AWARD
description:

       QSC079 Hellsdon, Norwich to Chalk Hill School, Sudbury  (4 seats, no passenger assistant required - route operates on Monday AM and Friday PM only)
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is Monday 6th January 2020 at 12 noon. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is Friday 3th January 2020 at 5pm which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: The Supply Of European Printed Music to the British Library
description:
The material required under this contract is printed music published and commercially
    available primarily in Europe ranging from editions and facsimiles of a high scholarly standard (including full critical
    apparatus) to less scholarly editions of a high standard aimed towards the performer. A small number of orders may

title: Consultants reports on non-road mobile machinery (NRMM) and solid fuel emissions to air. Evidence Base Technical Reports
description: The Council intends to appoint a Consultant to complete two separate evidence based technical reports. One report will provide evidence on the scale of pollution emissions from NRMM and use this evidence to determine approaches to reduce these emissions effectively. The other report is to determine the scale of biomass use within Bristol, to quantify the associated health impacts and to develop appropriate interventions to reduce emissions.

Verge Maintenance and Weed Control

•	Lot 2 - South Area (Barrow Borough Council and South Lakeland District Council)
•	Lot 3 - West Area (Allerdale District Council and Copeland Borough Council)
Arboriculture

Tenderers are invited to bid for one or more Lots. All tenderers should clearly indicate which Lots they are bidding for in their submission.

title: Low Cost Metal Additive Manufacturing Technology - AWARD
description:
The University of Warwick Manufacturing Group has a requirement for Low Cost Metal Additive Manufacturing Technology.
      
      The deadline for this tender is 13th December 2019 at 12 noon.
      
      In order to express interest in this opportunity please go to the University of Warwick In-Tend supplier portal (https://in-tendhost.co.uk/universityofwarwick).
      
      The University of Warwick is not a contracting authority for the purposes of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (as amended) and its procurement activities are not subject to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or the obligations under the European Public Procurement Directives, including the European Remedies Directive. Advertisement of any contract in the Official Journal of the European Union or Contracts Finder is at the sole discretion of the University and is undertaken on a voluntary basis with no implied obligation to comply with the procurement legislation.

title: Medium-Scale (£15k - £225k) Building & Refurbishment Works for Blackpool Housing Company Owned Properties
description:
Blackpool Housing Company (BHC) are looking to appoint around 12 Contractors on a framework to provide medium-scale building works and refurbishment work to Blackpool Housing Company properties. The Company has an existing arrangement for small-scale, low-value works up to £15,000 but this contract will cover larger jobs estimated at costing between £15k - £225k.  
This current round (issued February 2020) is to appoint 5 Contractors to fill spaces on the existing framework.  Details in the following link: https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=033376ff-ed80-e711-80e4-005056b64545

title: Teviot Estate Regeneration
description:
Poplar HARCA is procuring a JV development partner to deliver a regeneration scheme to build approximately 1,800 - 2,500 homes at the Teviot Estate site.
      The regeneration must protect the close and strong community spirit, and deliver high quality homes, beautiful open spaces that feel welcoming and safe, and suitable infrastructure such as local shops.
      Poplar HARCA is responsible for the procurement, but the London Borough of Tower Hamlets (LBTH) is also a named contracting authority as it may later contribute land to the project and rely on the contract to deliver its regeneration outcomes.
      Only the land owned by Poplar HARCA is guaranteed within the scope of the contract. The contract will contain provisions which allow for the inclusion of the LBTH at a later date. No exclusivity is granted and it is at the sole discretion of Poplar HARCA and the LBTH to include such land. More information on the possible inclusion of the land is set out in the MOI.

title: GB-Leeds: Z/3783 SCAPE 2.01 - Lab Cooling
description:
Lab 2.01 experiences temperature fluctuations due mainly to the solar and the appliance heat gains.
      
      Lab temperatures should be maintained at 21C (comfort cooling control conditions) in line with the UoL space heating and cooling policy and the energy management policy. 
      
      Initial proposals are to manage the heat gains with a split type "DX" cooling system. Fan coils will be installed within the lab and refrigerant pipe work will connect the indoor units to the outdoor condensing unit(s). The outdoor unit will be positioned on a lower mezzanine flat roof.

title: PROJ10012 Strengthening the teaching of primary school mathematics in Malawi
description:
DFID Malawi's new education programme aims to help more Malawian girls and boys progress through the education system and achieve better learning outcomes, thereby contributing to social and economic development. A core component of this work is focused on supporting the Malawi Government to improve the quality of early grade mathematics teaching, so all children are supported to learn and master the basics. DFID Malawi intends to work with suppliers who are committed to improving the quality education in Malawi and strengthening government systems for long lasting sustainability.
      
      This programme aims to improve student learning outcomes in mathematics, so girls and boys have a solid foundation in basic skills to succeed in the rest of their schooling and fulfil their potential. By the end of the programme we hope this will contribute towards improved service delivery, so more girls and boys, especially from disadvantaged backgrounds, progress through and complete primary school with measurable improvements in their learning outcomes. This component is part of a larger education programme. Other components include: (i) strengthening Malawi's education system by providing technical assistance to district councils to ensure they have the finance and human resource capacity to oversee primary schools and teachers, (ii) improving the availability and use of education data for evidence based policy and planning; (iii) and making the education system more equitable, by providing targeted support to marginalised girls to support them to finish primary school with improved learning outcomes and transition to secondary school.
      
      The supplier will provide technical assistance to facilitate the revision of the mathematics curriculum for lower primary (standards 1-4), develop corresponding teaching and learning materials, design teacher training strategies (including school-based support structures), rigorously pilot the new materials and training strategies, document impact, refine the materials and training strategies, and then oversee the national scale-up.
      
      (Please note the EME and PIN for thsi tender was published under PO8419)

title: Underwater Bridge Works 2020
description:
***Please view oppounity available via The Chest    https://www.the-chest.org.uk/    ***                                                                      The County Council is responsible for around 1,800 highway bridges, 1,000 footbridges, over 500 retaining walls and over 900 culverts. Many of these structures are founded below water level and are prone to erosion and scour damage. This was most significantly demonstrated during the storm Desmond floods when a number of bridges were destroyed or needed to be closed due to the severe action of the flood waters.
As part of its capital works programme the Council undertakes routine underwater inspections of a proportion of its structures assets each year to identify and repair any defects that if left unattended could result in structural collapse and risk to the public. 
This term contract is for underwater inspection, underwater repairs and debris recovery for bridges and structures across Cumbria. The contract will comprise annual routine inspection and repairs works with additional reactive works commissioned through task orders.
The agreement will be based on the NEC3 term contract amended in accordance with the Highway Maintenance Efficiency Programme guidance.

Many of these structures are founded below water level and are prone to erosion and scour damage. This was most significantly demonstrated during the storm Desmond floods when a number of bridges were destroyed or needed to be closed due to the severe action of the flood waters.
As part of its capital works programme the Council undertakes routine underwater inspections of a proportion of its structures assets each year to identify and repair any defects that if left unattended could result in structural collapse and risk to the public. 
This term contract is for underwater inspection, underwater repairs and debris recovery for bridges and structures across Cumbria. The contract will comprise annual routine inspection and repairs works with additional reactive works commissioned through task orders.
The agreement will be based on the NEC3 term contract amended in accordance with the Highway Maintenance Efficiency Programme guidance.

title: Supply and Installation of double glazed aluminium windows at Hindlip CofE Primary School Fernhill Heath Worcester
description:
Place Partnership Ltd. on behalf of Worcestershire County Council invite suitable, qualified and experienced Window Instalation Contractors to carry out the replacement of windows at Hindlip CofE  Primary School Droitwich Road Fernhill Heath Worcester WR3 8JR
      Supply and Installation of double glazed aluminium windows to meet the criteria in the specifications. All windows are to match the profiles previously installed at the school
      Site Visits:
      Ascertain the nature of the site, access thereto and all local conditions and restrictions likely to affect the execution of the Works.
      Arrangements / Appointments for a site visit: Contact the Place Partnership Project Manager:  Steve Wharrad  Mobile. 077100 68908 Email: steve.wharrad@placepartnership.co.uk
      Failure to book a site visit appointment will result in access to the site being refused.
      The works to be carried out and completed between Monday 6th April 2020 with completion by 24th April 2020.
      The form of contract will be the JCT Minor Works Building Contract 2016.
      To register your interest or to download all tender documents please visit the Worcestershire County Council e-procurement portal at: www.in-tendhost.co.uk/worcestershire
      
      It is on this basis that we invite suitable contractors to provide a full turn-key project compliant quotation, to deliver this project within set time scales.
      All tender documents must be uploaded to the portal by the due date as late returns will not be accepted.
      Tenders and supporting documents shall be in English and any contract subsequently entered in to shall be subject to English Law.
      
      Please note that the Supplier is responsible for obtaining all information necessary for the preparation of the tender submission. All cost, expenses and liabilities incurred by the Supplier in connection with the preparation of their submission, the Form of Tender and Pricing Schedule shall be borne by the Supplier.
      
      No tender can be considered to be accepted until such time as the particular tenderer has been notified. If a tender is accepted there will not be a contract until the Authority's offer has been accepted by the tenderer.
      
      Worcestershire County Council reserve the right not to award a contract in full or in part.

title: PRJ-875 Tower Hamlets Individual Placement and Support
description:
Individual Placement and Support (IPS) is an evidence based model of employment support for people with
mental health problems.
Tower Hamlets CCG and Mental Health and Employment Partnership have jointly commissioned IPS services
in Tower Hamlets since April 2016 and are now in need of a new IPS contract from April 2020 after the current
contract ends. Over four years this service will deliver support to over 1000 individuals, with high fidelity to the
principles of Individual Placement and Support (IPS), an evidence-based model promoted by the Centre for
Mental Health in the UK.
The overall aim of this service is to support people with severe mental illness to achieve paid, competitive
employment in a fulfilling, sustainable way. Through this, we aim to support adults in Tower Hamlets to:
• Recover more rapidly and effectively from their mental illness
• Build social connections and support networks
• Gain financial independence
• Improve their general health and wellbeing

title: Fit-Out of Historic England's Bristol Office - Finzels Reach - AWARD
description:
Historic England has taken out a 14 year lease for a 1st floor 6,000 sq. ft. open plan office space within the Finzels Reach complex within Temple Meads, Bristol.
      
      A design process has already been undertaken to develop a modern office space to accommodate staff from both Historic England and its sister organization "English Heritage Trust" to provide a space to support the work of both organisations in the Southwest region of England.
      
      This tender is for the "fit-out" of that design, which incorporates modern ways of working, in an environment that supports "welling-being" and "Neuro-diversity" within the work space.

title: Holy Spirit MAC ~ Catering Services Tender
description:
The Holy Spirit Catholic Multi Academy Company comprises four primary schools and one secondary school serving the catchment area of North Warwickshire. The schools are:
      •Our Lady and St Joseph Catholic Academy, Nuneaton
      •St Anne's Catholic Academy, Nuneaton
      •St Benedict's Catholic Academy, Atherstone
      •St Francis Catholic Academy, Bedworth
      •St Thomas More Catholic School and Sixth Form College, Nuneaton

title: Joint Dog Kennelling for South Kesteven District Council and North Kesteven District Council
description: South Kesteven District Council and North Kesteven District Council each require kennelling services for stray dogs in their respective districts. Each Council anticipates that they may require kennelling for up to 40 dogs per annum for an average of three nights per dog. Tenders are invited from suitably qualified and experienced providers able to serve the requirements of both Councils. Providers must be within a reasonable distance of each Council for ease of access by Council Officers, by Council-appointed contractors transporting Stray Dogs to the kennels and by Dog Owners collecting dogs. Bidders are required to provide an inclusive fixed price per annum based on the estimated volumes above. Tender documents will be published on www.eastmidstenders.org. The deadline for bids is noon Friday 6th March.
contactname: Paul Large, Welland Procurement, on behalf of South Kesteven District Council

title: Homes England - Harrogate Police Training Centre - Demolition and Site Clearance
description: The Client (Homes England) acquired a parcel of land located on Yew Tree Lane in Pannal, Harrogate (the Site) from the Home Office in January 2019 with the purpose to bring the land to the market for housing development. Prior to bringing the Site to the market the Client requires pre-development enabling works to be completed to prepare the site for redevelopment. The enabling works are to primarily comprise the demolition and clearing of existing structures associated with the former police training centre. Please go to the ProContact system for further details.

title: ITT: Ainley Salt Barn and Ancillary Works
description:
The project objectives for this commission are to: • Undertake works to construct the new Salt Barn with the Ainley Depot in readiness for 2020/2021 Winter Maintenance period (1st October 2020 - 30th April 2021). The works are, but not limited to: Site Clearance • Removal/recycling of existing concrete slab. • Isolation and removal of existing lighting columns. Salt Barn Building • All works in association with the design, supply, erection and commissioning of the new Salt Barn Building including all ancillary works including design and construction of;- retaining walls, foundations, concrete slab drainage connections, slot drain, ramped access, salt bund protection measures, above surface drainage, ducting, internal & external LED lighting and connections. We expect the value of this project to be within the region of £400,000 - £750,000.To view documentation please go to:
https://procontract.due-north.com/ProjectManagement/ProjectDashboard?projectId=69a95114-be20-ea11-80fc-005056b64545

title: Provision of travel training service for SEND Young People
description:
The London Borough of Bromley ("the Council") is seeking bids for provision of Travel Training for Young People who have Special Educational Needs and Disability (SEND) to become confident independent travellers on public transport and in their local community, increasing their independence and improving opportunities. This approach also reduces the reliance upon Home to School Transport.

Travel Training is a life skill that benefits individuals in achieving independence throughout their lives; enabling them to engage fully in universal services as well as enjoy and achieve a wider range of activities during and post formal education.

Primarily, all pupils will be young people who have SEND who use Home to School Transport:

The contract will commence on 1st September 2020 and be for a period of 2 years with an option to extend for a further period up to, but not exceeding 2 years at the sole discretion of the Council.

title: Homes England - Chesterfield: A61, The Avenue Landscape Implementation Works, 2020
description: Homes England is seeking to appoint a competent Supplier for soft and hard landscaping Works at the A61 entrance to the Avenue site, Chesterfield. The Works include soft landscaping - tree planting and grass seeding, and hard landscaping works - supply and installation of a wall and estate railings.

title: LT609. - Lowestoft to Poplars Primary School, Lowestoft - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      Transport required from Britten Road, Lowestoft to Poplars Primary School, St Margarets Road, Lowestoft, NR32 4HN (4 seat vehicle).
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is 1300 on Tuesday 25th February 2020. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is 0900 on Tuesday 25th February 2020 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: Intra Operative monitoring machine replacement - AWARD
description: Current intra-operative monitoring (IOM) equipment was purchased in 2008 however this is now obsolete and is in need of replacement. It is used on 1-2 times weekly to provide essential nerve monitoring during complex neurosurgery on and around the spinal cord and brainstem reducing the risk of damage/injury to nerve roots and nerve structures.

title: Historic England Public Engagement and Communications Strategy
description:
Historic England (HE) is seeking to commission a two-phase piece of work to deliver our Public Engagement and Communications Strategy:
      o Phase 1: a swift piece of discovery to inform the shaping of our strategy, with draft strategic outline delivered by 3 April 2020. 
      o Phase 2 (subject to sign off of phase 1): fieldwork, engagement, strategy refinement, asset production and strategy launch by 15 June 2020.

title: City Benchmarking Data Refresh and Software Development

title: Unix Server - Hardware and Software Maintenance Services KMCIT-119
description: The Council intends to enter into a contract with a single supplier who can provide hardware and software maintenance services for UNIX hardware over the term.  The contract will provide hardware and software support for both the Fujitsu M10-1 and Fujitsu M10-4.  This is being procured via our e-portal www.yortender.co.uk

title: Provision of DVLA Driving Licence Checks
description: Leicester City Council licenses taxi drivers, which involves carrying out checks on their DVLA driving licences to check for convictions, endorsements, etc. Until recently this was carried out using a third party, but they have ceased to offer this service and so a new supplier is required.

title: EBC MC Mechanical & Electrical Services
description:
Elmbridge Borough Council is approaching the market with the view of contracting for Mechanical and Electrical reactive and cyclical services in the Council's buildings and properties within the borough. 
      There are three lots for this opportunity as follows:
      Lot 1 -- Mechanical services
      Lot 2 - Electrical services
      Lot 3 - Mechanical and Electrical services
      
      The Council may vary the requirements over the period of the contract as follows:
      Statutory testing
      - Annual gas safe- Annual gas safety tests.
      - Annual portable appliance tests.
      - 5-yearly tests of fixed electrical installations.
      - Planned maintenance
      Planned periodic inspection and maintenance of:
      - Gas heating boilers heating systems, and associated flues.
      - Gas installations.
      - Air conditioning systems.
      - Ventilation systems and extractor fans.
      - Building management system; heating, ventilation and air conditioning controls.
      - Fire detection and alarm systems.
      - Portable fire extinguishers.
      - Fixed fire suppression system.
      - Emergency lighting.
      - Lightning conductors.
      - Sewage pumping equipment.
      - Water leak detection systems.
      - Urinal flush controls.
      - Stand-by generators.
      - Incoming mains supply transformer.
      - Car park lighting. 
      - Auto Doors
      - Lifts
      - Electric Vehicle charges
      Remedial works
      Remedial repairs identified in the course of planned testing and maintenance (subject to limits defined by theCouncil).
      Responsive repairs
      Provision of a 24-hour, 365-day responsive breakdown and repairs service in respect of the equipment listed inthis document, together with:
      - Fixed electrical installations.
      - Fixed electrical appliances, e.g. hand dryers and water heaters.
      - Mains water, domestic hot water and domestic cold water services.
      - Sanitary ware, equipment and fixtures associated with plumbing services, e.g tanks, hot water cylinders, sinks, taps, and hand wash/dryer units.
      Outline of principal sites, equipment and planned maintenance requirements
       
      Elmbridge Civic Centre, Esher
      - The Civic Centre is the Council's main location for administration and governance. The site comprises the Council Chamber, committee rooms, offices, meeting areas, staff catering and welfare facilities, IT suite, plantrooms and car parks. Some areas of the site are occupied by external organisations.
      - The proposed contract will encompass planned maintenance of the following equipment:
      - Main gas-fired heating and hot water boilers, together with associated solar water heating.
      - LPHW central heating system.
      - Gas installations.
      - Chillier plant and associated fan coil and VAV air conditioning systems.
      - Supply and extract ventilation systems.
      - Window extractor fans.
      - Building management system and associated controls.
      - Fire detection and alarm systems.
      - Portable fire extinguishers.
      - Fixed fire suppression system.
      - Emergency lighting.
      -...

title: GB-Braintree: Public Realm Enabling Works Lot 1
description:
The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.The works are to reconstruct footways and carriageways, with the inclusion of a proposed Bus Gate and contra flow bus lane and road narrowing, including street lighting improvements, signage and drainage improvements and traffic signal improvements, as well as construction of parking bays and the implementation of a one way system and associated works.
      
      Works at Fairfield Rd (area 1) and Bank Street (area 2) St Michaels Lane (area 3) will require works on the public highway.
      
      The objective of the works is to create improvements to the surrounding highway network to facilitate the main Public Realm Works to be let under a separate contract. This works package is the enabling works to facilitate the Public Realm contract, to be let separately.

title: 1440 Clinical Simulation Suite- Market Engagement Exercise
description:
Market Engagement for the procurement of a Clinical skills/simulation suite at De Montfort University, Leicester. 
      De Montfort University is seeking Market Engagement (ME) from companies who could provide a Clinical skills/simulation suite solution in the near future. The ME will take place on Wednesday 18th March 2020 at the University on a one to one basis.
      
      The aim of the event will be to establish a structured approach across the Clinical Simulation market and to encourage suppliers to share their views and offer suggestions in light of information provided & if possible provide a demonstration. This will then allow the university to formulate the specifications & procurement process. 
      
      If you are interested in the ME, please register on In-tend and we will send you a brief questionnaire and reserve your time slot.
      
      The University intends to go out to Tender in May/ June 2020 for a delivered & Installed system ready for the new academic term 2020. 
      The facility will have large simulation rooms, examination rooms, cubicles in one building and the system would need the capability to host similar activity in at least one another building on campus.  As an initial estimate; 5 rooms each with 4 bays as an estimate There will be 3 large rooms, each with 6 bays.  
      Brief system requirements:   
      o Simulation is a critical part of healthcare training and we need reliable recording and debriefing.
      o We need an audio-visual learning management system.  We need an easy-to-use interface specifically designed for healthcare training.  The system also needs to be compatible with high fidelity manikins/patient simulators.
      o AV learning management system:
      o HD Video recording
      o Learning & assessment, ability to tag comments/feedback to video footage
      o Integration with patient simulators
      o Live broadcasting to any classroom/office on campus
      o PTZ cameras & the ability to zoom footage already taken
      o Multiple cameras/views per room
      o Manually start-stop recording & scheduled recording
      o Immediate access to recorded data
      o Ability to see single rooms & multiple rooms from control room interface
      o Generate reports on individual performance & give learning access to these reports at home/on campus
      o Access/security - link to single sign on, administrators to view from control room & off-site.  Simple to set-up user accounts and user groups.
      o Ability to allow students to see selected footage easily & securely.  Search function to find video footage.
      o 2 way audio - microphones & speakers in rooms - ability to talk from control room or from 1 room to another.  Ability to use earpieces to communicate.
      o Ability to choose which microphone records i.e., general ceiling microphones or directional mics
      
      To apply please register on the In-Tend system :
      https://in-tendhost.co.uk/demontfort/aspx/Home
      Closing date on Monday 16th March 2020 at 12:00 noon.
      
      ****PLEASE DO NOT APPL...

title: WP3600a - Employee Research Services
description:
The Council is seeking tenders for Employee Research Services (staff surveys and other associated work)
      
      There are two elements to this research;
      
      1.Employee survey (conducted bi-annually in 2020, 2022 and 2024)
      2.Following surveys; support us in the design and delivery of ad-hoc qualitative and quantitative staff engagement activity (pulse activity)
      
      This procurement project is to replace project WP3600, that was cancelled.

title: Expansion of Care Home Services for People Aged 16 upwards Framework Agreement
description: The Council wishes to expand its Care Home Services Framework Agreement (project reference DN316366).  The Framework Agreement allows the Council to engage with suitably qualified providers who are already providing Care Home Services to existing Service Users, the majority of whom will be aged under 65 when placed.  The Council wishes to update existing contract terms and conditions, or renew existing packages of care.  No further competition processes will be run under this Framework.                                                                                                                                                                                    Placements for newly identified service users in need of care home services will generally be commissioned through an alternative project, the "Dynamic Provider List - Residential Care for Younger Adults", reference DN80051.  That dynamic purchasing system (DPS) is active and open to new applications from organisations seeking opportunities to deliver care home placements.          PLEASE NOTE: ORGANISATIONS WHICH BID SUCCESSFULLY FOR INCLUSION ON THE FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT (under project reference DN316366) SHOULD NOT RE-APPLY

title: Print Room and Software Provision at Lancaster University - AWARD
description:
Lancaster University wish to procure the services of a Multifunctional Device supplier to undertake the supply, delivery and installation of equipment for the University Print Room.
      
      All suppliers on Lot 1 of the Multifunctional Devices and Associated Print Services and Suppliers Framework, ref: CPC/DU/MFD/02A have been invited to submit a bid in accordance with the enclosed specification and scope of requirements.
      
      Lancaster University print room sits within the commercial services section of the Facilities division.  It is an established dynamic print room and is run on a commercial footing along with a photography, design, and video service. We offer digital and wide format printing to a mainly internal customer base in both colour and mono on a wide variety of media.
      
      We offer a range of online and offline finishing options including ring and thermal binding as well as booklet making. In this tender we are looking to expand our off line finishing options to ensure specialist colour printing is retained in house wherever possible.
      
      Our peak workflows occur in Sept/Oct and Dec/Jan and our core product during those periods are course readers and workbooks, however due to digitisation the demand for these products is declining.
      
      We currently utilise a cloud hosted EFI DSF web to print as part of our customer interface, and this is a popular method of job submission. We would like to develop and improve this interface by having different storefronts for different customers.
      
      Our mono volume in the print room is in the region of 4,000,000 mono impressions and 850,000 colour impressions. Colour volumes are growing and mono volumes are falling which is typical in the HE sector.
      
      We currently own a Xerox J75 and a Konica Bizhub 1052 which are used as backup devices. 
      We also have on our current contract a further colour 70ppm engine and two 130 ppm mono engines. Contracted finishing equipment currently includes a Morgana BM500 booklet maker and an EBR5560 guillotine. The contract for all these items ends on the 29th Feb 2020.
      
      Our wide format printing devices include an HP Latex2600 and an HPZ2100, both of which need to be replaced.
      
      We are looking at options for a Flatbed UV printer given that the current university spend on signage is in the region of £80,000 pa. 
      
      We are also looking at options to support our School of Architecture students with devices which will sit on Papercut.
      
      We our looking for a lease contract lasting 5 years.

title: Lightwoods House Decor Upgrade 2020 - AWARD
description:
Lightwoods House Decor Upgrade 2020
      
      Sandwell MBC is seeking to appoint a supplier to upgrade the décor of Lightwoods House in order to enhance its appeal to wedding and corporate clients who form a key source of income for the sustainability of the House.  Details of the requirements are listed in the specification.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to Quotation or other related documents.
      
      To submit a quotation you will be required to 'Opt In'.
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Friday 07 February 2020 at 15:00hrs

title: FGM promotion and awareness
description:
• Delivery of at least three FGM engagement and awareness-raising workshops with communities affected by FGM in Enfield. At least one of these will be focussed on engagement and awareness raising among men. 

• Outreach and engagement activities to increase participation in engagement events and strengthen relationships with community members. 

• The provider to coordinate and facilitate the events and source all personnel, volunteers and materials. 

• Events to be held in 2020.

• Feedback and evaluation of engagement activities to be reported to the Enfield FGM Steering Group

title: Senior Systems Accountant 180220
description:
Sandwell Council is looking to appoint a Financial Systems Accountant with Oracle fusion financial implementation experience or general Oracle experience specifically in the Council. 
      
      Candidates need to have working experience of Orcale R12 also. 
      
      They need to be a full or part qualified accountant to support year end and month end processes. 
      
      Candidates must have excellent Excel skills. The ideal candidate should have experience of working with at least one other local authority in the implementation of the oracle cloud financials, preferably as a systems accountant/systems administrator background. 
      
      They need to have a qualified Accounting Technician or equivalent qualification and have at least 3 years' experience gained in a public sector financial management environment. 
      
      This role is full time 37 hours per week and is based at 1 Providence Place, West Bromwich, B70 8SZ. The role is to start asap and is for 12 weeks initially. 
      
      The rate of pay for this role is £18.03 per hour (PAYE).
      
      Candidates must be readily available for an interview with a view to start immediately. For further information please have a look at the JD and PS attached.
      
      Please note this advert is also out with our Master Vendor agency.
      
      The Quotation Document(s) will be made available to suppliers who Express Interest on the Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council Tendering Portal. To access the portal please click the following link https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc
      
      You will be required to log into an existing account or register a new one. Once logged in, from the top menu bar click on 'Tenders' to list all the current opportunities. Once you have found the relevant opportunity you should click on 'View Details' in order to Express Interest.
      
      Closing date for submission of quotations is Wednesday 19th February 12:00pm (midday).

title: 2020-01-09 0900 AOC012: Lowestoft - Aldeby Resource Centre - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      AOC012: Lowestoft - Aldeby Resource Centre (Requirement for wheelchair accessible vehicle with a passenger assistant).
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is Thursday 9th January 2020 at 0900. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.

title: Cornwall Music Education Hub - Strategic Progression & Ensemble Support for Mid and West Cornwall
description:
Cornwall Council, the lead partner of the Cornwall Music Education Hub (CMEH), seeks to contract a supplier to undertake strategic planning and support for progression and ensembles, as outlined in the delivery plan approved by The Arts Council.  
The progression of young players is a key area of focus for the Cornwall Music Education Hub in order to ensure that our young people are able to take their musical journeys forward.  The contractor will provide support to existing and emerging ensembles, regional/school ensembles in their geographical and support for the CMEH managed county level ensembles.

Please see attached specification document.

title: Provision of an Integrated Transport Service
description:
Southend-on-Sea Borough Council (the Council) is seeking a lead provider to deliver and operate the whole of its passenger transport service (core services) as follows:
(a) Home to School Transport for Children with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities, (b) Transport for Supervised contact visits for families and Transport for Disabled Children Respite Care, (c) Adults with Learning Disabilities Transport and (d) Dial-a-ride Transport. 
The core services maximum budget is £1.8m per annum to deliver the core services.  Therefore any tenders that are in excess of £1.8m per annum will be disqualified.  There may also be optional additional non-core services which the Council may add in its sole discretion (estimated to be an additional £980,000 per annum) as well as potential investment for any approved projects via the strategic partnering agreement (no specific value is earmarked at this time and any investment would be agreed over the life of the strategic partnering agreement).  
Further details are set out in the Services Specification published with the tender documents.  
The Council also wishes to also establish a partnership between the Council and the lead provider to deliver the partnership objectives as described in the Services Specification.

"Southend-on-Sea Borough Council (the Council) is seeking a lead provider to deliver and operate the whole of its passenger transport service (core services) as follows:
(a) Home to School Transport for Children with Special Educational Needs and Disabilities, (b) Transport for Supervised contact visits for families and Transport for Disabled Children Respite Care, (c) Adults with Learning Disabilities Transport and (d) Dial-a-ride Transport. 
The core services maximum budget is £1.8m per annum to deliver the core services.  Therefore any tenders that are in excess of £1.8m per annum will be disqualified.  There may also be optional additional non-core services which the Council may add in its sole discretion (estimated to be an additional £980,000 per annum) as well as potential investment for any approved projects via the strategic partnering agreement (no specific value is earmarked at this time and any investment would be agreed over the life of the strategic partnering agreement).  
Further details are set out in the Services Specification published with the tender documents.  
The Council also wishes to also establish a partnership between the Council and the lead provider to deliver the partnership objectives as described in the Services Specification.", "supplyChain": false, "hasEnquiries": null, "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2018-08-08T00:00:00Z"}, "awardCriteria": null, "submissionMethod": null, "xClassifications": {"isSuitableForSme": false, "isSuitableForVco": false, "ojeuContractType": "Services"}, "procurementMethod": null, "eligibilityCriteria": null, "awardCriteriaDetails": null, "submissionMethodDetails": null, "procurementMethodDetails": "Open procedure", "procurementMethodRationale": ""}, "language": "en-GB", "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "publishedDate": "2020-05-12T01:34:39.625021+00:00"}

title: Building Maintenance and Cleaning Services
description:
Herefordshire Council requires a contractor to provide building maintenance and cleaning services for its property assets which includes corporate buildings, industrial units, schools, public buildings, public conveniences, car parks, small holdings, land and open spaces and other assets together with associated infrastructure, fixed plant and equipment.
The Council welcomes tender submissions from any suitably qualified supplier. To access the tender documents please go to www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk and search for the opportunity under Herefordshire Council.

title: DM322. - Stowmarket to Stonham Aspal Primary School - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      Transport required from Hill Rise, Stowmarket, IP14 2HB to Stonham Aspal Primary School, The Street, Stonham Aspal, Stowmarket, IP14 6AF (4 seat vehicle).
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is 1100 on Friday 13th March 2020. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is 1700 on Thursday 12th March 2020 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: RB600 People Development Trainers Framework
description:
A framework of trainers split over 2 lots:
      
      Lot 1 - Development Sessions
       
      For the provision of development and teambuilding sessions to be delivered to University colleagues.
      Our University's People and Organisational Development Team schedule a wide range of sessions as part of their development offer. 
      
      Lot 2 - IT Training
      
      Lot 2 is for the provision of IT Training to be delivered to staff within the University.
      
      Leeds Beckett University offers a range of IT support, which responds to the development needs of colleagues.  Sessions covering the full Microsoft Office 365 suite are available to colleagues.

title: Expedition Leader for I-Venture 2021 and 2023
description: Bolsover Partnership are seeking quotations from suitably experienced third parties who will work with an existing group of key stakeholders to lead the planning and delivery of two expeditions to South Africa in October 2021 and October 2023 for up to thirty 14-15 year olds per expedition (aged 12 and 13 at selection).  This will require partnership collaboration and intensive planning with the stakeholders involved prior to both expeditions taking place.

title: Provision of Internal Audit Services for South Yorkshire Fire & Rescue Authority
description: South Yorkshire Fire & Rescue Authority (the Authority) is looking to establish a contract with a Provider for Internal Audit Services. Barnsley Metropolitan Borough Council will be managing this process for the Authority. This procurement is for Internal Audit services covering the scope of work and responsibilities of the Authority. The Fire and Rescue Service under the leadership of the Chief Fire Officer and Chief Executive delivers services to the communities of South Yorkshire and consequently is where internal audit activity is predominantly focussed. The Authority has delegated certain functions to the Audit and Governance Committee that oversees the work of Internal Audit.

title: Thermostatic Mixer Valves Maintenance and Supply
description:
The Authority seeks a Contractor to provide service /goods for Thermostatic Mixer Valves (including Maintenance, Servicing, Repairs, Installation & Ad Hoc Work). The key objectives are:
•	Maintenance / Servicing of thermostatic valves
•	Ad hoc / repair work to thermostatic valves & pipework
•	Emergency service for ad hoc and repairs for critical services
•	Installation of additional thermostatic valves & pipework requirements.

title: Newton Abbot Schools Group
description: Newton Abbot group of schools, listed in the ITT documents but Chudleigh School as the lead, is requesting tender responses from suitably qualified cleaning contractors to deliver a daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and periodic cleaning service to the college buildings. Contractors are asked to complete the relevant documentation and return to comply with the tender requirements. Further details can be found within the attached documents.
streetaddress: Chudleigh School - as Lead school Lawn Drive

title: Gloucestershire County Council minor works framework asbestos removal including demolition works up to £15,000. (Formerly Lot 11)
description:
Gloucestershire County Council (GCC) is procuring a minor works framework for asbestos removal including demolition works up to £15,000.                                                                                                                                                                                        The Minor Works Framework list will be available to premises managers, budget holders and commissioners within GCC.  Works may be instructed for premises and sites such as Schools, Day Centres, Fire Stations, Libraries and other properties across Gloucestershire.                                                                                                                                                                                  As the lead purchasing body, the Minor Works Framework may be made available to other public bodies to use. These bodies include, but are not limited to, Gloucester City Council, all District Councils with Gloucestershire, Schools and Academy Schools within Gloucestershire. The framework may also be used by other districts authorities, Schools and Academies within South Gloucestershire, Wiltshire, Oxfordshire, Warwickshire and Herefordshire.
This framework will be effective from 8th November 2019 to 29th April 2023.                                                                              Individual works called off under the framework will have a maximum value of £15,000. The estimated total value over the life time of the framework is £170,000.

title: Pritchatts Park Expansion
description:
The University of Birmingham ('the University') would like to procure a Student Housing Partner (SHP) to design, build, finance and operate its Pritchatts Park Village, as part of a stock transfer and new build project (the 'Project'), which should have minimal impact on the University's balance sheet.
      
      The strategic context is that the University wants to increase the number of high-quality, affordable beds, in order to maintain its guarantee to accommodate its growing student population, while at the same time upgrading some of its older stock. The Project is a vital step in providing the facilities to support the forecast growth in student numbers and thereby enhance the attractiveness and reputation of the University.
      
      The University's residential estate comprises 5,183 freehold beds across three villages: The Vale (3,531 beds), Pritchatts Park (734 beds), and Selly Oak (918 beds). The majority of the estate is self-catered, with a catered option at The Vale. There is mix of room types across the estate: mostly standard and en-suite rooms, with a smaller number of studios. It also currently has nomination agreements across five private halls (total 1,872 beds). The scope of this Project only includes the University's Pritchatts Park Village. See Section 4 for more details.

title: WHC - Supply of Digital Emergency Equipment
description:
The Independent Living Service provide a response and monitoring service to approximately 1700 WHC designated sheltered housing properties and 700 community Lifeline clients living within the borough. Approximately 2/3 are owner occupiers and 1/3 are Council properties.
      
      The 1700 sheltered housing properties connect via a hard wired system installed in the property and receive support via scheme coordinators on site and mobile wardens, providing a 24 x 7 service. The units require an active landline and electrical socket in order to operate and successfully connect to the control centre. The hard wired units also connect to pull cords in each room.
      
      There is a programme to remove the existing units which will be replaced by new units supplied through this procurement.
      
      The Council requires 2400 units to be delivered over a 5 year period.The new units need to be delivered to one location in Welwyn Garden City and the onward delivery will be managed by Council staff.

title: Vehicle Technician x 3
description:
Vehicle Technician x 3
      Working Hours: - 37 Hours Per Week, working 8.00am to 4.00pm Monday to Thursday and 8.00am to 3.30pm on Friday 
      Pay Rate: Band E, ?12.60 Per Hour PAYE, 
      Start date: ASAP for 3months
      Contract type: Agency
      Location: - Waterfall Lane, Cradley Heath, B64 6RL
      
      Job Description and Personnel Specification are attached, which also provides more information above the role.
      We require 3 Vehicle Technicians to undertake without supervision all major and general repairs to all types of motor vehicles to include, inspections and diagnostics within the workshop and on site.
      
      You must:- 
      o Have experience as a Commercial Vehicle Mechanic  
      o Be able to work under own initiative with minimum supervision
      o Have the ability to work with others 
      o Be able to liase with and advise customers and managers at all levels
      o Be accurate and be able to pay attention to detail.
      o Have clean Cat. B licence
      o Hold a BTEC in Vehicle Maintenance
      o Be able to diagnose and rectify faults on vehicles
      o Accurately complete all relevant paperwork associated with the post
      o Hold a BTEC National Certificate in Automotive Engineering ONC or Equivalent or experience of working in vehicle workshop

title: GB-Leicester: Measuring and control equipment.
description:
The Space Technology Applications from Research (STAR) project at the University of Leicester require a Coordinate Measuring Machine, suitable for the accurate measurement of precision components, made from various grades of Stainless Steels/Steels, Aluminium Alloys, Brass, Copper Molybdenum and other materials.  The Machine is needed to support a wide range of research groups and projects within the STAR project to measure/check components to a level of high accuracy for space flight and other areas of Engineering based research.
      
      The University proposes awarding a contract for a suitable machine by carrying out an open tender exercise.
      
      This procurement process is advertised on the University's electronic tendering portal (Delta E-Sourcing) and Contracts Finder as required within the Public Contract Regulations 2015. 
      
      The contract is funded by a European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) grant award.

title: PIN 2019-03 - Derby Arena Lighting Service and Maintenance
description:
Derby Homes Limited (the Employer) is an arms-length management organisation, fully owned by Derby City Council.
      
      Part of the Employer's remit is to provide a repairs, maintenance and servicing to public buildings within the city of Derby, including the Arena.
      
      Derby's Arena is used for providing various public events which require sound and lighting equipment.
      
      In line with the Employer's Procurement Standing Orders, this Prior Information Notice (PIN) is intended to enable the Employer to confirm if the system can be maintained and serviced by more than the original installer.

title: Commission Marketing and Copy Write Support to Promote Sandwell's Business Growth Support Function - AWARD
description:
Commission Marketing and Copy Write Support to Promote Sandwell's Business Growth Support Function
      
      Tenders are invited from appropriately experienced and qualified individuals and agencies to lead on all social, digital and traditional media requirements on behalf of Sandwell Council's Regeneration and Business Growth Team, Think Sandwell, Sandwell Business Ambassadors and the Sandwell Borough.
      
      Think Sandwell, the Regeneration and Business Growth Team and Sandwell Business Ambassadors are committed to supporting all businesses from start up to established businesses, offering help in identifying funding for growth and expansion, opportunities to build relationships with key stakeholders in addition to providing tailored programmes to suit each individual business's needs.
      
      Term of Contract
      
      The contract will be for 1 year from 1st April 2020 to 31st March 2021.
      
      Appointment of Service provider
      
      To appoint a single provider for the provision of Commission Marketing and Copy Write Support to Promote Sandwell's Business Growth Support Function
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to Quotation or other related documents.
      
      To submit a quotation you will be required to 'Opt In'.
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Monday 24 February 2020 at 15:00hrs

title: Fire Remediation Works

title: 9922 - Procurement of services - Support services for the annual programme of events to be delivered by Norwich City Council - AWARD
description:
Norwich City Council (the council) is seeking to create a contract framework of up to five suppliers in each of the following service categories to continue providing its event support services for up to four years.
      The Lots are for the following services:
      LOT 1 - Radio communications
      LOT 2 - Generators and Lighting Towers
      LOT 3 - Portable toilets
      LOT 4 - Marquees
      LOT 5 - PA services
      LOT 6 - Stages
      LOT 7 - Stage lighting
      LOT 8 - Portacabins
      LOT 9 - First Aid and Medical Services

title: GB-Leeds: 2020/6 Market research for Agri-Systems
description:
We wish to test the hypothesis outlined above and to inform the broad aims and objectives and potential research focus forthe University'sagri-systems Centre of Excellence.  The study will identifyand fully define the unmet (or under-met) needs and wants ofpotential research and innovation collaborators withthe Centre of Excellence.  The study will research and describethe opportunity defined bythe marketand the competitive environment.
      The key output of this work will be a market insights report identifying areas of growth and opportunities for research collaboration in the defined markets. The market insights gathered through this research will inform the University's strategic planning process focus and prioritise our scientific research efforts to meet the needs of industry.

title: QU319 - Cleaning and Environment Support Services: Cleaning and Support Services - Apprenticeship Framework Level 2
description:
The Council requires a supplier for the provision of Apprenticeship training Cleaning and Environment Support Services apprentices: Cleaning and Support Services, Level 2 Framework.
      
      To provide training and/or sourcing training to train between 20 and 25 apprentices in the aforementioned discipline within our Landlord Services Teams across the City. This training will be delivered to apprentices across various age groups on a full-time basis. Registration with the Register of Apprentice Providers is a prerequisite, along with a track record of experience of delivering apprentice training in the Local Government Sector.
      
      Birmingham City Council will work with the awarded training provider and the apprentice to support and mentor apprentices as part of their long-term career pathway. In addition to this Managers will have regular communications with the training provider regarding feedback on performance/attendance of the apprentices, including any key milestones/achievements and satisfaction levels of the tutor/assessor; manager and apprentice.
      
      The Training Provider will:
      o be funded the agreed cost of the training for all apprentices with the city council's Apprenticeship Levy via the Digital Apprenticeship System, once a contract for service has been signed by both parties.
      o ensure that during the 20% off the job learning, apprentices do not breach any GDPR regulations that could implicate the council.
      o work with the city council to ensure that the pattern of training suits the needs of the service. This would be a separate day release for each apprentice. The Training Provider will provide details of the delivery location for classroom-based provision.
      o ensure that apprentices are provided with regular timetables, and attendance is regularly recorded and fed back to the manager, this includes regular contact with manager during 'day releases'. The Training Provider should notify the apprentice's manager, should the apprentice fail to attend training, and work with the manager to organise an action plan to resolve any further absences. Persistent failure to meet the 20% off the job learning will result in disciplinary action against the apprentice and potential dismissal. The city council will notify the Training Provider if this is the case and will not impact on the cost of the training already funded.
      
      This contract will be for a period of 12 months commencing 15th June 2020 until 20th June 2021. 
      
      BCC will be using its e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and providers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. The web address is: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc Registration and use of In-tend is free. All correspondence for this procurement process must be via the In-tend correspondence function. If you are unable to register with In-tend please either email us at: cps@birmingham.gov.uk or call 0121 464 8000.
      
      If yo...

title: South Cambridgeshire District Council - Community Development - Marleigh
description: South Cambridgeshire District Council (SCDC) are seeking a service provider to support the development of a strong, creative and resilient community in and around the new development of Marleigh.    Marleigh is situated within the Parish of Fen Ditton on the border of SCDC and Cambridge City Council (City) and will consist of up to 1,300 homes (30% affordable), a primary school and community facilities. Construction will take place over 9 phases (Planning Application Reference S/2682/13/OL). Reserve matters (S/1096/19/RM) for 239 homes and a local Centre was granted by SCDC in August 2019. Building commenced in October 2019 with first occupation in Summer 2020.

title: CBC-1108-H-CE Refurbishment of 2 Housing Properties at Houghton Regis - AWARD
description:
The project is a refurbishment of 2no properties based in Houghton Regis, these are to be used for temporary accommodation and works will include full decorations and flooring, 2 of the properties will require new kitchens, these will be designed and produced to winning tender. Bathroom and kitchen specifications along with flooring and decorating are the same throughout all 3 properties.
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the quotation process.  Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all tenderers, to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure about or need clarification on, please use the Correspondence facility within the In-tend electronic tendering system. Last date for receiving questions on Intend system is Monday 17th February 2020                                 
      
      Return of Quotation - Completed Quotations and attachments should be submitted electronically by the due date via our In-tend electronic tendering system. Quotations must be uploaded via the "My Return" section of the system. Quotations submitted through the correspondence facility will not be considered. Your Quotation must be submitted via the In-tend system by no later than 12:00 noon on Friday 24th of February 2020. Quotations received after that time will be excluded.

title: Healthy Early Years Psychical  Activity and Obesity Work with nursery's in Enfield
description:
• Increase practitioner and parental knowledge of the Chief Medical Officer's guidelines for 3 hours (180 minutes) of physical activity each day.
 
 • Supporting settings to embed physical activity in relation to Healthy Early Years London.

• Raising awareness with parents on how they can support children to become more physically active.
 
• Increase practitioner confidence and skill in delivering children's Physical Literacy entitlement in the early years setting/school (planning and assessment).

• Support settings to create an active friendly environment for purposeful physical play.

• Evaluate the physical activity program.

• Decrease children's sedentary behaviour by increasing children's activity levels and movement opportunities whilst attending your setting/school.

title: CBC-1107-H-CE  Barton-le-Clay Scout Hut and University Technical College Garage Block -  Demolition Works - AWARD
description:
Demolition of Barton-le-Clay Scout Hut and Garage block at University Technical College of Central Bedfordshire. 
      
      For Specification details, please refer to BSH - GENERAL SPECIFICATION and UTC - GENERAL SPECIFICATION and associated drawings within the quotation pack. Terms and conditions will be JCT MINOR WORKS BUILDING CONTRACT WITH CONTRACTOR'S DESIGN.
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the quotation process. If there is anything you are not sure about or need clarification on, please use the Correspondence facility within the In-tend electronic tendering system. Your Quotation must be submitted via the In-tend system by no later than 12:00 noon on 24/02/2020
      
      Target contract commencement date or delivery date: WC 16/03/2020
      Contract term: 4 weeks

title: Q20365 River Valley Strategy Report
description:
In order to optimise the potential of its river valleys, the city is commissioning a River Valley Strategy Report (with the focus on the rivers Irk, Medlock and Mersey) and an associated GIS database.

The Strategy Report will be developed over a period of one year from 1 April 2020. It will consist of one cover report (providing an over-arching summary review of the city's rivers) and three individual river valley strategies with action plans focusing on the rivers Irk, Medlock and Mersey.

title: SERPENS RFI 2
description:
THIS IS TO NOTIFY ALL SUPPLIERS THAT RFI 2 IS NOW AVAILABLE ON THE AWARD PORTAL.
      
      SERPENS is a Category A equipment procurement project taking into account the through life costs.
      
      The main Users are 1 Arty Brigade and 1 ISR Brigade. The In Service date for SERPENS is 2026 with an anticipated Out of Service Date of 2057. 
      
      If not already completed, registration can be found on the SERPENS AWARD Portal where the Authority will be sharing information throughout the project. https://award.bravosolution.co.uk/serpens/web/project/101/register.
