title: LT204 - Kessingland to Elm Tree Primary School - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      Transport required from Kessingland to Elm Tree Primary School, Ranworth Avenue, Lowestoft, NR33 9HN (4 seat vehicle).
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is 1100 on Monday 9th March 2020. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is 1600 on Friday 6th March 2020 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: Future Northants- Northamptonshire Strategic Infrastructure Plan
description:
The principal councils of Northamptonshire, working in partnership with other service providers and England's Economic Heartland (EEH), wish to procure a strategic infrastructure plan for the county for the period up to 2050. This plan would consist of three main elements:
A. A modelling environment ('NSIP Model') which allows a wide range of options for development and infrastructure, and external scenarios, to be tested and a range of measures calculated for each combination of these. The outputs should be robust for use in preparation of statutory development plans. These measures are of two types:
i. Measures which assess the acceptability of outcomes, resulting in a numerical score and a red, amber, green rating.
ii. Measures which are used to provide inputs to other processes and therefore have a numerical output but no rating. These measures would, among other purposes, provide a basis for seeking investment in the county.
B. A user guide ('Model Guide') for the modelling environment, to enable effective future use.
C. A written report (NSIP Report, the formal Strategic Infrastructure Plan) based on the modelling work setting out the proposed strategy for infrastructure provision for the county up to 2050 and setting out the justification for this. The written Plan should be robust for use in preparation of statutory development plans as well as compelling as a case for investment in the county by Government and the private sector.

providers and England's Economic Heartland (EEH), wish to procure a strategic infrastructure plan for the county for the period up to 2050. This plan would consist of three main elements:
A. A modelling environment ('NSIP Model') which allows a wide range of options for development and infrastructure, and external scenarios, to be tested and a range of measures calculated for each combination of these. The outputs should be robust for use in preparation of statutory development plans. These measures are of two types:
i. Measures which assess the acceptability of outcomes, resulting in a numerical score and a red, amber, green rating.
ii. Measures which are used to provide inputs to other processes and therefore have a numerical output but no rating. These measures would, among other purposes, provide a basis for seeking investment in the county.
B. A user guide ('Model Guide') for the modelling environment, to enable effective future use.
C. A written report (NSIP Report, the formal Strategic Infrastructure Plan) based on the modelling work setting out the proposed strategy for infrastructure provision for the county up to 2050 and setting out the justification for this. The written Plan should be robust for use in preparation of statutory development plans as well as compelling as a case for investment in the county by Government and the private sector.", "supplyChain": false, "hasEnquiries": null, "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2020-04-07T00:00:00Z"}, "awardCriteria": null, "submissionMethod": null, "xClassifications": {"isSuitableForSme": true, "isSuitableForVco": false, "ojeuContractType": "Services"}, "procurementMethod": null, "eligibilityCriteria": null, "awardCriteriaDetails": null, "submissionMethodDetails": "Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section.", "procurementMethodDetails": "Open procedure", "procurementMethodRationale": ""}, "language": "en-GB", "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "publishedDate": "2020-05-12T01:34:49.447806+00:00"}

title: CP1828A-19 SW Exeter HIF - A379 Eastern Junction
description:
The overall objective of this scheme is to improve the accessibility of the A379 for all type of users: pedestrians, cyclists and motorists, between the Devon Hotel roundabout and the Sannerville Way roundabout, Exeter, prior to major development planned to the south west of Exeter. (UK Ordnance Survey grid reference SX 93217 89154). At present, this section of the A379 is a 4-lane single carriageway with limited facilities for pedestrians/cyclists. There are no crossing facilities near the Sannerville Way roundabout and a narrow shared use path on the south side of this road. The proposal seeks to introduce a new toucan crossing on the approach to the Sannerville Way roundabout to connect the south side of the A379 with the existing shared use path on Bridge Road and Matford Marsh. The existing shared use path on the A379 will also be widened where possible. Furthermore, a new signalised junction will be created with a new side road to the south of the A379 which will provide access to the proposed development area. The elements of work included in this phase of the scheme are, but not limited to: • Site Clearance • Earthworks • Drainage Works • Introduction of a staggered toucan crossing. • Modification and widening, where possible, of the existing shared use paths. • Realignment of the carriageway. • Resurfacing of the carriageway. • Road markings and signage. • Introduction of a new signalised junction. • Introduction of a new side road with shared paths and a staggered toucan crossing. • Removal of a layby. • Vehicle Restraint System Barriers • Street lighting electrical works. • Landscaping works.

Bidders should be aware from the outset that the maximum budget available for this contract is £2.6m.  Bidders who submit a bid over this amount will be rejected.

The procurement documents are available for unrestricted and full direct access, free of charge, at: http://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk Tenders or requests to participate must be submitted electronically via: http://www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk. Time limit for receipt of tenders or requests to participate: Date: 20/01/2020 Local time: 12:00

title: Residential &/or Nursing Care
description: The COVID-19 outbreak has given rise to an urgent need for the supply of residential care services due to facilitate rapid hospital discharge. This does not give Wokingham Borough Council sufficient time to comply with the standard open procedure timescales for this procurement. Wokingham Borough Council considers this to be a state of urgency which it has duly substantiated. Accordingly, Wokingham Borough Council is using the accelerated time limits permitted under the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (regulation [27(5) for the open procedure]) in respect of this procurement.

title: CPU 3981 Out of Management Voids (Tendered on behalf of Ashfield District Council)
description: Nottingham City Council is undertaking this procurement exercise on behalf of Ashfield District Council. Ashfield District Council are the Contracting Authority; and will be entering into the Contract with the appointed supplier. Ashfield District Council is seeking tenders for a Contractor to undertake works relating to Out of Management Void Properties to various Council owned properties throughout the District of Ashfield. The Authority's detailed requirements are set out in the Specification section and accompanying documentation.

title: HE Framework for Supply, Installation and management of Data Centre Management equipment and Infrastructure (2019)
description: NEUPC has awarded a framework agreement which is for the provision of Data Centre Management equipment and Infrastructure products and related services. NEUPC intends to award up-to the seven top ranked bidders to the framework, see the ITT document for full details. The purpose of the Framework Agreement is to provide Institutions and participating Consortia members with a framework for the Supply, Installation and management of Data Centre Management equipment and Infrastructure plus related Design and Consultancy. Products in scope include a range of data centre management equipment and infrastructure including but not limited to Uninterrupted Power Supplies (UPS), cooling equipment, generators, gas & fire suppression systems, power distribution units (PDU's), blanking panels, caging. Any or all elements of the supply, Installation, and management of data centre equipment and Infrastructure may be bought via the framework. See ITT.

title: GB-London: ST19-P181 SLaM Chaucer Centre Refurbishment
description:
The Trust is looking for a Supplier to carry out Refurbishment works at Chaucer Resource Centre (SE16 2TH) - this is in order to provide additional work space.  The works include but are not limited to:
      - Refurbishment of cellular offices to provide flexible hot desk spaces, provision of new benching, power and data points, upgraded lighting, new radiators, new flooring and new blinds
      - New vinyl flooring
      - Overhaul of fire doors and toilet facilities
      - Fire alam remedial works
buyer: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust
streetaddress: Bethlem Royal Hospital Monks Orchard Road

title: Customer Research: Relationship Survey
description:
Beyond Housing are currently out to tender for the provision of Customer Research: Perceptions Survey 
      
      Suppliers that would like to take part in this tender process are invited to 'Express Interest' upon which the will be given access to the full tender documentation delivery through this e-tendering system.
      
      When the tender documents have been made available involved suppliers will receive notification via email and the tender documents can be accessed from the 'My Tenders' area of this website and selecting the 'View Details' button of this project.
      
      Expressions of interest will only be accepted until, and the deadline for submissions of the tender will be Monday 23rd March 2020 at 10am.
      
      Please allow sufficient time to make your return as late returns will not be permitted.
      
      Any questions relating to this tender should be made via correspondence on the website and can be addressed to the main contact as shown in the details above.

title: Cambridgeshire County Council: Banking Services
description:
Contract for the provision of banking services and associated services for Cambridgeshire County Council.

This Contract is for 5 years, with an option to extend for 2 years, followed by a further 2 years followed by a final 1 year (making a maximum contract length of 10 years in total). The contract estimated start date will be 1st March 2020.

The current estimated spend for such is £50,000 per annum. Potential Providers should note that this figure is an estimate and shall fluctuate depending on the numbers,  types of transactions  and any borrowing that may occur over the life of the agreement.
Potential Providers should note that this figure is an estimate and shall fluctuate depending on the numbers,  types of transactions  and any borrowing that may occur over the life of the agreement.
There will be no guarantee of work or volume of work to be given under this contract.

The Authority requires a comprehensive money transmission banking service involving maintenance of Council, Pension Fund and school bank accounts, handling of paper, BACS and CHAPS clearing, cash processing and other activities associated with local authority banking business. The Authority will require an internet banking service for balance/transaction reporting and payment initiation.

The Authority expects that the way the service is provided during the life of the contract may change as the market and the authority change its working practices and more digital Methods/ processes are adopted for receipts and payments. 

The Authority is not dividing this contract into lots as they wish to have one banking provider in order to provide economies of scale and ensure consistency within internal processes and contract management of the agreement where this is relevant.  

The Deadline for Potential Provider's Invitation To Tender clarification questions is Tuesday 3rd September 2019
buyer: LGSS on behalf of Cambridgeshire County Council

title: Future Northants- Northamptonshire Strategic Infrastructure Plan
description:
The principal councils of Northamptonshire, working in partnership with other service providers and England's Economic Heartland (EEH), wish to procure a strategic infrastructure plan for the county for the period up to 2050. This plan would consist of three main elements:
A. A modelling environment ('NSIP Model') which allows a wide range of options for development and infrastructure, and external scenarios, to be tested and a range of measures calculated for each combination of these. The outputs should be robust for use in preparation of statutory development plans. These measures are of two types:
i. Measures which assess the acceptability of outcomes, resulting in a numerical score and a red, amber, green rating.
ii. Measures which are used to provide inputs to other processes and therefore have a numerical output but no rating. These measures would, among other purposes, provide a basis for seeking investment in the county.
B. A user guide ('Model Guide') for the modelling environment, to enable effective future use.
C. A written report (NSIP Report, the formal Strategic Infrastructure Plan) based on the modelling work setting out the proposed strategy for infrastructure provision for the county up to 2050 and setting out the justification for this. The written Plan should be robust for use in preparation of statutory development plans as well as compelling as a case for investment in the county by Government and the private sector.

The tender and subsequent agreement consisting of 11 Lot:
  Lot 1 Supply/conversion of accident and emergency vehicles of a box body construction
  Lot 2 Supply/conversion of accident and emergency vehicles of a van conversion construction
  Lot 3 Supply of rapid response vehicles (based on a car construction) 
  Lot 4 Supply/conversion of patient transport vehicles (including multi patient and stretcher variations)
  Lot 5 Supply/conversion of Wheelchair Accessible Vehicles 
  Lot 6 Supply of ambulance service support vehicles, other specialist vehicles and vehicle refurbishment and/or body remounts
  Lot 7 Provision of lease finance of ambulance and specialist vehicles and related equipment
  Lot 8 Provision of vehicle maintenance management and maintenance provision of ambulance and specialist vehicles
  Lot 9 Provision of contract hire of ambulance and specialist vehicles
  Lot 10  Short Term Hire of Vehicles
  Lot 11 Microsoft® Software and Services Lease Facilities
buyer: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: NUN - Vehicle Inspection Framework Agreement - Private Hire & Hackney Carriage Licensing - AWARD
description:
The  Council  is  tendering  for  a  new  Framework  Agreement  to  undertake  the  inspection  of hackney  carriages  and  private  hire  vehicles  which  operate  and  are  licenced  within  the Nuneaton and Bedworth area.  It  is  the  Council's  intention  to  award  2  Suppliers  onto the  Framework  Agreement. 
      
      There is no guarantee the Council require the services under this Framework Agreement  and  the Council  does  not  guarantee  any  level  of  spend  or  volume  of  Services through the Framework Agreement.

title: Supply of Physiotherapy and Rehabiliation Items
description:
The Physio requirement is to cover the future need of consumable items and support.
    
    There are 12 categories of Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation consumables items.
    
    Items will be shipped to medical centres throughout the UK and to our main operational distribution hub in Telford.

description:
Oakengates theatre @ the Place, annual pantomime.
      The Place pantomime is the key annual production of the year. We are looking for a high quality, visually spectacular pantomime with traditional characters, modern musical numbers, audience participation and a lots of comedy.

title: 2020-03-04 1000 QSC044: Brandon & Mildenhall - Chalk Hill, Great Cornard - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      QSC044: Brandon & Mildenhall - Chalk Hill, Great Cornard (Requirement for 6 seat vehicle with experienced PA).
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is Wednesday 4th March 2020 at 1000. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is Tuesday 3rd March 2020 at 1600 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: Move More Falls Prevention
description:
Quotes are sought for the provision of a Falls Management Exercise programme to be delivered by trained postural stability instructors during 2020/21.

The maximum value of this contract is £33,000 for the first year, with the possibility of extension for a further year.

The overall aim of the falls management project is to increase physical activity amongst the most inactive people aged 60+ years in Cornwall, and to increase access to falls prevention strength and balance classes for those who have previously fallen or who are at risk of falling.

Specifically, the quote requested is for delivery, by qualified postural stability instructors (PSIs), of the structured Falls Management Exercise programme (FaME).

title: Provision and Implementation of a new Control Room Solution
description:
Essex Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner Fire and Rescue Authority (the Authority) is preparing to initiate a procurement process to award a contract for the provision and implementation of a replacement ESN ready / future proofed Computer Aided Despatch System (CAD) and Integrated Communication and Control System (ICCS), which shall include the following:
      1) Provision of all hardware, including but not limited to workstation and server based hardware;
      2) Provision of the Core Command and Control Software; and
      3) Provision of maintenance and support services throughout the life of the contract.
      The Authority are seeking to view current ICCS and CAD systems available and ask for interest from the market to host the Authority to demonstrate how their solutions will meet our current and future requirements.
buyer: Essex Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner Fire and Rescue Authority
streetaddress: Essex County Fire and Rescue Service Service Headquarters, Kelvedon Park

title: HCC - 05/19 - The Provision of Traffic Count Support Services (Lots 1-4) - AWARD
description:
Following a procurement, Hertfordshire County Council has awarded contracts for The Provision of Traffic Count Support Services (Lots 1-4)
      
      This is an award notice and this opportunity is now closed. 
      
      The successful suppliers are - 
      
      Lot 1: Intelligent Data Collection (IDC)
      Lot 2: Traffic GB Ltd
      Lot 3: Traffic Technology
      Lot 4: Tracsis Traffic Data
      
      The estimated total value of the Contract is £455,000.00 and is for the core Contract period and also includes the approximate value for extensions.  
      The initial term of this contract is five (5) years with a possible extension of up to a further one (1) further year at the Councils discretion. 
      
      OJEU Contract Notice Number: 2019/S 096-232114
      
      OJEU Award Notice Number: 2019/S 202-492558

title: Making Informed Choices - Provision of Information, Advice, Advocacy and Support
description: Sutton Council intends to commission a Provider(s) to be a Key Strategic Partner. This Partner would be responsible for working with the Council to embed the Making Informed Choices Approach, which would include providing the universal and specialist information, advice, advocacy and support services.

title: Architects - New Build Programme
description:
An architect firm is required to produce feasibility and detailed design works (RIBA work plan items 2 & 3) for the new build programme - up to and including the planning process.
 
The initial projects are the Cambridge House and Glebelands sites with the option, subject to satisfactory performance, of extending the contract to include the programme for the following four years.

Please see the procurement portal www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk for further information.

title: GB-London: Second World War & Holocaust Partnership Programme
description: IWM wants to appoint an external evaluation consultant for its Second World War and Holocaust Partnership Programme. The evaluation should demonstrate the effectiveness and impact of the SWWHPP in brokering creative, strategic partnerships across the UK. However, while the evaluation does not need to focus exclusively on individual activities/public programmes their successful delivery and impact on participants and audiences will be influenced by the effectiveness of the Partnership and should therefore be considered when designing an evaluation programme.

title: Home to School and Passenger Transport Services DPS (Dynamic Purchasing System)
description:
Bracknell Forest Council (BFC) are tendering for a range of transport services. The purpose of this specificationis to detail the service requirements of the selected Suppliers on the Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) forworking with Bracknell Forest Council (BFC) in providing transport for both service users and Council staff. This document should be used in conjunction with the Terms and conditions of individual Contracts (routes) known as lots on the DPS.
Providers are expected to operate a high-quality service that caters for the needs of the passengers and meets all current and future requirements of the contract, the Council and all relevant legislation. They will need to be able to supply appropriate, suitably trained, client- focused staff for all passengers, especially those with additional or challenging needs. Providers will also need to demonstrate that they can manage their staff's professional conduct and ensure that they, as individuals, understand and meet the service standards.
We are looking for Providers who will treat Council staff, schools, parents/carers and the passengers as customers. They should be open and honest in their communication with the Council at operational and management levels. The Council expects to be informed of any service delays, accidents, issues or changes to the contract requirements. Providers must also be able to effectively manage the performance of the contract and work with the Council to analyse the current provision and develop effective and innovative solutions. They will need to supply suitable vehicles dependent on the contract needs and there should also be strong contingency plans and arrangements in place to minimise interruptions in service due to unforeseen events such as breakdowns and sickness.
The Initial Contracts will commence on 01/09/2020 following mini competitions under this DPS. Total contract value estimated between £3500000 and £12000000 depending on usage and contract duration. Organisations must register their interest on the South East Business Portal site in order to receive any changes or notifications issued by the Council during this tender process. The Council will not be held responsible for lack of communication to any organisation who does not register their interest. Clarification questions can also be sent through this site.
This will be a restricted two-stage process. Stage 1 is the Selection Questionnaire for tenderer selection and, if successful, at stage 1 (Rounds), organisations will be invited to tender at stage 2 under mini competition under this DPS.

title: Bridge Inspection - CCTV Survey Contract 2020
description:
To carry out specialist CCTV Surveys to 25 structures (Bridges & Culverts) around the Wigan Borough in accordance with the performance specification and works information pack.
The Authority considers all the sites to be confined spaces. The inspections will require either Pan & Tilt CCTV crawler unit or Man Entry methods or a combination of both (some sites are walk-through, some of which have restricted freeboard and others are CCTV crawler unit only). In all cases a remote control unit with viewing station is required to enable Council officers to supervise the operations.

title: Support to Live at Home - Extra Care Services
description:
Medway Council is seeking to establish an Extra Care Framework from which the Council can purchase Extra Care Services. This will enable the Council to work together with providers in partnership across Medway to

• Create a stable and sustainable care market

• Implement a stable and fair pricing structure

• Work in partnership with providers to maintain good quality services and develop and share best practice amongst Framework Providers

• Utilise performance and quality data to support and develop a proactive approach to ensuring our services are developed to meet our future demand and needs of our Service Users.

• Ensure the Service Users' experience of the Extra Care services is positive across all areas.

• Ensure continuity of service for our customers within their journey through health and social care.

• The Council will work with the Support to Live at Home, Extra Care Framework providers to develop the care market, direct resources at innovative projects that support increasing market capacity and share resources to support the development and maintenance of a resilient and stable workforce.

The framework is divided into 5 lots, one for each scheme. To view / apply for the opportunity and download documentation please visit the Kent Business Portal https://www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk/

title: CBC-1099-FW-AE Biggleswade HIF Legal Services - AWARD
description:
Central Bedfordshire Council is seeing specialist legal support for Central Bedfordshire Council with respect to the Biggleswade Housing Infrastructure Fund (Forward Funding) Programme. 
      
      The Council is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced legal firm to support the discharge of pre-commencement grant funding conditions and to put in place the required contractual arrangements for the Biggleswade HIF Programme. 
      
      Bids are sought only from suppliers via Lot 2a of the Crown Commercial Services Framework RM3788 Full Service Firms - England & Wales.

description: The Council require a Contractor to supply either new or refurbished1100 litre or 660 litre bins as requested by the Council, as well as the provision of a service to refurbish the Council's current stock of mainly 1100 litre bins. There will be occasions where there will be the requirement to supply or refurbish 1040 litre or 1280 litre bins.

title: Planned Maintenance and Property Reinvestment Framework
description:
The purpose of this new framework agreement (this Framework Agreement) is to ensure we can provide an offering suitable for members of PfH in England, Wales and Northern Ireland and other public bodies permitted to use this Framework Agreement who require the provision of Planned Maintenance and Property Reinvestment. 
      
      Procurement for Housing has conducted the necessary pre market engagement activities to develop this Framework Agreement to meet the immediate and future requirements of PfH members.
      
      Subsequently, the scope of this Framework Agreement will be to cover all aspects of planned maintenance work, with materials supply provision on kitchens and windows. It will consist of 4 lots which will be awarded to multiple Suppliers
      
      Lot 1 Windows and Doors  Supply Only
      Lot 2 Windows and Doors   Supply and Install
      Lot 3 Kitchens  Supply Only
      Lot 4 Planned Maintenance and Property Reinvestment Works
      
      
      Contract periods may vary from an expected minimum of 12 months to an expected maximum of four years or will be project based. However, PfH members will be free to select the most appropriate period for their needs which may vary from these expected periods.

title: Beach Chalets Refurbishment
description:
The full refurbishment of 35 beach chalets (27 pitched roof chalets and the 8 tiered chalets).  

Infrastructure improvement works will take place alongside this refurbishment project which may require some liaison between contractors. 

The contract anticipated to start in early April and are expected to continue for 12 weeks, however, the contract start date is subject to planning permission approval.

The opportunity is available on Kent Business Portal and can be accessed via the portal's webpage, https://www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk/. Registration is required and free for those not already registered.

title: 2019 - 0777 Asbestos Surveying Services Framework - AWARD
description:
PLEASE READ DOCUMENT ONE FIRST.
      Citizen is seeking to appoint multiple service providers to work with us to provide our required Asbestos Surveying Services. 
      
      The service will be predominantly provided to occupied domestic premises and will in the main be highly reactive and will be made available on 24 X 7 X 365 days a year basis. However, you should note that Citizen is unable to guarantee the level or frequency of instructions.
      
      The reactive instructions are generated via a contact centre where appointments are raised which the contractor will be expected to attend. It is expected that many will be classed as emergencies will be completed within 24hrs of the call and all other work must be completed within 10 working days.
      
      If you wish to express an interest in this project please ensure you are registered and logged into our Portal. The 'Express Interest' button will only appear on the Tender Management page if you are logged in.
      
      Applicants are advised to ensure that they do not base their submission on discussions with any other member of Citizen Staff. If you require any clarification on matters contained within the Tender Documents, you must do so via Correspondence of the Citizen E-Tendering portal. Failure to observe this requirement may result in your bid being eliminated.
      
      Please note that in the case of tender clarifications where appropriate, answers will be circulated to all tenderers.
      
      NB: Should you require assistance or clarification on the use of In-Tend, please contact In-Tend support on 0845 557 8079 / +44 (0) 114 407 0065.
      
      You must upload your bid by using the `Attach Documents` button and your return must be submitted via 'Submit Return' on the Citizen E-Procurement portal before the deadline date provided in the project details. You will have the option to modify you bid up until the deadline.

title: Daventry District Council- DC Isolation of Solar Arrays
description:
The solar array at Daventry District Council's offices was installed in 2012 and has been operating successfully since then. The installation was installed in accordance with the appropriate standards at the time.

A recent fire risk assessment of the office building identified a potential health and safety risk associated with the solar array's direct current (DC) network. The risk assessment noted that there was no means of isolating the DC link from the rooftop arrays to the inverters and, in the event of an incident in the building, the network will remain live even after the building's electricity supply had been isolated. This presents a risk to any persons who would be required to enter the building, for example firefighters. The Council has resolved to address this risk.

The Council engaged a specialist company to review the existing system and propose an appropriate method to provide DC electrical disconnection at panel level. The recommended solution is to install the Solar Edge inverter system with DC optimisers installed under the solar panels. The new inverters will replace the existing inverters, which will be disposed of.

The work also provides an opportunity to address a problem with pigeons nesting underneath the panel arrays and to undertake cleaning of both the panels and the roof guttering.

title: Cambridge City Council - Building Cleaning
description:
Cambridge City Council (The Council) is calling for bids to fulfill its building cleaning services for the city across three core lots and two additional specialist cleaning contract lots, resulting in the following five lot structure as follows: 

•	Lot 1: Administration, commercial buildings, community centres and operational buildings
•	Lot 2: Public toilets
•	Lot 3: City Homes communal areas and sheltered housing schemes
•	Lot 4: Multi-storey car parks
•	Lot 5: Window cleaning
Suppliers are invited to bid for one or more of the five lots, in any combination.  
Please note the current arrangement is with a single supplier and as such the exact nature of the TUPE requirements and who transfer to whom will not be known until the selection process is complete and the number of successful tenderers has been identified.
A contract term is initially 3 years, with an option to extend by 2 years then up to 2 further years, if the supplier is performing satisfactorily, and the service can be shown to continue to provide best value to the Council; this gives a maximum possible contract length of 7 years.
Assessment - price: quality tender assessment split of 40% price: 60% quality
The current contract is due to end on the 19th June 2020 and it is anticipated that the start date of the new contract will be begin on the current contract end date (20th June 2020).

title: Quotation for the Meadows School
description:
As the population of Sandwell grows so does the demand for school places which also includes the demand for places in our special schools. Having undertaken an independent review (EVOLVE Review 2015-2016) of Special Educational Need (SEN) provision in Sandwell, the council and the Joint Executive Head Teacher Group (JEG) has identified the need to increase SEN provision by using the full capacities of our schools, including special schools.  Consideration has been given to what additional provision is required and what can be better utilised within our existing schools.  The EVOLVE programme provides the strategic direction for building the extra capacity required across the Authority's education provision.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the Quotation document or other related documents.
      
      In Order To View a On-Line Questionnaire (if applicable) or Submit a Quotation, you will be required to` Opt-In`.   
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Friday 31 January  2020 at 15:00hrs

title: UCA Website Redevelopment
description:
The University for the Creative Arts is currently out to tender for the redevelopment of the UCA web environment.
      
      Suppliers that would like to take part in this tender process are invited to Express Interest until 09/04/2020 upon which they will be given access to the full tender documentation through this e-tendering system. 
      
      
      Tender submissions must be received by  Midday 09/04/2020
      
      Please allow sufficient time to make your return as late returns will not be permitted.
      
      Any questions relating to this tender should be made via correspondence on the website and can be addressed to the main contact as shown in the details above.

title: CPH024 Targeted Substance Misuse Service for Children and Young People
description:
A single provider to deliver a Targeted Substance Misuse Service for Children and Young People under theLight Touch Regime (LTR) to screen higher risk populations throughout Derbyshire (excluding Derby City) inorder to identify young people using drugs or alcohol and other psychoactive substances; deliver interventionsaimed at reducing harm and refer to the specialist service where more intensive support is required.
The contract start date will be 01 June 2020 to 31 March 2022 with the option to extend for a further 2 years up to 31 March 2024.
There will be an implementation period of 3 months prior to the contract start date.
Please note that the contract price is fixed at £112,000 per annum for the contract term up to 31 March 2024.
(Please note the amount will be pro rata for the first 10 months of the service)

title: The Supply & Delivery of Vehicle Paint & Associated Consumables
description:
The Mayor's Office for Policing and Crime (MOPAC), as the contracting authority, is tendering for the provision of Vehicle Paint and Associated Consumables for the Metropolitan Police Service (MPS) Discreet Fleet Services.
      
      Fleet Services is responsible for a discreet and specialised vehicle fleet of approximately 1200 vehicles, including Cars, Vans, LGV's, HGV's, Equipment carriers, Motorcycles, Armoured Vehicles and Marine Vessels. Retained Fleet Service provide vehicle and equipment maintenance and repair of this fleet, ensuring the delivery of the required levels of asset availability.
       
       Please see attached documents for more details. 
       Please see attached documents for more details. 
       Please see attached documents for more details.

title: GB-Swansea: Provision of AWS Exam Vouchers
description:
The DVLA are currently upskilling a number of staff in various areas and levels of Amazon Web Service (AWS) certifications, including Cyber Security, Service Creation, Enterprise Architecture, and Applications Support. Following the training an examination must be undertaken and passed in order for delegates to successfully complete the training programme and achieve certification in the subject.
      
      This requirement is for the purchase of examinations for various subjects/levels of AWS training, along with the provision to purchase any additional exams that may be needed for resit purposes.

title: Provision Of Eye Clinic Liaison Officer (ECLO) Service
description:
Wakefield Council and the Wakefield Clinical Commissioning Group wish to jointly commission an ECLO service to support people of all ages, from birth onwards, who are resident in the Wakefield District and/or are registered with a GP practice within the Wakefield District, and who are experiencing significant sight loss/low vision or who have recently been certified as blind or partially sighted. This service is extended to carers and family members. This service will form part of a wider comprehensive range of services that meet the needs and outcomes of people with a visual impairment across Wakefield District, removes barriers, and promotes their independence and wellbeing.

The aims of The Service is to:

•	Support Wakefield Council to prevent, reduce and delay the need for care and support services for individuals experiencing sight loss.
•	Provide professional, high quality information, advice and support services for people experiencing sight loss and their carers
•	Provide early intervention in a person's sight loss journey at point of diagnosis, providing impartial non-medical advice, information, and practical and emotional support to individuals and their carers
•	Provide timely access to community based support services by signposting and referral; including referral to appropriate Local Authority services
•	Enable people to begin to adjust to significant sight loss and to provide direction which in the longer term will enable the maintenance of quality of life, control, choice and independence
•	Make the Certificate of Vision Impairment (CVI) registration process efficient, enabling service users to access benefits and services sooner
•	Proactively promote the offer of The Service to citizens, professionals and other key agencies, including the third sector
•	Enable service users and professionals to provide feedback and to participate in the development of The Service
•	Inform Service users that they can re-engage The Service as and when they need support

title: Roofing Planned and Repair Works 2020-23
description: The project is for the planned roofing replacement and repairs at properties owned by Weaver Vale Housing Trust Ltd in the County of Cheshire area. The Contract is for 3 years which will include the option, at the Trust's sole discretion, to extend up to a maximum of 1 further year through the implementation of the extensions (subject to the successful Contractors' adherence to the Agreements and yearly reviews). The Works are described in detail in the tender and contract documents.

title: VEHICLE BODYWORK REPAIR SERVICES
description:
The London Borough of Bromley ("the Council") is inviting tenders for the provision of Vehicle Bodywork Repair Services under a contract to support its vehicle fleet operation                                                                                                                                         
 The service required is to carry out accidental damage and other bodywork repairs to a fleet of lease cars and light commercial vehicles operated by the Council, which could be driveable or non-driveable at the point that work is required.

title: Private Contract Security
description:
The Birmingham 2022 Commonwealth Games requires the provision of Private Contract Security with the following specialisms:
      •Security Industry Authority (SIA) PCS Supervisors
      •Licensed SIA personnel (qualified Level 2 Door Supervisor)
      •SIA Public Space CCTV (Operations)
      •Security Screening X-Ray Operators
      Resourcing will increase on an incremental level, covering Pre-Games, Games Time and Post-Games.
      It is envisaged that this opportunity will be on a multi-lot basis.
      
      A draft initial scope and market engagement questionnaire document is attached to this PIN and should you wish to respond, completed and submitted to the Contracting Authority via Delta by 12 noon on Monday 6th January 2020.

title: KMCAS-142 Provision of Rehabilitation, Equipment, Support, Information and Advice for Adults with a Visual Impairment Service
description: Tenders are invited by The Council of the Borough of Kirklees from Service Providers with relevant experience and ability to demonstrate sufficient capacity to provide a Provision of Rehabilitation, Equipment, Support, Information and Advice for Adults with a Visual Impairment Service. The contract will initially run for a period of 2 (two) years up to 30 June 2022, with the option to extend the contract by up to a maximum of two (2) further twelve (12) month periods. Tender documents are available to download at https://www.yortender.co.uk/procontract/supplier.nsf

title: Technical Consultancy Services for a Peer Assessment of Hereford Transport Package and South Wye Transport Package
description:
The Hereford Transport Package (HTP) and South Wye Transport Package (SWTP) are major transport packages which have been developed to support the growth of Hereford, as set out in the Herefordshire Local Plan Core Strategy 2016-31. They form key parts of the council's transport strategy as set out in the Herefordshire Local Transport Plan 2016-31. 
The council has decided to undertake a peer review of these two packages to inform its next steps. 
The council welcomes bids from suitably qualified suppliers, to access the tender documents please go to: www.supplyingthesowuthwest.org.uk and search under Herefordshire Council.

title: GB-Gillingham: Medway Park Pool Refurbishment Project
description:
These works should enable the pool to meet the PWTAG (Pool Water Treatment Advisory Group) standards, the PWTAG Code of Practice ensures that Medway Council, as the swimming pool operator, are able to comply with their general duties under the Health and Safety at Work etc Act 1974 and the associated regulations.
      
      When complete, the works must ensure that the technical operation of a pool meets quality standards that provide a healthy experience for swimmers using recognised and established practices, techniques, engineering and design.  The successful bidder should, as far as is reasonably practicable, ensure that the pool operation meets all the current and anticipated legislation and is economically advantageous to operate. 
      
      Works may include such areas as; but are not limited to:
      
      The refurbishment as required of 2 x Main Pool, 1 x Diving Pool and 1 x Training Pool filtration vessels, to include:
      • the replacement of filter media 
      • the disposal of existing media at a registered landfill site
      • an internal inspection of the underdrain system and inlet distribution system
      • an inspection of the concrete under bed
      • application of a solvent-free, epoxy lining, where required
      • replacement of existing air release valves with new automatic air release and bulk air drains
      • The installation of compliant lower manway with door to each filter vessel (current manways are not adequate)
      • Complete removal of all circulation cast iron/steel pipework, valves and fittings [including disposal].  Supply and installation of uPVC replacement pipework, butterfly valves and fittings and the reinstatement of the chemical dosing onto the new circulation system.
      • The installation of new dial gauge flow meter displays and orifice plate on each pool circulation system.
      • The replacement of the 3 x Chemical Dosing Controllers to the latest standard
      • The installation of a PAC [Polyaluminium Chloride] flocculent to the pool filtration systems

title: 9845 - Lamppost Banner Systems
description: Norwich City Council (the council) is seeking a company who will install, maintain, manage and market the banner scheme in Norwich. This is to include fixing on 87 lighting columns.  Any system must not contravene requirements of Traffic Management Act 2004 and should minimise wind loading on columns and risk of damage to banners.

title: GB-London: 663004 Allhallows, All Saints Church
description: Religious buildings construction work. Historic building repair with internal joinery and services alterations to the grade 1 listed church of All Saints, Allhallows. Works include repairs to galleted Kentish Ragstone and flint walling, slate roofs, cast iron rainwater goods, below ground drainage including archaeological monitoring of work within the burial ground, mechanical and electrical services and joinery work. Contract value £250,000 GBP approx. Tender issue will be subject to evaluation of expressions of interest and is anticipated in June 2020 subject to the successful award of a National Lottery Heritage Fund grant.

title: Provision of Internal Audit Services for South Yorkshire Fire & Rescue Authority
description: South Yorkshire Fire & Rescue Authority (the Authority) is looking to establish a contract with a Provider for Internal Audit Services. Barnsley Metropolitan Borough Council will be managing this process for the Authority. This procurement is for Internal Audit services covering the scope of work and responsibilities of the Authority. The Fire and Rescue Service under the leadership of the Chief Fire Officer and Chief Executive delivers services to the communities of South Yorkshire and consequently is where internal audit activity is predominantly focussed. The Authority has delegated certain functions to the Audit and Governance Committee that oversees the work of Internal Audit.

title: 2459/447/MY/DPG/19 3D Printed Electronics Prototyping (3DPEP)
description:
2459/447/MY/DPG/19       3D Printed Electronics Prototyping (3DPEP)
      
      The University of Sheffield wishes to invite tenders for a 3D Printed Electronics Prototyping (3DPEP) on behalf of the Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre, Design and Prototyping Group at Catcliffe, South Yorkshire.
      
      Scope of Requirement
      The AMRC Design and Prototyping Group have a need to develop a capability for rapid prototyping of electronic circuit designs. Developing this capability will support the strategic aim of the AMRC Design and Prototyping group to provide a world class agile digital product prototyping service and demonstrate to industry the opportunities for integrated agile digital product design.
      
      Tender Process and Documentation:
      This procurement is an EU open procedure conducted in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015
      
      The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield
      
      If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend System, this can be accessed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield
      
      Completed tenders must be returned through the same e-tendering system.
      
      Closing date for receipt of tenders:  23rd March 2020 at 12 noon (UK time).

title: GB-Chelmsford: CO0001 Essex Social care Academy Training Framework
description:
The purpose of this procurement is to provide social care practitioners with the skills and knowledge to deliver the best outcomes to the community they serve.  This will include, although is not limited to, newly qualified and experience social workers, senior support staff, residential workers, occupational therapist, senior practitioners, team managers, service managers, fosters carers and director of local delivery through a multi-supplier Framework. Lot breakdown as follows;
      Lot 1 - Assessment, including Achieving Best Evidence, Age Assessment - Unaccompanied Asylum-Seeking Children & Young People, Assessing mental capacity and making restrictions on liberty decisions for children and young people, Assessment, Reflection & Analysis, Sibling Assessment and Unaccompanied Asylum Seeking Children & Young People
      Lot 2 - Behaviour, including; Courses on Gangs, Attachment, Motivational interviewing, Non-Violence Resistance (NVR), Positive behaviour and physical intervention, Working with known, suspected or alleged perpetrators of child sexual abuse, Vicarious trauma and burnout.
      Lot 3 - Ethical, including; Equality and Diversity (Audience: Social Care and Foster Carers), Modern Slavery and Trafficking
      Lot 4 - Health, including; Foetal alcohol spectrum disorders (FASD), Mental Health (Child & Adolescent Mental Health Training), Self Harm  - Social care workers,          Substance misuse - Course, Therapeutic life story work, Theraplay Training, Working with parents who have learning disabilities/difficulties, Eye Movement Desensitisation and Reprocessing therapy - EMDR
      Lot 5 - Legal, including; Law for NQSWs, Protecting children and young people
      Lot 6 - Social, including; Housing, Neglect, Social Media Safeguarding: Children, Young people and their Families, Vulnerable Adults and our Essex Social Care workforce in online environments and social media
      Lot 7 - Trauma, including; Bereavement, loss & grief, Child / Adolescent to Parent Abuse, Domestic abuse - male and or same sex victims, Domestic Abuse; Living with the Perpetrator, Harmful Sexual Behaviour 1)Harmful sexual behaviour in young people under the age of 12, 2) Harmful sexual behaviour - adolescents and young people over 12, Neuroscience, Brain development and impact of trauma on emotional wellbeing and behaviour difficulties in those in Foster Care, Trauma, Relational & Developmental

title: EBC AJ 2020 Gazetteer Management System Replacement - AWARD

Elmbridge Borough Council is seeking to replace their gazetteer management software (GMS/LLPG) solution. 
      EBC must replace the current software solution with a system that meets business requirements, represents value for money and can be completed within project deadlines with the least disruption to services.

title: Canterbury Park & Ride Bus Service - Zero Emission Fleet to start within one year of contract start date
description:
Canterbury City Council ("the Council") wishes to select and appoint a suitable supplier for the provision of a Park and Ride Bus Service and invites tenderers to submit a tender to meet the Council's requirements.                                                                          
The Services have been divided into the following service packages (Lots):
Lot 1 Zero Emission within the first anniversary of the Commencement Date - Electric Vehicles 
Lot 2 Zero Emission within  the first anniversary of the Commencement Date - Hydrogen Vehicles                                                          
note fleet vehicles may be any fuel type until delivery of the specific fuel type as described within each Lot, which must be within the anniversary date of the contract start.                                                                                                                                                            
The Contract is anticipated to commence 5 October 2020 and will continue for a period of 7 years (unless terminated early in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Contract), and may be extended for a period of up to 1 year subject to the satisfactory performance of the Services by the Contractor and at the Council's entire discretion

title: Professional Consultancy Services
description:
Text to be corrected in the original notice:
        Place of text to be modified: Place of performance
        Instead of: UKG21
        Read: UKG
        The Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) will provide a database of approved suppliers considered capable of carrying out professional consultancy services to a satisfactory standard. The nature and types of services that may be required may include, but are not limited to, those services identified by the CPV code and summarised in Section II.2).
        The specific services cannot be clearly defined at this stage, however the nature and types of services that may be required may include, but are not limited to, buildings and civils professional consultancy services
        The DPS is a 2-stage process:
        Stage 1: all providers who meet the selection criteria within the online questionnaire and are not excluded will be admitted to the DPS. New providers can also apply to join the DPS at any point during its lifetime;
        Stage 2: contracts are awarded during the second stage. A call-off competition will be put out inviting each approved provider on the DPS list relating to the particular lot.

title: CCC - Rural Estate Manager - HQ00019169 - AWARD
description:
Opus is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Temporary Recruitment Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2019/S 022-048063
      
      Rural Estate Manager - Based at Shire Hall, Cambridge, due to be relocating to Alconbury Weald in December 2020/2021
      
      Permanent equivalent P4 - £48,302 - £50,852 PAYE - 28 days basic holiday plus 8 BH
      
      £300 to £350 per day umbrella for an agency worker - rate must be indicated on the questionnaire for each candidate submitted
      
      Lot 13 - Property
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is Monday 2 December 2019 at 12.00noon. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is Friday 29 November  2019 at 12.00noon  which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website

title: OG - Supply of New Battery Operated Machinery for Grounds Maintenance - PP998
description:
Orbit Group Limited (Orbit) are looking for a supplier who is able to supply battery operated grounds maintenance machinery including but not limited to the types set out below, together with a comprehensive all inclusive fixed cost maintenance and servicing provision including the batteries for such items to be purchased over a phased period of 2 to 3 years as the Client phases out its use of petrol operated machinery and equipment. 
• 18 pedestrian mowers 
• 18 commercial batteries 
• 10 harnesses 
• 10 charging units 
• 5 compact hedge trimmers 
• 5 long reach/telescopic hedge trimmers 
• Double sided blades for hedge trimmers (if not supplied with hedge trimmers) 
• 10 brush cutters 
• 10 hand blowers

The machinery is to service Orbit schemes in the Midlands. Delivery to potentially be to multiple locations within the area. Please see the Request for Quotation document for full requirement.
This tender opportunity is being run via the e-procurement portal 'Procontract'. If not already registered, your company can register for free via https://procontract.due-north.com. Once registered you will need to search for the opportunity and register your interest to access all
The relevant documentation and submit your response. 

Please read the full requirements and answer all questions.  Any additional documents that may be requested must be uploaded with your response via the portal.

You must submit your quote through ProContract no later than the date specified.  Quotes may be submitted at any time before the closing date although will remain sealed until the opening date.

The following information must be provided:
• Questionnaire Response
• Signed Appendices (including T&C's)
• Pricing Schedule

All clarification questions must be raised via the portal.

title: GB-London: Transport Statistics Online Data Collections
description:
DfT invites proposals for the following service to host collection, storage, compilation and onward transmission to DfT of transport data collected from bus operators and local authorities via secure web-based surveys.
      
      Statistics Travel and Safety (STS) division of The Authority has responsibility for the collection of data and provision of statistical analysis and advice on a wide range of topics related to personal travel including buses, taxis and disabled parking. The division also co-ordinates the collection of data from local authorities covering other aspects of transport statistics, for example on road conditions. The collected data is used to produce a range of National Statistics publications, available from the gov.uk website: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-transport/about/statistics

title: Cambridgeshire County Council and Peterborough City Council Sexual Illhealth Prevention Services
description: This service is focused on the prevention of sexual ill health and includes primary and secondary prevention deliverables alongside the provision of support for vulnerable groups living with sexual ill health and who have wide ranging complex issues. The Commissioner acknowledges that there is a range of expertise found in different organisations and is interested in a collaborative contractual and service delivery model that best utilizes resources and assets.

title: Provision of Reactive, Statutory & Planned Maintenance Services
description:
This opportunity is advertised via The Chest  https://www.the-chest.org.uk/ Project reference -  DN454976.                              Cumbria County Council ("the Council") seeks to appoint a competent Service Provider for the undertaking of works associated with Reactive, Statutory and Planned Maintenance for Electrical & Mechanical and Building Fabric for the Council's Corporate Properties (Sites) in Cumbria. The Contract is to cover approximately Two hundred and Forty One Cumbria County Council managed properties. In addition to the Corporate Council sites, the School Estate has the option to buy into the contract and should be accommodated at the agreed rates/ prices presented within the tender.
The Council proposes to enter into the Contract(s) Agreement for a maximum period of 22 months with the 
successful Tenderer (Service Provider) with an option for further 2 single year extensions to March 2024 (Total 46 months).The Contract term may only be extended if it was advertised on this basis and the Council shall have absolute discretion to extend the contract.

In addition to the Corporate Council sites, the School Estate has the option to buy into the contract and should be accommodated at the agreed rates/ prices presented within the tender.\r\nThe Council proposes to enter into the Contract(s) Agreement for a maximum period of 22 months with the \r\nsuccessful Tenderer (Service Provider) with an option for further 2 single year extensions to March 2024 (Total 46 months).The Contract term may only be extended if it was advertised on this basis and the Council shall have absolute discretion to extend the contract.", "supplyChain": false, "hasEnquiries": null, "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2020-02-05T00:00:00Z"}, "awardCriteria": null, "submissionMethod": null, "xClassifications": {"isSuitableForSme": true, "isSuitableForVco": false, "ojeuContractType": "Services"}, "procurementMethod": null, "eligibilityCriteria": null, "awardCriteriaDetails": null, "submissionMethodDetails": "Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section.", "procurementMethodDetails": "Open procedure", "procurementMethodRationale": ""}, "language": "en-GB", "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "publishedDate": "2020-05-12T02:07:36.639811+00:00"}

title: Serviced Apartment Accommodation for patients of The Christie NHS Foundation Trust, and their families and/or carers.
description:
The Trust requires a provision of Serviced Apartments, local to The Christie main site in Withington, Manchester and the Royal Manchester Children's Hospital ("RMCH") on the University Campus, Manchester, to accommodate its patients and their families and carers while they are preparing for and receiving cancer treatment.
The Serviced Apartments will be used by patients and their families as part of a service managed by The Christie. The Christie will be the corporate client and will direct the bookings of apartments within the provision according to the patient's treatment timescale. 
Each patient stay is expected to last between a single night at minimum and up to approximately 60 nights at maximum. Patients may be under the clinical care of one or more Trust departments during their stay, including but not limited to:
•	Proton Therapy
•	Young Oncology Unit Ambulatory Care Services
•	CAR T-Cell Therapy
•	Specialist Surgery
•	Clinical Trials
IMPORTANT NOTE: The sought provision is non-clinical in nature. Bidders are asked to provide serviced apartments only, and are not required or expected to provide medical care of any kind. The provider will not take any clinical responsibilities for patients staying at their premises.

title: Home Support CQC Regulated Services -  Bradford South, Wyke and Royds
description:
Further to the award of the Home Support CQC Regulated Services Contracts earlier this year, the City of Bradford Metropolitan District Council has found it necessary to re-provision services in two specific Locality areas, and therefore seeks tenders from providers of Home Support services for personalised support and care to adults in the Bradford South, Wyke and Royds areas.

The purpose of this contract will be the delivery of a range of personal care and domestic/community support services to individuals in their own homes and will cover support to older people and those with support needs relating to learning disabilities, mental health and/or physical disabilities

title: CBC-1103-H-TS - Greenfield Close - Fire Damage - AWARD
description:
Greenfield Close - Fire Refurbishment work
      
      Please note timeline with regards to questions and submission dates.
      
      All communication/correspondence and clarifications must be sent via the In-tend portal. Please do not contact the Service area directly.
      
      Please view the 'Clarification' tab for any updates or responses to questions asked.
      
      Please avoid uploading your return just prior to closing deadline as you may incure IT issues and we will not accept Tender Returns via e-mail.
      
      The Council will provide as much support and information as it can to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the response, will be made available to all suppliers tendering, to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification of, then please contact us using the correspondence facility within the In-tend electronic tendering system.
      
      Please ensure that you inform us of your decision to participate. To submit a response, you will be required to Opt In.
      
      Opt In- This will confirm to us of your involvement and your intention to submit a return.
      
      Opt Out- This will confirm to us that you are not submitting a return. You will be able to provide a reason as to your decision and have the option to cease any system-generated communication. You will be able to opt back in at any point. 
      
      Target contract commencement date: Wednesday 29th January 2020
      Contract term: 6 weeks

title: Operation of the HEFER consultation website 2020 - 2023 - AWARD
description:
The project is intended to support the operation and enhancement of the Historic Environment Farm Environment Record (HEFER) web portal (https://www.myshinedata.org.uk/) during the period 2020-2023.  
      
      The portal is used by Historic England and ALGAO to provide historic environment advice to prospective applicants, Natural England (NE) and the Rural Payments Agency (RPA) on Countryside Stewardship (CS) applications.  The portal also manages and provides access to the national Selected Heritage Inventory for Natural England (SHINE) dataset of undesignated heritage assets on behalf of local authority historic environment services.

title: West Suffolk Garden Waste - AWARD
description:
Manage, maintain and operate composting facilities to accept and process garden waste collected by West Suffolk on the days and times required. Core operating hours when the Facilities must be open to receive Garden Waste are 07:00 to 17:00 Monday to Friday. The Contractor shall ensure that Consents and Planning Permissions allow for additional opening when requested which may include weekends, public holidays, bank holidays and late opening. West Suffolk will work with the successful Contractor to establish dates where bank holiday/weekend working is required.
      
      Receive and process garden waste to produce a compost material to accepted industry standards. For the avoidance of doubt the processed material must be classed as recycled in accordance with National Indicator 192 (http://www.sandwelltrends.info/lisv2/ni_handbook/NI192.pdf) or any future amendment to this standard.

title: Dynamic Purchasing System for Supported Living Services in Worcestershire
description:
Worcestershire County Council is committed to making sure that people with disabilities have the opportunity to live as independently and as normal a life as possible. As part of this commitment a range of supported living accommodation has been and is being developed across the County for people with disabilities.  These are mainly a mix of clusters of flats and shared houses.  When the Specification was written 415 people with learning disabilities were living independently in supported accommodation and that number is expected to increase.
      
      The Council wishes to ensure that all Service Users have the opportunity to receive care and support from good quality Service Providers who listen to what people want, are empowering and promote independence wherever possible, provide services when and where people want, and provide safe services whilst not being overly risk averse. 
      
      Worcestershire County Council  is looking for providers of Supported Living Services to join a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) for the future procurement of them. The DPS will create a list of suppliers that can provide the services which the Council require for call off of future service delivery.
      
      Details of the services required can be found in the Service Specification. 
      
      Please could tenderers ensure they read all the documentation provided and return all completed documents as requested and detailed in the DPS Information and  Guidance provided.
      
      Please 'View Details' and then 'Express Interest' and then in order to upload and complete the mandatory Questionnaire you must 'Opt in'.

description: The Borough Council of Wellingborough is seeking tenders to refurbish, re-equip and re-design four of its play areas. The works must be completed between 1st Mar and 31st May next year. The play areas cater for a range of needs and age groups. Further details are to be found in the Specification and accompanying tender documents. The deadline for bids is noon Fri 3rd Jan and the expectation is that award and contract signing will be completed by 1st Feb for a 1st March start on site. The form of contract being used is the JCT Minor Works with Contractor's Design 2016 edition. The tender documents are available from www.eastmidstenders.org project reference DN449438  Interested parties MUST register on this tender portal to access the tender documents and enable them send and receive clarification questions and answers. The deadline for questions is close of play Thu 19th December.

title: Daventry District Council- Moulton Sports Centre Car Park Extension Works
description: The Council are in the process of purchasing the Chris Moody Centre and some adjacent agricultural land from Moulton College to convert into a new leisure centre. Part of the works is to extend the existing car park into the adjacent agricultural grazing land to provide circa 190 car spaces in total and re-allocate the existing spaces to provide parking for motorcycles, more accessible parking spaces and to add a footpath from the car parking area to the building main entrance as well as to provide both cycle hoops and cycle storage lockers in the main entrance to the building.

title: Asbestos Testing and Surveys
description:
Services required under the framework are expected to include surveying and testing
for asbestos, as well as the provision of associated reports, across a variety of
property types primarily within Knowsley, but also potentially anywhere in the North West of England as appropriate to meet the needs of First Ark. From time to time, successful contractors may also be required to conduct quality
assurance assessments on work conducted by other framework contractors. 

The initial estimated annual value of the framework is £120,000 excluding VAT
based upon historical expenditure, however, this is an estimate only. It is likely that
the volume of work required by KHT under the framework will increase for
subsequent years of the framework, so annual expenditure could increase by up to
50% per annum over the framework duration.

Please see the tender documents for full service requirements.

This procurement exercise is being led by Knowsley Housing Trust (KHT) for itself
and on behalf of the other members of the First Ark Group and references in this
document to KHT/First Ark/the Group should be construed accordingly.

The framework will be available to the following, such that each of the following will
be entitled to purchase goods/services from the successful supplier at the discretion
of First Ark Group:

- First Ark Group and all subsidiary undertakings of First Ark both current and
future
- All parts of any current or future group structure of which First Ark is, or may
become, a part
- Any joint venture entities (whether companies, limited liability partnerships or
otherwise) in which any member of First Ark participates from time to time
(whether as a shareholder, member or otherwise), and are permitted by First
Ark to make particular purchases from the service provider from time to time

      SUM033 Oulton, Lowestoft to Inspire Suffolk, Benjamin Britton School.

title: Nightly Paid Accommodation Framework Project
description:
The Royal Borough of Kingston is seeking expressions of interest from interested parties to join the Framework in provision of Temporary Accommodation. The Council through the establishment of the framework will have access to a much wider pool of providers who are able to provide suitable accommodation, providers will be evaluated and accredited onto the Framework for three years contract with option to extend annually twice.

The benefit of the framework is to ensure that all providers are operating to the same quality level, a minimum quality criteria has been set that must be met in order to join the Framework. Documents detailing requirements are attached and other related documents that will inform on specifications requirements, please take the time to read these documents.
buyer: The Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames

title: GB-High Wycombe: 26-28 White Hart Street
description: Refurbishment of the premises at 26 -28 White Hart Street, High Wycombe to create a ground floor café and 1st floor office space. The works will include, but are not limited to, new electrical and mechanical services, new cladding and external decorations, fitting of internal security shutters to the ground floor facade, re-roofing to include the replacement of existing roof lights, minor structural repairs, drainage repairs, drylining and partitions, internal finishes and landlord fit-out.

title: Framework for the supply of OSCE Ready International Nurses
description:
Maidstone and Tunbridge Wells NHS Trust (MTW) are seeking tenders from suitably experienced Supplier who can provide OSCE ready international nurses in accordance with the service specification and other associated documentation. 
The development of a Direct Award Framework will enable NHS organisations to access the single appointed Supplier for the provision of OSCE ready international nurses. This is seen as a valuable resource for NHS Trust's within the United Kingdom and represents an exciting step change in the provision of Nurses into the NHS. 
The Contract will run for 48 months, unless terminated in accordance with the Terms and Conditions. 
Expressions of interest will only be accepted via the Trust Procurement Portal. MTW is undertaking this procurement activity under the Competitive Procedure with Negotiation Procedure and will subsequently award a direct access Framework that is accessible by all NHS Trust's within the United Kingdom.

title: Quotation for New Information Governance & Cyber Security e-Learning and Phishing Solution
description:
Title: Quotation for New Information Governance & Cyber Security e-Learning and Phishing Solution
      
      Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council (the Council) is seeking quotations from potential providers primarily for the provision of an eLearning tool.  The product will be used by all (approximately 5,000) employees to undertake training in Information Governance, Data Protection and Cyber Security, and to carry out phishing campaigns.  Additional functionality that may be of use to the council will be considered, but as a secondary benefit of the system.
      Potential providers must be able to demonstrate that their application can meet the Council's requirements (as detailed in this document).
      Potential providers should complete all sections in full. The contract will be awarded based on quality (how well the product can demonstrate it meets our requirements, we will also take in to consideration the road map of the product factoring in enhanced features and the future vision of the product) and cost. 
      The preferred bidder will be invited to demonstrate the proposed solution.  The purpose of which will be the proposed functionality.
       
      Period of Contract
       
      As an indication the Contract is expected to commence 1 April 2020 and will be awarded for a period of 2 years until 31 March 2022, with the option for a further 12-months extension until 31 March 2023.  
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal. From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to Quotation or other related documents. To submit a quotation you will be required to 'Opt In'. For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Monday 24th February 2020 at 12:00noon
