title: SC19002 - Waste Transfer Services (Dover and Folkestone & Hythe)
description:
KCC requires waste transfer services that encompasses the provision of reception, handling and haulage of waste collected by Waste Collection Authorities (WCAs) within the East Kent Waste Partnership, including: Dover District Council (DDC) and Folkestone & Hythe District Council (FHDC). The required services are going to be split across three geographical lots: (Lot 1) Waste Transfer Services for DDC (service commencement on 1 November 2020); and (Lot 2) Waste Transfer Services for FHDC (service commencement on 16 January 2021).
Waste Transfer Sites must be conveniently located to receive the waste collected by one or more of the above named WCAs (e.g. within, or within a reasonable distance from, the boundary of the relevant WCA for fully laden Refuse Collection Vehicles taking the most appropriate route). 
Waste transfer services will include the following services: (a) the reception of waste (i.e. allowing the off-loading of waste by Refuse Collection Vehicles and other waste collection vehicles); and (b) the haulage of waste to waste processing/disposal sites. 
All organisations that register an interest in this opportunity via the Kent Business Portal will automatically be invited to tender.  KCC anticipates publishing the Invitation to Tender (ITT) on 6 March 2020 (subject to change).  The ITT will contain both selection and award criteria.

title: Football Foundation Artificial Grass Pitch (AGP) Supplier Framework 2020
description: The Contracting Authority has established a multiple provider "Manufacturer-led" framework to deliver artificial grass pitches (AGP). Providers are be required to design, supply and install AGP pitches and all associated works to provide sports playing surfaces to meet the requirements of the National Governing Bodies of Sport including Football, Hockey, Rugby Union and Rugby League. The Contracting Authority will act as Funder for Applicants who will come from primarily public sector bodies such as schools and not for profit sports clubs.  Works will be delivered adopting a two-stage design & build approach.  The Contracting Authority is purchasing on behalf of itself and the entities listed at Section VI.

title: DBC (SF) Cleaning Service at Maylands Business Centre and Kylna Court - AWARD
description:
Dacorum Borough Council requires cleaning services at Maylands Business Centre (MBC) and Kylna Court.
      
      MBC and Kylna Court are both flagship developments and state of the art facilities for new and growing businesses. Both centres are owned, supported, and managed by Dacorum Borough Council. It is essential, therefore, that the Centres are cleaned to a high standard and well presented, for the benefit of tenants, visitors and staff.
      
      More information including how to book appointments to view the sites is in the Tender documents.
      
      The current supplier who cleans Maylands Business Centre has confirmed that TUPE does apply. TUPE information can be requested via the portal
      
      Please submit your completed tender document via the Council's e-tendering portal no later than 12 noon 4 September 2019. Any tender submitted either manually or by email will not be accepted.

title: Extension Supported Employment provision
description:
Brighter Futures is a community-based project, which provides a wide range of learning and employment support interventions to support holistic social inclusion within Leicester and Leicestershire. We would like to commission Supported Employment provision to complement other forms of support available through the project during its extension period from 1st July 2020 and 30th December 2021. We are inviting applications from providers who are able to supply Supported Employment provision for people with common mental and physical health conditions and/or learning difficulties and/or disabilities. The provision will need to include individual health and employment action planning, advice workshops, vocational profiling, job matching and in-work support. A full description of the provision requirements is included in the attached specification and questionnaire document which is also available at https://www.business2businesslimited.com/current-partnership-opportunities. If you are interested in supplying this provision, please complete the attached specification and questionnaire document and return to Rob Gray at rob@business2businesslimited.com by the submission deadline of 11.45pm on Friday 31st January 2020. 
      For all clarifications, please send written queries to rob@business2businesslimited.com. A response will be given within two working days of the query being raised. Within three working days of the query being made, the questions and answers document available on the Business2Business website will be updated with an anonymised version of the query and the given response. The deadline for queries relating to this specification is 5pm on Thursday 23rd January 2020.
       
       Responses will be scored against fixed selection and award criteria. 
      The following selection criteria will be used:
      
      •	Organisational capacity
      •	Economic and financial standing
      •	Prior experience of service delivery
      
      Tenders that do not satisfy the above selection criteria will be de-selected from the procurement process.
      The following Most Economically Advantageous Tender (MEAT) award criteria will be used to score tenders that satisfy the selection criteria:
      •	Price 20%
      •	Merit of provision design 20%
      •	Quality of plans to engage employers 20%
      •	Merit of approach to meeting the needs of participants 20%
      •	Quality of the approach to be taken to management and monitoring 20%
      
      The highest scoring tender will be the winning tender. Only information supplied by tenderers in response to the questions will be taken into account during the scoring process.  Please note that additional information may be requested as part of our due diligence procedures. 
       Brighter Futures (https://www.business2businesslimited.com/brighterfutures) is a community-based project, which provides a wide range of learning and employment support interventions to support the holistic social inclusion of unemployed and economically inactive people aged 16+ within Leicester and Leicestershire. Delivered through a partnership of local organisations, the project is funded by the European Social Fund and the National Lottery, through the Big Lottery Fund. 
      The project began in December 2017 and was due to end in June 2020. However, a project extension granted by the Big Lottery and Leicester and Leicestershire LEP will enable the project to continue to meet the ongoing demand and need for support from local residents.
      This procurement of Supported Employment provision will be funded through the project's Community Provision Budget which was established to enable the procurement of supplementary support to meet participants' additional needs.

Within three working days of the query being made, the questions and answers document available on the Business2Business website will be updated with an anonymised version of the query and the given response. The deadline for queries relating to this specification is 5pm on Thursday 23rd January 2020.
       
       Responses will be scored against fixed selection and award criteria. 
      The following selection criteria will be used:
      
      •	Organisational capacity
      •	Economic and financial standing
      •	Prior experience of service delivery
      
      Tenders that do not satisfy the above selection criteria will be de-selected from the procurement process.
      The following Most Economically Advantageous Tender (MEAT) award criteria will be used to score tenders that satisfy the selection criteria:
      •	Price 20%
      •	Merit of provision design 20%
      •	Quality of plans to engage employers 20%
      •	Merit of approach to meeting the needs of participants 20%
      •	Quality of the approach to be taken to management and monitoring 20%
      
      The highest scoring tender will be the winning tender. Only information supplied by tenderers in response to the questions will be taken into account during the scoring process.  Please note that additional information may be requested as part of our due diligence procedures. 
       Brighter Futures (https://www.business2businesslimited.com/brighterfutures) is a community-based project, which provides a wide range of learning and employment support interventions to support the holistic social inclusion of unemployed and economically inactive people aged 16+ within Leicester and Leicestershire. Delivered through a partnership of local organisations, the project is funded by the European Social Fund and the National Lottery, through the Big Lottery Fund. 
      The project began in December 2017 and was due to end in June 2020. However, a project extension granted by the Big Lottery and Leicester and Leicestershire LEP will enable the project to continue to meet the ongoing demand and need for support from local residents.
      This procurement of Supported Employment provision will be funded through the project's Community Provision Budget which was established to enable the procurement of supplementary support to meet participants' additional needs.

title: RBC - ELECTRICAL REPAIRS &  REWIRES CONTRACT 2020-2023
description:
The Council is seeking to appoint a Contractor for the Electrical Repairs and rewiring to all types of properties operated by Reading Borough Council (RBC). 
      
      The Form of Contract is the JCT Measured Term Contract 2016. It is anticipated that the Contract will commence in April 2020 and will run for three years, with the option to extend the contract by a further 2 years to end in March 2025 (subject to agreement by both parties).
      
      The anticipated value for the works ordered using this contract is £350,000 per annum. There is no guarantee of any work and no guarantee of any level of work in any financial year.

title: Strawberry Gardens Extra Care Housing in Yatton
description:
Extra care housing is housing designed with the needs of older people in mind and with varying levels of care and support available on site.  Residents of extra care housing have their own self-contained homes, their own front doors and a legal right to occupy the property.  Extra care housing is not a care home.  There is an on-site care provider who will deliver care and support to the residents of the development with a view to enabling clients to remain as independent as possible in their own home.  The care provider is also available for any emergency calls required by the clients.

North Somerset Council is committed to offering extra care housing as an alternative to residential care for those people who can no longer manage in their current home due to their care needs.  Extra care housing should be a vibrant place to live with activities and facilities available for residents and the local community.  Although the care provider is not responsible for this, they will be expected to work closely with the housing provider to achieve this.
As part of the Bloor 2 development in Yatton, Housing 21 are building 60, two bed apartments and supporting facilities together with external landscaping and parking areas. North Somerset Council will have nominations to 30 of the 60 apartments. The other 30 will be available for shared ownership. 

The council is responsible for commissioning a care provider to work within the extra care housing development. The residents that will be nominated to the council nominated apartments will meet the following eligibility criteria. 
Applicants must:
•	be 55 or over;
•	be eligible to receive care from North Somerset Council;
•	be eligible for North Somerset Council funding;
•	have a current application for housing via North Somerset Council's Home Choice Development;
•	be resident in North Somerset.
People with exceptional circumstances may be considered on a case by case basis.

Shared ownership residents may or may not have care and support needs. If they do, they will be encouraged to use the onsite care provider to meet these needs. If the resident of a shared ownership apartment is eligible for council funding, their care and support will fall under this contract.

It is anticipated that there will be approximately 375 hours per week care provision and 15 hours per week housing related support to council nominated apartments. The council will only fund actual planned care provided and 15 hours per week housing related support. Planned care could be at any time within 24 hours i.e. during the day and overnight. 

24-hour emergency cover for the whole development will be funded via a weekly payment of £23, made by every apartment in the development, directly to the care Provider. 24-hour emergency cover is one member of staff to attend emergencies and unforeseen fluctuations in someone's care needs between the hours of 10pm and 7am and potentially between 2pm and 5pm.

title: Health and safety training services
description:
To obtain the tender documents and respond, please follow the link to ProContract. Do not contact the buyer directly.Tenders are invited from suppliers to be appointed to a framework of ten suppliers enabling the delivery of health and safety training services to the following Customers in the Group:

•	EMH Group (East Midlands Housing Group)
•	EMH Homes (EMH Housing and Regeneration)
•	EMH Care & Support
•	EMH Sharpes (Sharpes Gardening Services)
•	Midlands Rural Housing and Village Development

A framework is a looser type of contractual agreement, where suppliers have agreed to parent terms and conditions, in order for them to be contracted with directly for any services described by the framework throughout it's life, in this case any health and safety training and related services. Appointment to the framework does not guarantee suppliers with any volume of services to be awarded; this will be dependant on the supplier's response to any individual quotation request (further competition) or direct award of contract subsequently made by the Customer.

title: Moving Forward - AWARD
description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `Suffolk Adult and Community Learning Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2019/S 068-159908:
      
      CD1281j MOVING FORWARD.  Note: The contract will be awarded for the value of £45,000.  
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is TUESDAY 18TH FEBRUARY 2020 AT 12 NOON.  Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.
      
      The deadline for clarification questions is FRIDAY 14TH FEBRUARY 2020 AT 12 NOON which must be generated via the correspondence tab within this project.

title: Contract for Referral and Website System
GB-London: 101886 Review of the Information Commissioners Office and it's structures
description: The Data Protection Act 2018 changed the role, responsibilities and powers of the ICO, which the ICO has been implementing over the last two years. Under this Act, DCMS remains the sponsoring department of the ICO. As part of fulfilling its sponsorship role, DCMS wants to take stock of how the ICO is operating within its relatively new legislative regime.

title: Children in Care Independent Visitor Service
description: Bristol City Council wishes to appoint a provider for the provision of an Independent Visitor Service for Children in Care. The service will recruit, train and support appropriate adult volunteers to act as Independent Visitors for children and young people looked after by the Authority. The role of an Independent Visitor is to befriend and advise these children and contribute towards their social, emotional and educational development.

title: Sheerness Street Furniture Repainting
description:
Swale Borough Council is seeking a contractor to deliver a public realm improvement scheme in Sheerness town centre. The contractor will be required to carry out refurbishment and repainting of street furniture within a defined area. The work should be carried out in accordance with detailed specifications and the contractor will be responsible for establishing and working within the parameters and traffic management requirements appropriate for the sites. All work is required to be completed by end of June 2020.
The contract will commence on Wednesday, 01 April 2020 and terminate on Tuesday, 30 June 2020.  The Council may extend this opportunity for a further one month.  The tenderer/s who submit the Most Economically Advantageous Tender, (MEAT) will be awarded the contract.
Expressions of Interest and Invitation to Tender (I.T.T.) must be submitted / uploaded on the Council's e-tendering portal.
The closing date for submission of Expressions of Interest and the closing date for the I.T.T. is 25/03/2020 at 12:00 noon.

title: Cleaning Services - Corporate Buildings Boroughwide
description: Cleaning services for LB Bexley corporate buildings. The services are currently provided under a total facilities management contract with one provider which will expire on 31st August 2020. There are currently 25 properties in scope including Bexley Civic Office, Libraries, Children and Community Centers. The number of properties in scope is likely to increase following review of the full estate. Services to include; cleaning, janitorial services, window cleaning, specialised conservation clean and a range of reactive and planned ad hoc services.

title: The Supply of Staplers, Staples, Perforators and Desk Top Plastics Framework
description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for The Supply of Staplers, Staples, Perforators and Desk Top Plastics. 
      
      The Framework will commence on 01 May 2020 and will be for a period of 4 years.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14:00 hrs on Wednesday 25th March 2020.

title: Invitation To Quote - The provision of Tennis coaching activities in the Abbey Gardens Bury St Edmunds  - AWARD
description:
This opportunity is available in the `Current Tenders`area of www.suffolksourcing.uk. 
      
      Interested parties are invited to express their interest in order to gain full access to the tender documentation
      
      
      The Council are wanting to appoint an established tennis coaching business to provide high-quality tennis coaching sessions on our two new tennis courts in Abbey Gardens. At the current time we are envisaging that the coaching sessions will take place on a Saturday morning between 8.00am and 1.00pm and will be offered to children of all ages.

title: DUD - BCI - CCTV for the Security Industry
description:
This Closed Circuit Television programme has been designed for participants who have already successfully completed an SIA course and hold the required certificate/badge. The successful completion of this programme will provide them with the qualifications required to work in the Security industry.
      
      The Service provider must deliver a structured course that will prepare participants for the CCTV Operative exam, so that they have a reasonable opportunity of successfully completing and gaining the CCTV operatives licence.
      
      Training should take place over 4 days from 9am - 5:30pm and should cover amongst other topics:
      o Roles and responsibilities of CCTV operatives
      o Codes of Practice
      o Use of CCTV equipment
      o Health and safety
      
      A written plan should provide to participants to support their understanding of what is required from them during an intervention. 
      
      The Service provider to guarantee interviews for live opportunities within the sector. Feedback to be provided by the interviewer to the participant.
      
      The Service provider should support participants to apply for CCTV Certificate/Badge.
      
      Travel and lunch costs should be provided for the those assigned places at the Service Providers designated place of delivery. In addition, travel costs to work placements and or interviews should be included where appropriate.

title: Home Suuport Assistant - R3
description:
Home Support Assistant x15
      Working Hours: - 20 Hours Per Week, see attached sample rota
      Pay Rate: Band C, £9.74 Per Hour PAYE, 
      Start date: ASAP for 4 months
      Contract type: Agency
      Location: - Various locations across they borough of Sandwell.
      Job Description and Personnel Specification are attached, which also provides more information above the role.
      As a Home Support Worker, you will be required to work with people in their own home, providing a range of care and support that maximises independence. This may include assisting people with their personal care, helping them to prepare meals and snacks and helping to rebuild their confidence.
      We aim to get people out of hospital as soon as they are medically fit and work with people to prevent further admissions.
      20-hour posts available, which include a continental shift pattern that includes mornings and evenings and you should be able to travel across the borough and will therefore need to hold a full valid driving licence, have access to a car and must have business class insurance.
      
      This role requires an Enhanced Barring DBS check for Adults, also the candidates must hold a certificate in moving and handling. 
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement opportunity, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the related documents.
      To submit your documents, you will be required to opt in.
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system, please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Monday 23 March 2020 at 3.00pm noon

title: GB-London: International activity of arts and cultural organisations
description:
NOTE: This notice was updated on 18 March 2020 for the following reason: IMPORTANT: The contracting opportunity has been withdrawn. 
      
      The Arts Council of England may advertise the opportunity in the future.(A key ambition of the Arts Council's new strategy for 2020-30, Let's Create, is to help develop a cultural sector which is world-leading, outward-looking and globally connected. This was already an important part of the Arts Council's work - between 2015 and 2018 £18 million was invested in this area through programmes such as Artists' International Development Fund (AIDF) and the International Showcasing fund - and it will continue to play a prominent role over the next ten years.
      
      In particular, it is crucial to demonstrate England's status as a world centre for cultural excellence, ensuring that more artists, arts organisations and museums based in England are exporting work internationally and that visitors cite the arts and culture as the reason they visited England. The Arts Council also aims to support cultural exchange, so that the best of international arts and culture is being enjoyed regularly by the public in this country and the best of our arts and culture finds new audiences overseas. The role that arts, culture and the creative industries can have in facilitating investment, creating new markets and providing influence is already well-documented, while it will also be important to understand what impact the Future Relationship to the EU will have on international working.
      
      In 2015 Trends Business Research (TBR) were commissioned to conduct a piece of research to help the Arts Council understand the scale and impact of the international activity of its National Portfolio Organisations (NPOs). Bigger, more established NPOs have major programmes of international activity, often focused on particular markets or geographies, but it is also crucial to understand if small- and medium-sized NPOs are working internationally. The research found that 65% of NPOs surveyed had undertaken international work in the previous three years and that experience, placing their work in a global context and showcasing opportunities were the strongest motivators for undertaking this work. Conversely, the generation of additional income was not considered as important a motivating factor but was frequently cited; suggesting that, while it is rarely the main reason for undertaking international work,  it can be an important pre-condition or consideration.
      
      The intention of this new piece of research is to develop this same level of understanding among the most recent cohort of NPOs, receiving funding between 2018 and 2022, and establish a study which can be repeated over the course of the lifecycle of Let's Create.)

Bigger, more established NPOs have major programmes of international activity, often focused on particular markets or geographies, but it is also crucial to understand if small- and medium-sized NPOs are working internationally. The research found that 65% of NPOs surveyed had undertaken international work in the previous three years and that experience, placing their work in a global context and showcasing opportunities were the strongest motivators for undertaking this work. Conversely, the generation of additional income was not considered as important a motivating factor but was frequently cited; suggesting that, while it is rarely the main reason for undertaking international work,  it can be an important pre-condition or consideration.
      
      The intention of this new piece of research is to develop this same level of understanding among the most recent cohort of NPOs, receiving funding between 2018 and 2022, and establish a study which can be repeated over the course of the lifecycle of Let's Create.)", "supplyChain": false, "hasEnquiries": null, "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2020-04-03T00:00:00Z"}, "awardCriteria": null, "submissionMethod": null, "xClassifications": {"isSuitableForSme": true, "isSuitableForVco": false, "ojeuContractType": "Services"}, "procurementMethod": null, "eligibilityCriteria": null, "awardCriteriaDetails": null, "submissionMethodDetails": "Please apply directly to the buyer using the contact details provided, or follow the instructions given in the notice description or information section.", "procurementMethodDetails": "Open procedure", "procurementMethodRationale": ""}, "language": "en-GB", "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "publishedDate": "2020-05-12T01:34:35.589916+00:00"}

title: Business Rates Forecasting - AWARD
description:
Business Rates Forecasting
      
      Business Rates localisation presents a variety of challenges for local authorities in relation to the calculation and forecasting of the various elements of the business rates retention scheme.  As an authority participating in the rates retention pilot scheme in Sandwell we currently retain 100% of the income generated through Business Rates.  
      
      It is crucial that we are able to manage our rating list effectively, forecast changes which may affect net collectable debit and maximise growth through the early identification of commercial properties in the area.
      
      Rates avoidance is a serious concern especially in the current climate and it is important that efforts are made to validate reductions applied as much as possible.  In Sandwell large numbers of hereditaments receive Small Business Rates Relief but this will no longer apply if a company/organisation has more than one business in the same name.  
      
      Sandwell MBC therefore require a company who can provide:
      o Revenues Forecasting
      o RV Finder
      o Small Business Rates Relief Audit
      
      The contract duration is for 4 years from 14 April 2020 - 13 April 2024.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to the ITT and other related documents.
      
      In Order To View the documents and Submit a Tender, you will be required to` Opt-In`.   
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810.
      
      Closing date: Tuesday 18 February 2020 at 12:00 noon.

title: Canterbury Park & Ride Bus Service - Zero Emission Fleet to start within one year of contract start date
description:
Canterbury City Council ("the Council") wishes to select and appoint a suitable supplier for the provision of a Park and Ride Bus Service and invites tenderers to submit a tender to meet the Council's requirements.                                                                          
The Services have been divided into the following service packages (Lots):
Lot 1 Zero Emission within the first anniversary of the Commencement Date - Electric Vehicles 
Lot 2 Zero Emission within  the first anniversary of the Commencement Date - Hydrogen Vehicles                                                          
note fleet vehicles may be any fuel type until delivery of the specific fuel type as described within each Lot, which must be within the anniversary date of the contract start.                                                                                                                                                            
The Contract is anticipated to commence 5 October 2020 and will continue for a period of 7 years (unless terminated early in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Contract), and may be extended for a period of up to 1 year subject to the satisfactory performance of the Services by the Contractor and at the Council's entire discretion

title: Services for People Who Are Blind or Have a Visual Impairment
description:
The London Borough of Bromley ('the Council') is inviting tenders through the London Tenders Portal, (www.londontenders.org) for the provision of Services for People Who Are Blind or Have a Visual Impairment. To achieve this the Council seeks to work in partnership with a Contractor which has proven and recognised expertise of working with visually impaired people and their families / carers.

The Council believes that people with visual impairment are individual citizens with equal rights and responsibilities who are entitled to be treated with dignity and respect. Each person has a right to a lifestyle which maintains and promotes their independence, provides opportunities to participate in and contribute to society and meets their social, cultural and religious needs.

title: Consultancy Services to Supply Examiners to Undertake Examination Work on Neighbourhood Plans
description: Guildford Borough Council has several designated neighbourhood areas within its administrative boundary where neighbourhood plans have either been adopted or are in the stage of preparation. It also has a number of additional parishes for which it anticipates receiving draft neighbourhood plan proposals in the near future.  Neighbourhood plans are produced for neighbourhood areas by parish or town councils or, in areas without a parish, by forums of residents and businesses, in consultation with their local communities.  After a neighbourhood plan has passed an examination and referendum of local residents it must be adopted (or "made") by the Borough Council as part of its statutory development plan and its policies must be used by planning officers and the Council's to help determine planning applications in that neighbourhood area. Neighbourhood plans therefore allow communities considerable influence over development in their own areas.  The Council is seeking tenders from suitably qualified and experienced external organisations for a framework contract with the Council for a maximum term of four years to provide examiners to undertake examination work on neighbourhood plans.

title: Tower Block Surveys - Consultancy Service
description:
Thanet District Council is seeking to select and appoint a suitably qualified consultant to carry out extensive surveys on Thanet Tower Blocks at Staner Court, Invicta House, Kennedy House, Trove Court and Harbour Towers. Early mobilisation/commencement of works is essential following contract award to the successful consultant. Works are anticipated to commence in June 2020.  
                          
The procurement process will be undertaken on the basis of an open tender. 

Evaluation will be on the basis of criteria and methodology as set out in the Invitation to Tender document. 

The form of contract will be TDC Consultancy Service agreement  .   
                                                                                                                                                                                     IMPORTANT INFORMATION: Suppliers should in first instance register themselves on the Kent Business Portal www.kentbusinessportal.org.uk by following registration instructions. All procurement documents are available via the Kent Business Portal (kentbusinessportal.org.uk) attached to the Contract Notice and available for suppliers to download and complete according to instructions contained.                                                                                                                                                                               Any clarifications or questions must be submitted via the discussions area of the Kent Business Portal by no later than 14.00 hrs 9th April  2020

Completed tender documents must be submitted electronically via the Kent Business Portal by no later than 14.00 hrs 15th April 2020

title: Recycling of Wood Waste
description:
The Council has a statutory duty to collect and arrange for the receipt and disposal of household waste and other waste arising within Bath and North East Somerset.  This includes Wood Waste taken to its Recycling Centres and Transfer Stations.
The Council is seeking to award a Contract for the Recycling of Wood Waste collected at its three Recycling Centres and one Transfer Station.   
The Contract will commence on 1st June 2020 and continue for an Initial Term of 2 years with an option for the Council to extend the Contract for up to a further 1 year. This Specification details the Services to be provided by the Contractor.

title: Bus Timetabling and Publicity ICT system
description:
Across the borough there is over 2,278 bus stops, of which 1,593 locations have public transport information displayed.  Real Time Passenger Information is provided at Chester Bus Interchange and on-street in Forgeate Street, Chester Railway station and very soon in Northwich. The Council is committed to ensuring that Public Transport is more attractive and is easier to use in the future. Getting people to the right place at the right time is essential to the smooth operation of any transport network. 

2.2	What we are buying and why
A bus timetabling and publicity ICT solution.
2.3 What we require: the solution
The Strategic Transport team is customer focused and committed to delivering an excellent service to its residents in the provision of public transport information across the borough. This is successfully achieved through maintaining roadside information at bus stops, producing timetables leaflets and travel information for bus stations, alongside providing regular updates to Traveline.  The system must be intuitive and flexible to ensure the efficient delivery of public transport at a local or national. 

The Council has embraced a cloud-first approach as part of its IT strategy and prefer where possible, the sourcing of solutions that will be offered to the customer as Software as a Service (SaaS).
buyer: Cheshire west and Chester Borough Council

title: HEY/19/227/SM SUPPLY OF LIGHTNING PROTECTION
description:
The requirement of lightning protection works to be carried out at 3 sites, 1 visit to each site, to be conducted at 11 month intervals for the length of the contract; year 1 December, year 2 November, Year 3 October, etc.

Site addresses:-

Site 1:- Hull Royal Infirmary, Anlaby Road, Hull, East Yorkshire HU3 2JZ

Site 2:- Castle Hill Hospital, Castle Road, Cottingham, East Yorkshire HU16 5JQ

Site 3:- Sterile Services, Unit 3-5 Harrow Street, Hull, East Yorkshire HU3 4BL

The requirement must include 1 annual inspection of all lightening protection systems, located at the 3 sites as follows:-

Engineers must report to site and receive any site specific safety information and permit to work.  Engineers must don all appropriate personal protective equipment; this must be provided by the supplier.  Engineers must cordon off the area and display danger signs whilst work is carried out.  

The inspection must be carried out in accordance with BS EN 62305 and BS6651 standards.  Engineers must carry out a visual inspection of the lightning protection systems, recording all installation details. Engineers must carry out an earth resistance test to each installation and record the reading(s) obtained. In addition to this engineers must also carry out a combined earth resistance test to the whole system recording the readings obtained.  Engineers must clear down the site upon completion, leaving areas clean and tidy. 

Engineers must provide 1 test certificate for each asset.  Engineers must also provide a written report of any defects found complete with photographic images. Any defects found by the Engineers, a written quotation to rectify these defects to current BS standards must be provided and sent by the supplier directly to the Estate Manager. All reports and test certificates must be passed onto the Estates Manager within two weeks of the site visit/inspection.
buyer: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust
streetaddress: Supplies Building, Hull Royal Infirmary Anlaby Road

title: HS2 Euston Station - Heritage removal
description:
Mace Dragados JV requires an experience heritage specialist subcontractor to provide and deliver their services in relation to the HS2 project.
      The scope of works will include (but are not limited to):
      -	Support and liaison (when required) with local authorities and planning services to grant permission for changing or influencing change to the historic environment.
      -	Attendance to meetings with HS2, stakeholders, regulators or local authorities. (i.e Historic England)
      -	Advice MDJV on the protection measures that could be implemented for each of heritage assets impacted by the works.
      -	Implementation of protection works for non-heritage and listed assets.
      -	Removal, when protection measures are not adequate, of non-designated heritage and listed assets.
      -	Storage and maintenance of the removed assets on the required conditions related to their nature.
      -	Reinstatement/relocation of removed assets as per HS2 and local authorities requirements.
      -	Make recommendations to MDJV in relation to the heritage impact due to the HS2 works.
      
      It is essential that the subcontractor/provider has demonstrable previous experience on large scale complex UK infrastructure projects (e.g. Network Rail, London Underground, Crossrail, Tideway).
       
       If successful, selected Applicants will be required to go through Mace Dragados pre-qualification.  
       Mace Dragados have been appointed as the Construction Partner to build a fully-integrated HS2 station at London Euston, together with links to the existing London Underground station.
      
      HS2 Phase One includes construction of a new railway line run from London Euston to new stations at Old Oak Common in West London, an Interchange Station near Birmingham Airport and the National Exhibition Centre (NEC) and a terminus station in Birmingham City Centre (Curzon Street)

title: Silvertown Tunnel - Riverlinx CJV: Survey Control Network
description:
The scope of works is for the installation of a Survey Control Network for the construction of the Silvertown Tunnel Project. 
      
      The control network is to be installed at the locations shown in the attached picture. 
       
       Expressions of interest are invited for the above opportunity. At this stage interested parties are asked only to complete the prequalification questions included herein; further details will follow thereafter for shortlisted companies.
      
      We are not accepting telephone enquiries at this time. 
       The Silvertown Tunnel scheme (STT) will link East and West London from the North Greenwich area to the Royal Victoria Dock Area and will serve to reduce the current congestion at the Blackwall Tunnel. This involves construction of a 1.4km long, twin-bore road tunnel, accommodating large vehicles including double-deck buses. It will include a dedicated bus, coach and goods vehicle lane, enabling TfL to provide additional cross-river bus routes. 25yr contract consisting of a 5yr design and construction phase, followed by a 20yr O&M phase (from Permit-to-use date).
buyer: Ferrovial Agroman UK, BAM Nuttall & SK Engineering & Construction Co. Joint Venture (RiverLinx CJV)

title: Disabled Facilities Grant (DFG) Framework
description:
The Disabled Facilities Grant is a mandatory Government grant, administered by local Council; funds a range of works that will help a disabled person remain in their home. ENGIE's DFG Technical Team on behalf of North East Lincolnshire Council is seeking suitably qualified contractors for their new Disabled Facilities Grant Framework. 

The framework delivers the Authority's Disabled Facilities Grants, which provides essential adaptations to give disabled persons better freedom of movement around the house, emergency grants to owner occupiers unable to finance emergency repairs and Home Appreciation Loans to eligible owner occupiers to allow them to bring the property up to a Decent Homes Standard. 

The Disabled Facilities Grant allows for:

• Adaptations of bathrooms for people who are unable to use a conventional shower or bath. 
• Home improvement works including damp proofing, electrical works, plumbing and heating works, minor adaptations to kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, repair/renew/alter windows, doors and roof.
• Major adaptations works including property extensions, complex cases where major adaptions are made internally to a property to meet the client's needs. 
• Ramps; permanent and temporary ramps to allow access into and out of the home. 

The framework will provide a mechanism for these works to be carried. The number of contractors the Authority is seeking is will be determined by the number of successful tenderers.

ENGIE's procurement team will be holding a drop in session for Contractors wanting more information or needing assistance with YORtender. Contractrors can attend a drop in session on Monday 03 February 2020 from 10am - 4pm at New Oxford House, 2 George Street, Grimsby DN31 1HB.

works that will help a disabled person remain in their home. ENGIE's DFG Technical Team on behalf of North East Lincolnshire Council is seeking suitably qualified contractors for their new Disabled Facilities Grant Framework. 

The framework delivers the Authority's Disabled Facilities Grants, which provides essential adaptations to give disabled persons better freedom of movement around the house, emergency grants to owner occupiers unable to finance emergency repairs and Home Appreciation Loans to eligible owner occupiers to allow them to bring the property up to a Decent Homes Standard. 

The Disabled Facilities Grant allows for:

• Adaptations of bathrooms for people who are unable to use a conventional shower or bath. 
• Home improvement works including damp proofing, electrical works, plumbing and heating works, minor adaptations to kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, repair/renew/alter windows, doors and roof.
• Major adaptations works including property extensions, complex cases where major adaptions are made internally to a property to meet the client's needs. 
• Ramps; permanent and temporary ramps to allow access into and out of the home. 

The framework will provide a mechanism for these works to be carried. The number of contractors the Authority is seeking is will be determined by the number of successful tenderers.

ENGIE's procurement team will be holding a drop in session for Contractors wanting more information or needing assistance with YORtender. title: GB-London: Film Production Services For Insight Investment Astronomy Photographer of the Year at the National Maritime Museum
description:
Royal Museums Greenwich (RMG) is seeking film production companies for an annual exhibition at the National Maritime Museum (NMM).
      
      NMM is part of RMG which has four sites - the Royal Observatory (ROG), Cutty Sark (CS) and the Queen's House (QH). These world-class attractions sit at the heart of maritime Greenwich, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
      
      RMG attracts over 2.5 million visitors each year and is one of London's top 10 visitor attractions - the place to discover sea and space exploration, pioneering architecture, art and royal history.
      
      In 2018 the National Maritime Museum opened the Photography Gallery. This temporary exhibition space of 265sqm houses the Insight Investment Astronomy Photographer of the Year (IIAPY) exhibition.
      
      Exhibition background:
      
      IIAPY is the world's largest astrophotography competition of its kind. Every year we ask photographers from around the world to send in their best images of celestial spectacles. 100 of the best shortlisted and winning images are displayed in our annual exhibition at the NMM. Each IIAPY exhibition is open September - April.
      
      Scope of services:
      
      We are seeking experienced film production companies to create three talking heads films of winning entrants for our forthcoming annual IIAPY exhibition and six social media edits. We are looking to create a framework agreement with a number of suppliers (number unknown) for a three-year contract 2020-23, with the possibility of extension subject to supplier performance. 
      
      The films will introduce visitors to the human story behind the photos and showcase their skills, experience and interests. Social media edits will grab audience attention online to promote the exhibition and competition.
      
      It is essential that the contractors have a proven track record of: 
      
      Relevant experience: experience in film production for exhibitions in the museum sector, in at least three contracts within the last three years, that have been successfully and substantially completed and that are similar to the proposed works.
      
      Capacity: the Tenderer is required to demonstrate that it has adequate resources and capacity net of current commitments (including receipt of letters intendent) and works in progress to ensure it can satisfactorily perform the contract that is the subject of this tender. The tenderer must commit to being available May-August each year should they be selected for the framework agreement.
      
      We recognise that the films may be harder to produce this year and welcome creative proposals around travel and social distancing limitations.
